Review_Date: Alex R wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: We stayed at The Palace over the festive period and we cannot compliment and recommend it highly enough. The driveway into the property gives you an expectancy of grandeur we were not disappointed. The lobby is spectacular and welcoming. The check in was efficient and painless just what was needed after a long day travelling.  Our room was Moroccan spacious clean with spectacular views over the pools gardens and the snow capped Atlas Mountains. The bathroom was spacious and clean with double sinks‚Ä¶large bath‚Ä¶separate toilet cubicle‚Ä¶separate shower cubicle.  The breakfast restaurant was large with both inside and outside seating. Any requests or questions were dealt with professionally confidently efficiently and always with a smile. Review_Text: We stayed at the Es Saadi Palace. This is a really stunning hotel set in beautiful grounds and with high quality service and spa.    We booked a ksar; eight traditional self-contained two-storey houses in the grounds of the hotel. They have lovely Moroccan decor plenty of space with two double / twin bedrooms both with en-suits fridges and tv's private terraces can be accessed off both bedrooms large enough to dine and sunbath on and a good sized living room and a wonderful butler service. I can't recommend them enough.    We were travelling as a family of four with two children aged 9 and 6. The ksars are perfect for families and the hotel had lots going for it for children including fabulous pools and also a good kids club (in the neighbouring Es Saadi Hotel). Breakfast is great on the terrace overlookign the pools. However be aware that children are not allowed in either of the restaurants in the Es Saadi Palace. Children can eat in one of the restaurants in the neighbouring Es Saadi Hotel but it felt a bit too formal for our kids. We made it work through a combination of room service on our terrace eating at the pool bar at the Es Saadi Hotel (which serves until 6pm) and also eating at local restaurants of which there are a variety at a range of price points within a short walk. You can also walk into the medina within 20-25 mins (or take a short taxi ride) so it's a great location to be on this side of the Hivernage new town area.

We stayed for three nights at the hotel and had a lovely experience. The hotel provided an excellent customer service throughout our stay. The two ladies at the reception Lubna and Maryam helped made our stay more comfortable by facilitating us with late checkout and providing a birthday celebration for my wife in the room with a cake. It was very kind of him to do this and make our stay more memorable.

Review_Date: Joanne R wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Overall, relaxing and peaceful - but there is room for improvement in some areas
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the Es Saadi Palace for 11-nights from 1st May 2022. We had a room on the 3rd floor overlooking the gardens.    The things we liked about the Palace are as follows:  * Free airport transfers were included in our package with a quality vehicle and a helpful driver.  * The hotel was calm and peaceful inside and outside.  * The location is good - about a 20-minute walk to the Koutoubia Mosque and Jemaa el Fnaa Square and about a 12-minute walk to Churchill's favoured Mamounia Hotel and the Menara Mall where the Carrefour sells wine and a whole host of other food products.  * Although we only had the standard room (a Junior Suite) it was large and comfortable with a 6ft bed fridge kettle (but bring you own tea and instant coffee unless you are happy using the expresso machine in the room) separate sitting area a balcony adequate air con a safe plenty of storage (in fact a separate dressing room) and a large bathroom with a corner bath 2 wash basins a separate shower and a separate toilet and bidet.  * The gardens are beautiful and the gardeners work hard to maintain them. It is worth trying to get into the gardens around 07:30 - 08:00 just to enjoy the peace and quiet before other guests arrive to sit around the pool.  * The public areas inside the hotel are faultlessly clean and well maintained.  * Breakfast is good albeit sometimes food runs out towards closing time (10:30 and 11:00 at weekends) and the service can be a bit "hit and miss" - we were lucky to be spotted and served coffee most mornings by waiter Hamid who never seemed to stop working and is an fine example of what consistent and good service looks like.  * There is a regular and efficient turn-down service around 18:30-19:00 when towels are replaced if necessary and bottled water is also replaced in the room.  * Although the next-door Casino is open until 05:00 in the morning and is busy throughout the night there is absolutely no disturbance for guests in rooms situated at the back of the building overlooking the gardens and pools.    The key things we did not like about the Palace are as follows:  * The balcony in our room was NOT swept daily by housekeeping and bird droppings sat there for days.  * The pool area / seating require daily or twice daily washing and wiping down to remove previous-day guest debris and bird droppings. This area was NOT well maintained or cleaned overnight / early morning when we stayed at the Palace and quite often I had to wipe down the sun lounger cushions and clear paper & plastic bottles from the previous days before I could comfortably sit down. There was little or no assistance from staff.  * The driveway to the Palace was littered in several places with bird droppings which stayed there throughout our stay - a bad impression on arrival / departure from the Palace.  * The cost of eating at the Palace is disproportionately high in all venues. Around the Pool Bar a burger is about ¬£25 a Club sandwich about ¬£24 cocktails about ¬£13 and a glass of local wine about ¬£10. In the 2 restaurants (Italian 'Othello' and Moroccan 'La Cour des Lions') prices are approx. double to what you would pay in a good restaurant in the city. In several occasions we would have liked to have eaten and / or have had a drink at the Palace but were put off by the prices.  * The Palace does not have a list of preferred taxi drivers - unless you pay for a private vehicle you have to go outside the gates and haggle yourself with local taxi drivers in yellow cabs who tend to make up the prices at whim and often have trouble finding your desired venue as they have no maps or navigators. It can be a nightmare getting an honest and reliable cab driver who doesn't overcharge and who takes you to where you want to go. You have to 'brace yourself' and be prepared to barter on the price (normally around 50MAD / ¬£5 for anywhere within a 2 / 3 mile radius of the Palace).

Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights to relax after some busy days of travel excursions.    Room: we had a junior suite in the palace. The room was impeccable! Very spacious and cosy. The bed was big and the sheets were very good. We enjoyed the big balcony. The bathroom was amazing. Overall incredible room.    Service: The level of service was not always on point for an expensive resort like this. We have stayed at resorts in other parts in the world for the same price were they almost never made errors or lacked in service.    We had a waiter forgetting an order at breakfast we had a disappointing experience in the restaurant in es saadi hotel. Breakfast buffet was sometimes empty because someone from the villas had ordered the last pieces of fruit in the bowl. Eggs were just laying there with no info or boiler nearby so you expect them to be boiled eggs which they were not.  All in all these are small things but i don't expect these things to happen in a resort like this with higher standards.    Pool bar: The pool bar drinks and snacks were average which is again disappointing for the price you pay. They also charged us double for two milkshakes which we dit not notice at the time but saw when we already paid for our bill...    In room dining: we had in room dining one evening and the food was very good! Service for in room dining was also a lot better.    Location: You can go on foot to neary restaurants and gardens or even the mall but its not nearby any other touristic spots. We expected this so this is not a big issue. Just keep this in mind if you want to visit the center of the medina during your stay here.    Amenities: the spa is wonderfull but not as big as we expected. There are some sauna rooms but one of them did not work. The tree in the main pool area is very beautifull and i recommend coming here in the evening when the lights turn on.  The outside pool is big and there is a lot of space around the pool. The usual rules apply for taking spots: they put their key of towel on the beds.    Overall: We won't come back here any time soon. We felt like this was not worth the money we paid.

Review_Title: The Place to stay in Marrakech

I will definitely return to the resort ifI go back to Marrakech. I highly recommend the resort. Pool was breathtaking and spa phenomenal. Breakfast was included and was delicious.

Review_Date: Faye K wrote a review Jul 2021

Review_Date: Philippe I wrote a review Dec 2020

Review_Title: Gorgeous hotel - 5* luxury in every way!

Thank you Es Saadi - see you in February 2021!

Review_Date: Maksimova E wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Amazing experience at Es Saadi palace
Review_Text: We stayed at the Palace. Everything is beautifully made flowers are everywhere. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast which is included in the price was the best I‚Äôve ever had various choice. Peaceful environment trees are everywhere huge territory. Spa experience was great but very expensive and overpriced but spa facilities at the palace are exceeded my expectations 7 different Hammams indoor swimming pool free tea and snacks..! It is the best choice for 2-3 days of total relaxation and injection of the sun!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great hotel from the off welcomed with Moroccon tea and a personal welcome to the hotel and its amenities the hotel strikes you as you walked through the door with a beautifully ornate grand entrance our room was not ready when arrived ( we were early so no issue) they let us get changed in the spa  don a couple of robes and we were straight in the Spa for an hour  it was great peaceful warm relaxing and the various steam rooms and saunas especially the herbal ones felt great for the body. The place is clean and all day everyday people were cleaning  polishing  wiping down  this maybe as a result of the current global virus issue but the hotel is immaculate if I were to make one suggestion here I would have the glass to the Spa cleaned from the outside regularly as nature resides a lot in the trees!!! We went to our room which was very large and comfortable and wonderfully Moroccan in style  clean and well presented with a great view over the expansive pools.breakfast was wide and varied and very good shame a couple of birds manage to sneak in the morning to steal from the nuts and dried fruit stand. Be wary the birds know exactly what they are doing and if you leave your room window open they will come inside and nick your food. Pool area is calm and relaxing and they are many spots to either stay in the crowd or away from it which for us is great as we don‚Äôt have kids one pool is heated 27 degrees and the other natural 17 degrees during spring the later not being for the faint hearted it feels very cold I am sure it‚Äôs great in the summer restaurants are varied and great and the food is also of great quality which I guess is reflected in the London restaurant prices ( (average price per meal ¬£100 with a glass of wine or two). Spa treatments were nice and the ambience and area is professional and clean  a massage will cost you around ¬£150. With other treatments similarly priced. Staff were Courteous and friendly and smiley which was nice each morning and do their jobs well on the whole in summary a beautiful hotel set in wonderful grounds in a bustling city  we loved our time there and enjoyed our holiday greatly Advice be prepared to have a decent holiday spend budget to really enjoy what this hotel offers

Review_Date: Susana P wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: This is asome and gem hotel in Marrakesh  I‚Äôm very surprised of this hotel The room are huge it‚Äôs beautiful around and calming peaceful  My favorite area the spa Have everything that you need and feel in very professional hands My first Hammams was asome. Very recommend place and spa  Love it

Adding our accolades to the mountain of positive reviews for Es Saadi. From the moment we arrived we were surrounded by kindness and efficiency. Review_Title: Superb hotel - to enjoy very good time with family

Review_Date: Ravi Kumar wrote a review Feb 2020

Review_Date: Joe O wrote a review Jan 2020

Review_Date: Rashwinder B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We just spent seven nights at the Es Saadi Palace and what a fabulous stay! The staff were just amazing and couold not do enough for us to make us feel comfortable and make sure we recieved everything we asked for. We are definitely coming back!!! Highly recommended!!!

Review_Title: An experience not to be missed!
Review_Text: "Palace" is the operative word. I've never stayed in such a luxurious hotel which so very cleverly combined VIP treatment and impeccable services with a friendly family feel. We stayed for three nights and this was clearly not enough. Although the hotel is large there is so much space that a calm atmosphere reigns. The weather was fantastic and we were able to take advantage of the choice swimming pools and wander around the wonderful grounds. The spa offered the most fantastic massages and we left the hotel with sadness but totally relaxed and feeling like new. We will certainly return.

Review_Date: graham F wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Have just returned from having 4 nights at this truly wonderful hotel. The quality of service offered by all of the staff we met was really exceptional  The size of the rooms and the facilities provided by the hotel are first class. The quality of the food for breakfast and lunch could not be beaten by any other 5 star hotel we have stayed at in the past. I wish all hotels would be as good as this one.  We very much look forward to going back to the hotel again in the near future.

Review_Title: Stop searching, book this hotel now.
Review_Text: Currently I'm staying in the hotel & all I can tell that Es Saadi is magic.    The main thing that Es Saadi stands out from other incredible hotels worldwide - it's the service. Hands down the best hospitality you could find. From the minute you walk-in everything is taking care of in the highest level.    I was planning to only come to SPA (which you probably know is one of the best SPA's there is in the world) but ended up booking a room and this was the best decision. Saad Head of Concierge went extra mile to make me feel like at home. He is a true gem in this hotel friendly professional & knows how to do his job very well. Also not forget to mention Khatima from the reception who quickly found me the room & escorted me upstairs.    The room is very spacious beautiful & luxurious. The bed is extremely comfortable the amenities are high quality the tub in the bathroom is perfect and the balcony had a lovely view over the pool. I am in love with the amenities & fresh roses that I found here.    It is my last night in Marrakesh & I'm already planning when I could go back - only to stay in this resort.    Thank you for everything  Laura.

Review_Date: Robert C wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We enjoyed a two night stay in this fine hotel on our recent visit to Marrakech. This is a very modern hotel with all the amenities. The staff that we interacted with were very professional and helpful. The common areas....e.g. lobby and pool area are very beautiful and clean. I especially liked the lobby bar where I enjoyed a martini or two....always accompanied with great munchies.    The breakfast buffet was outstanding....I think the best of any hotel that we stayed in during our tour of Morocco. Our room was fairly spacious with a sitting area and a nice balcony overlooking the pool area. The bed was very comfortable the bathroom was clean and had a nice shower although one oddity was the narrowness of the tub. There were some beginning signs that some things are in need of a little freshening....e.g. the carpeting in our room looked a little worn and was spotted in areas.

This really is a gem of a hotel. There are many luxurious hotels in Marrakech all of them are beautiful but what sets the Es Saadi apart from the others is the feeling of being welcomed into the family which own and run the hotel. It is decorated superbly with so many little touches which together has created the most beautiful space. It even has its own art gallery - family owned pieces on display it truly is beautiful. We met the very elegant Madame Bauchet who greeted us with such genuine warmth and her son Jean-Alexandre who now runs the hotel and has created one of the worlds best nightclubs we found him friendly engaging and welcoming. The concierge team helped us with restaurant reservations guides to the Medina and nothing was too much trouble. We were unlucky to have one of our bags go missing from the flight they couldn't help us enough in recovering luckily the next day. The room had the most beautiful four posted bed with muslin curtains so romantic. The room was huge as was the very well appointed bathroom. Some of the staff told us the hotel was at full occupancy but at no point did it feel that way there were enough staff on hand for ordering drinks or food either at the bar inside the hotel or at the pool side (there are 2 pools) that it felt they were there for servicing us alone. The hotel and its beautiful grounds have a calming peaceful atmosphere. We were lucky enough to be shown one of the several villas you can stay in which are again so beautifully decorated. All in all this was an incredible trip I honestly cannot think of anything negative about the hotel or any of its wonderful staff. I cannot wait to return. Thank you for making this trip so special

Marrakech is without doubt my most favourite city in the world. And the Es Saadi Palace is my favourite hotel in Marrakech. There is a special magic that happens at a family owed hotel. Even one at the hight of the five star catagory. And that is care! Care for the guests care for the team that work there care for the little things that the large corporate hotels take for granted. You can tell that the family that own this hotel are very proud of the hotel and what they have achieved and this is mirrored by the staff.  The service in the Es Saadi Palace is second to none. Nothing is too much trouble and the team are happy to assist with your every need. The hotel its self is very well kept and exceptionally clean. The rooms are very spacious and very comfortable. The Spa is incredible with a team to match. Forgive me for forgeting your names but the guys that run the pool bar remembered me from 4 years ago!!! amazing!  The concierge team lead by Saad are nothing less than miricle workers. Thank you guys!  Basicly if you want to stay in Marrakech stay at the Es Saadi Palace

Review_Date: Steve D wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Fantastic Hotel . Loved staying there with friends. Staff so helpful and friendly couldn‚Äôt do enough for us.  Spotlessly clean . Food excellent and leisure facilities amazing.  Will return !  Steve and Sharon

Review_Date: Derek J wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: 4 day leisure break at the Es Saadi Marrarkech Resort
Review_Text: We visited the Es Saadi Marrakech Resort in October 2019 with friends and found it to be a truly wonderful hotel in every respect. Beautiful comfy rooms and surroundings friendly staff great service and the food was fantastic too. We couldn't have been happier and would definitely recommend it to others and return again ourselves.  Derek & Susanne  London

Review_Date: Helen B wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at Es Saadi Palace this week. It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel with all the luxurious amenities. What we found disappointing though was dishonesty of their staff. We were provided misguiding information on a few occasions by their workers at the reception and sightseeing desk. The way they do it is they tell you everything you want to hear in order to sell you something or impose it on you. Then they try to charge you for their misguided information that was initially offered as a free service or less priced. The interesting thing is their reaction. They pretend that they either never provided that information or you misunderstood it ( however it‚Äôs not the case because you would clarify it a few times). So be careful with everything you are told and if possible record the conversations when it comes to payments of significant amounts. Otherwise you might find the bill for something you never used or planned to pay for or buy a tour that doesn‚Äôt include everything you were promised at the beginning. The worst thing is that with a smile on their faces and apologies they will make you feel and look like an idiot üòâ
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thanks to all el saadi resort staff. It was a wonderful three nights. The supreme cleanliness of the rooms and The amazing Moroccan and international food. For sure I will be visiting again soon. Morocco is the best.

Review_Date: Lushele R wrote a review Sep 2019

I was pleasantly surprised to get roses sent to my room and also a birthday cake for my birthday and the piano guy even played ‚Äúhappy birthday‚Äù for me. Review_Date: ian f wrote a review Sep 2019

The pool rooms and dining were superb. The staff are very attentive and helpful at the Palace as they are in the Hotel.  All in all a great relaxing holiday.

I was not expecting such an high level of kindness and luxury place like Ed Saadi Palace. Amazing food amazing location amazing place position is perfect  service is perfect THE CONCIERGE TEAM IS REALLY GREAT !!! I really recommend this place  my best wishes to all the team

Incredible hotel within easy reach of the medina providing an oasis of calm. Beautiful rooms from suites to private villas in a luxury setting with an amazing modern art collection. Attentive friendly staff and a lovely welcome. Plus if you want to have more entertainment the casino or live music bar and club provide locals &`tourists with an amazing night!

Review_Date: Hans d wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: The place is beautifull the staff is more then perfect.  The Villa was topclass.  So it was in total beyond our experience as up till now of our visits in the world.  So we can advise everyone to go this beautifull spot.

Review_Date: Daniel P wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Prior to visiting I was somewhat skeptical about our stay at this "Palace" but my concerns were immediately assuaged upon entering the establishment.    The resort is an opulent mix of old world charm new age convenience.  My one "must do" recommendation is to try the indoor spa pool. Lay back in the water ensure your ears are submerged and prepare for a surprise.  After experiencing this don't ruin the surprise for anyone else!    We ventured out for most of our meals but we did have breakfast and on a couple of occasions dinner. The food is authentically Moroccan and there is lots of it.  This resort is a little pricey but you deserve it. The staff are really friendly and go out of their way to help they guys who served breakfast were excellent!  At the end there was a mix up with our car to the airport and the hotel arranged a free drop off.  If you visit Morocco and you can afford a little luxury this is the place to stay.

Review_Title: Perfect stay in a beautiful luxury Hotel
Review_Text: Very good and silent location but still pretty close distance to main square / market (Jemaa El-Fna).  Large clean pool with nice green park around. Sunbeds can be well separated from other guests due to the large area.  Rooms are very nice and comfortable (we had a Junior Suite) with large and very nice Maroccain style bathroom and toilettries.  Staff is perfect and looking for our comfort and really provides the 5 star feeling not only the facilities.  SPA is also very nice ...  Overall it was fantastic 4 nights for us .... would happily come back anytime !

The welcoming of guests was pleasant. Wonderful place to stay with family very polite and helpful staff. We were looked after well. Excellent service from all staff. The restaurants served good food  Looking forward to stay here again

July 5th-8th    We came for a weekend at the beginning of July . We were greeted and taken from the airport by the Hotel driver . Only 15 min away the Es Saadi Palace is stunning. A very grand and beautiful lobby with a bar and lots of seating areas.  As we were early we were shown to the pool restaurant where we had coffee whilst waiting for our room . It was certainly worth the wait. We had booked a Deluxe Suite and we were not disappointed. It was amazing . Devided in two our suite was beautifully furnished and had a king size bed and a beautiful big bathroom and on the other side a large living area with table and chairs and a seating area with sofas . Our son was with us too and there was plenty of room for another bed in the lounge.There was also 2 dressing /luggage rooms  a kitchen area and another toilet. Our suite was overlooking the pool and gardens and had a double balcony with loungers and a table and chairs.  All staff from Reception especially Mohsine to Housekeeping Bar staff  the staff at Breakfast and the restaurant plus the guys at the pool bar were all courteous friendly and very professional.  On our first night we went to the Moroccan restaurant. Which had beautiful views overlooking the pool and gardens.  Impeccable charming service and our meal was delicious. We opted for the beef tagine and the slow cooked lamb (for 2 ).  Breakfast each morning was a delight lovely fresh food and omelettes and eggs cooked to order .  We also chose to have lunch in the restaurant each day which was also very good .  Overall we loved our stay at the Es Saadi Palace and would love to return.

Review_Date: Thabied M wrote a review Jul 2019

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo F wrote a review Jun 2019

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 3 rd time back...wonderful staff very large bedrooms and bathrooms..very clean and wonderful linens  very nice generous buffet breakfast by the pool  i much prefer this hotel than to other famous hotels in marrakech...just superbly run.

We stayed here for our last night of a week‚Äôs stay in Morocco.    Our previous 6 nights had been spent in a Riad in the M√©dina a kasbah in the mountains night under canvas and a Riad in Ait Ben Haddou. The service provided at these surpassed the Palace by far. All offered welcome drinks and staff went out of their way to be welcoming and friendly. The staff at the Palace were bordering on rude (reception) friendly (Moroccan restaurant) and at times slowwwwwww.  Our room was lovely don‚Äôt quite get the welcome of one cake when there‚Äôs 2 of you though!  Pool area and spa excellent.    Pool snacks and drinks expensive but the buffet in the Moroccan restaurant tasty and good value. Breakfast good except many of the yoghurts were ‚Äòfizzy‚Äô When finally found one which wasn‚Äôt it was delicious! Wine was competitively priced.    Wouldn‚Äôt choose to stay here again as the service was not up to the standard it should be for a five star hotel and is certainly not a good advertisement for Moroccan hospitality.

Review_Title: An amazing stay at the beautiful Es Saadi Palace
Review_Text: We had an amazing stay at the beautiful Es Saadi Palace. The villas are absolutely gorgeous and typical. The Spa was beautiful too with typical architecture. Everything corner is pretty. We definitely recommend this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christopher M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Should Not Be Your First Choice
Review_Text: The El Saadi is a large hotel adjacent to a casino and villas all part of the complex. It‚Äôs about a 20-minute walk from the main hotel to the market and souks. They have a lovely pool that is heated and spa facilities and the rooms are pretty typical of a ‚Äúluxury‚Äù hotel; however that‚Äôs where things end. Their hotel does offer some respite from the stench of the main market and the souks. They do offer a few news programs in English hair dryers and decent towels. The first room they put us in was right above the main entrance and adjacent to the road so it was very noisy. We asked to be moved to a quieter room a request they took with some umbrage; however they told us they would comply the next morning. Upon returning from an excursion to the Atlas Mountains they had indeed moved us ‚Äì two floors directly above where our original room was located where it was just as noisy. One did get the feeling that this may have been an ‚ÄúAmerican‚Äù thing though that‚Äôs the only time we felt that our entire two weeks touring in Morocco. I would not stay at the El Saadi again as there are other luxury hotels on the same street where the staff may be more friendly. Not a great experience for the money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rand K wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: I spent 5 nights at Es Saadi Palace with my partner as it was the venue for a wedding we were attending. Our suite was absolutely lovely spacious and comfortable. It also had a lovely balcony -overlooking the huge oasis-like pool- with sun loungers.    The service we received at the Palace was impeccable always provided with a smile and a genuine desire to please guests. The included breakfast was a large varied buffet with a wide selection for every taste made of high quality ingredients.    I cannot praise this place enough and would definitely go back at the first opportunity if only to have a spa-hammam weekend. Thank you Es Saadi Palace!.

When we arrived we felt being in another world - just incredible - the staff was just incredible. I have never been at such a place where the staff was so helpful so friendly - congrats!!! Really 5*****+. I strongly recommend this fantastic hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Noela M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Peaceful, serene oasis in what can be a busy, frantic, bustling Marrakech
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights following an intense Intrepid 15 days tour of Morocco which was fabulous however we were a bit tired and needed a relaxibng place to stay for a couple of nights before heading back to Australia. We certainly found it at Es Saadi Palace Resort. It was avsimply beautiful stay. Staff were lovely gardens perfection service great breakfast wonderful - all in all a great stay. The pools looked very inviting although we did not indulge. We did however spend sometime in the Spa with massages and hair treatments which were lovely. No complaints here. Free private transfer to the Airport a bonus and the driver even assisted us with our luggage from the carpark directly to the entrance of the Departure hall at the Airport with a smile even though our bags weighed a ton. Truly could not fault this esatablishment at all. Only tiny thing to comment on was the soundproofing between rooms. Many times I thought someone was knocking on the door only to find they were knocking on the next room's door. Minor inconvenience factor only though.

Review_Date: A bennett wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I enjoyed a great stay at the Palace (not to be confused with the ‚Äúhotel‚Äù) complimentary airport transfer was a great touch and the service from all staff was excellent nothing was too much trouble from advising on restaurants to changing currency. The Palace is beautiful inside and out by the pool and gardens which are well kept. Initially we booked a Riad in the old town however changed to this and so glad we did. We still gained a true Moroccan experience in a far more grand setting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Do yourself a favor, stay elsewhere
Review_Text: Not a palace more like a palace wanna be. the hotel looks very tired poor toiletries there was no water for a few hours when we moved in. What‚Äôs the most amazing is that housekeeping doesn‚Äôt even bother to knock on the door before they walk in they just walk in. Swimming pool is too cold with a lot of dirt flowing in the water and the sides of the pool are covered in bird crap which makes it gross to walk on. Breakfast options are very limited and extremely basic. There was no hair dryer and no bottle opener in the room.  On the good side they have a nice indoor pool and gym. The room is also spacious. Helpful front desk and restaurant staff.

The service here is first rate lots of attentive professional and friendly staff with a high ratio of staff to guests. Makes for a very luxurious experience.    Fabulous suite furnished in traditional style is very comfortable - familiar creature comforts make it more so - e.g. coffee machine.    Spa treatments yet to come looks very slick and am sure they will be up to the standard of the rest of the services.    Would recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Not sure what the bad reviews are about. Large cool room with sunny balcony. Good breakfast selection and you can sit outside.  Good sized pool (deep though parents) with sun beds around. Lovely gardens with some very tall trees. We had a room overlooking gardens and couldn‚Äôt hear noise when doors closed at all. Heard a bit of traffic on balcony but mainly birdsong.  Staff were helpful polite and friendly.  Brilliant location - walkable to central square of Marrakesh through Koutoubia Park easily navigable due to it having a very tall minaret. Area of hotel is far away enough from hustle and bustle to be peaceful though. Upmarket area of Marrakesh - Hivernage. Staff spoke English and French fluently.  I would recommend as it is European friendly (I.e standards I would expect) and it is so convenient and pleasant to be able to walk into the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: (for palace) Great Location, gardens, carefully crafted property, attentive staff
Review_Text: Important: The review is for Palace which is very different from the hotel itself.  (+) Location is top draw Gardens solitude SPA  (+) Rooms - Exquisitely hand crafted individually. Be warned if you are looking for flawless factory cut perfection in every piece of wood tile metal work etc. it is not the place for you. The detail/minor imperfections are the signature of the craftsman.  (+) Staff - discreet but attentive to your needs very helpful especially when my son was a bit unwell; I was sent a doctor and one of the staff offered traditional warm drink. Almost everyone at breakfast (next day) and around the hotel asked my son about his health. He felt really good with a sense of wonder how everyone knew he was not well. Mohammed at concierge was really proactive in suggesting and finding the right trips.  (+) Variety of Restaurants in the Palace Hotel and within 10min walk  (+) Overall package on offer at Palace is good.    ...Well already gave 5stars but i loved the place and can't resist sharing some constructive suggestions (not criticisms) that i normally don't bother with anywhere else. It is such a beautiful place I just want it to keep up with the best in its class; so we can enjoy for ever.  (-) The Egg station (at breakfast) - Everyone needs an egg and the queues and wait spoils the holiday feel of a relaxed bfast (unbecoming of a 5* holiday). Copy the process from a business hotel (Hilton) if you want to do it this way but then you have so much staff around go the Shangri La way.  (-) For a property of this kind with heavy French influence my expectations were sky high with food; however the creativity on the menu/dishes/taste can go a notch up. AT this price point one can go to south of France and they will blow your mind with creativity. Similar in London  (-) Check-In: The longest checkin for a hotel of this class we have ever had and two other guests said that to us too. reference again - Shangri_LA cos your property is in same class. When we stay at top end Shangri LA; the driver radios the hotel when we start from airport checkin staff is at the door of the car with the room key in hand and walks us straight to the room. My family loves that. No waiting time at all (after long journey that is heavenly). At the palace it will greatly help the experience.  (-) The guides (not hotel employees) - i heard from other guests as well. though knowledgeable but have ulterior motives i.e. showing you the shops than the sites (perhaps get commissions). The downside is you get quoted unbelievable prices with those guides :) compared to when you go to shops on your own. Best to charge a little more money and shorten the list of guides you get. Tell them only take us shopping if we request that.    I think the leaders of the hotel may benefit from a three day trip to a Shangri La in similar location. The experience you are offering is similar but small touches in food customer experience will ensure you keep the customers for ever. You have the people location buildings and very creative leadership to match. We highly recommend spending some holiday time here.

Review_Date: david a wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Enjoyed staying here staff all very helpful & efficient  Breakfast buffet good variety & gourmet restaurant serves high quality food  Facilities are excellent large clean well equipped room  The hop on hop off city tour bus -worth taking - has a stop 50mtrs from the hotel entrance just go to the left  guests have complimentary entrance to Casino that‚Äôs in the grounds. Free wi.  Hotel is set in Gardens & is about a 10 min walk to the old town medina  Highly recommend  David A

What a wonderful place to stay for a few days of luxury. The staff are welcoming polite and helpful and as you enter it certainly has a strong Moroccan palatial feel to it. An older style hotel but elegant and distinguished nonetheless.  We booked two executive suits which were adjoining. Perfect rooms well equipped serviced twice a day. Very nice pool side area with plenty of places to watch the day go by. A really very good hotel....so what would make it perfect? Really only very small things: perhaps a more varied menu available in the evenings in the restaurants. There were plenty of excellent dining options but perhaps something a little more casual with more western choices? These are provided for lunch but close in the evenings.  Apart from that minor point - excellent and we had a lovely stay. Thank you

Review_Date: Oliver F wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: I have had the pleasure of staying at this location in the Suite twice. I have stayed here the first time with my immediate family then invited my in-law to come and stay as well. Coming from Asia she had no concept of Africa in general and after a few nights and spa treatments she refused to leave the property. The food is superb and we were traveling there as a family of 4 to include my in-law. I have recommended this place to everyone I know and would definitely go back again. My first stay Lil John was a guest there and we saw him and my second time we visited all the landmarks in the area. All of the staff are very professional and will cater to whatever you need to include babysitting for kids.

Review_Date: Victor V wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Outstanding Hotel - One of the Best
Review_Text: I have just returned from two fantastic weeks at the Es Saadi Palace. I am delighted to report that it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.    The room was very spacious - a duplex suite with a nice sitting area and a terrace.    The swimming pool was spectacular - the main pool being around 100m long. OK it's a bit chilly at this time of year but great for swimming my daily kilometre (and there's a smaller heated pool to keep children happy).    Internet access was excellent being fast and reasonably reliable.    But the best thing was the friendliness of the staff. Everyone was cheerful and helpful without being in any way intrusive.    My only reservation would be the quality of the in-house restaurants is a bit disappointing - particularly the Italian Othello restaurant. But there are some very good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel so there's plenty of choice.    All in all a truly wonderful holiday.    I really look forward to a return visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous stay at the Es Saadi Resort Palace
Review_Text: My friend and I had a wonderful stay at the Es Saadi Resort Palace on our recent trip to Marrakech. The hotel is lovely with extensive amenities and our room was large quiet and comfortable. We found the staff to be warm and helpful. The breakfast buffet with made-to-order omelets and other selections was extensive and excellent. The Es Saadi provided free transportation to/from the airport and they were very responsive by e-mail ahead of the trip on any questions we had.    I made use of the gym (part of the salon area) during my stay which is open from 8 am to 9 pm and provides bottled water towels and fruit. (One recommendation: It would have been better for the gym to be open longer to accommodate our sightseeing schedule--say from 6 am to 10 pm.)    We would highly recommend the Es Saadi Palace for your stay in Marrakech!

We are a family of 4 (kids aged 13 and 9) based in London and were in need of a sunny break.    We really enjoyed our time at Es Saadi. The guys on the front door were especially welcoming whisking our kids off in a golf buggy for a tour of the resort whilst we checked in. Thumbs up from the kids - good start.    We stayed in a Ksar which was lovely. Like a large 2 storey apartment with more than enough space for us all (and plenty of storage). There were lovely terraces on both floors.    We were lucky enough to have wonderful weather and so spent most of our downtime around the pool. Great attendants there - they jump to find you beds/ mini-cabanas/ shade/sun/umbrellas as soon as you arrive and despite being there in UK school holidays there was never a shortage of any of these facilities whatever time we arrived.    At the Palace one of the pools was heated to 25 degrees whilst the other was unheated. Our kids spent most of the time in the former as the latter was still a bit chilly but it was the start of April so I expect it would be glorious by next month.    The guys serving around the pool were delightful. A little haphazard at times for a ‚Äú5*hotel‚Äù but really friendly utterly charming and very good with kids. (Special mention to Ashraf!)We ate lunch at the pool bar 4 times and whilst the menu is fairly limited it was nice.    We ate in the cor de lion - very nice good food beautiful views but quite formal. Also ate in the Ed Saadi restaurant in the actual hotel which we found to be atmosphere-less. We also had room service which was efficient and actually delicious - the ksar is big enough to properly sit down as a family for a 2 course meal.    We ate out on our final night and enjoyed the wander around wishing we had done that more in the evenings - there are lots of nice bars around the area.    All in all we had a great time - it‚Äôs good for kids. The shaded playpark for little ones and table tennis for older ones is right by the pool so it‚Äôs possible to read a book with one eye on the kids for hours on end. We also used the well-maintained tennis court everyday.    We had one drink at the Hotel pool but it looked very busy at that small pool and we were very glad that we had booked the Palace.

Review_Date: Saarika R wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Es Saadi resort (NOT Palace)... terrible 1 star service...WOULD NOT ADVISE ANYONE TO STAY
Review_Text: Please be warned ...some of the reviews on this stream are meant for the Es Saadi Palace and not the resort attached to the Palace. This is a review for the resort.    Es Saadi Resort has been listed as a 5 star resort which is why we booked it. We received nothing short of a 1 star service at this resort. The manager (Mustafa) and the majority of staff (Marium and many of the breakfast staff) were rude did not speak good English and only interacted with guests who were fluent in French.  1.) Day 1 - our booking was messed up. We booked a double room and received a twin bed room. It took 1h30mins for them to fix (they kept us waiting in the twin room with no update of what was going on after a long journey). When I went down after an hour and fifteen minutes to see if it was fixed Marium told me they were fully booked quite rudely! To be honest I was supposed to be one those bookings!  2.) Day 2 - first day at breakfast. Staff who spoke fluently in French and not English didn't give us the time of day (this was most of the breakfast staff). We are strict vegetarians and there were no labels on any of the foods. We couldn't tell what was meat and what was vegetarian. It would be a struggle for those who have allergies!  Breakfast staff seemed to be in their own world of rushing past you to do things just not the 5 star service I expected. Even when the collected finished plates from our table they would push passed your hands very quickly and forcefully dropping pastry crumbs from your plates all over your lap! Certainly not 5 star.  3.) Evening of Day 2 - Came back from a privately booked tour of the Atlas mountains had an amazing day just wanted a shower. The water came out cold then came out brown with a distinctive smell I jumped out and told my husband to grab my phone we took photos as proof and one video. Please see attached. When we showed Mustapha (the manager) he didn't apologise and just told us we were the only people in the hotel who experienced it. Not 5 star service. He asked us if the problem had been fixed (not sure how I was supposed to know if it had fully been fixed but clear water came out 5 mins later to which my new husband and I had quick showers in fear of more of the brown stuff coming out). He said he would send someone to look at it whilst we were out for dinner.  I also mentioned our breakfast problem at this point - he did nothing to help resolve the issue (even the next day before we saw him for breakfast).  4.) Came back from dinner we asked reception (Samira) if it had been done she told us no and that now she would send maintenance (!). We had been out for 3 hours by this point and there seemed to be no urgency in resolving what could have been a serious sewage type of issue.  5.) Maintenance finally came and said our shower head needed to be replaced and left. We assumed he would come back and change it - NO ONE EVER DID FOR THE REST OF OUR TRIP we even fell asleep waiting! Again not a 5 star service.  6.) We were offered no compensation no complimentary drink at the bar not even a measly 10% off a drink at the bar or even an apology! Terrible for a 5 star.    Kamal head of concierge who we met on our last day was nice and Salima who was at breakfast on the second to last day was nice spoke good english and helped me figure out what I could and could not eat.    Mustapha ignored us for the remainder of our stay every time we saw him. This is not 5 star service.    Terrible service certainly not 5 star as promised on your website. Thoroughly disappointed unfortunately. PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON STAYING HERE...Spend a few bucks more and go to the Novotel or Sofitel which are closely and only a little but more money. You won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good but a number of minor issues
Review_Text: We stayed in a corner suite 3101 on the first floor in the palace part of the resort.    The entrance to the palace is basically the entrance to the casino with the hotel entrance off to the left. It does make you wonder where you are going especially as the ‚Äúhotel *****‚Äù is around the other side of the block.    Our suite had a large living space an outside terrace a small kitchen area closet large bathroom and a bedroom.    Other rooms on this floor are much smaller with living/sleeping rooms and no kitchen.    The kitchen has a fridge filled with soft drinks a kettle Nespresso machine and a sink.    The living room has a dining table for four a writing desk and lounge sitting for up to six comfortably.    Now the minor issues.    There was no milk and we had to ask for it but it was left in a jug so it went off spectacularly within a day. The fridge and Nespresso pods were not replenished even though other things (like bathroom shower gels etc) were replenished.    The TV in the living room didn‚Äôt work but the one in the bedroom did. The TV opportunities here are pretty dire though so no big deal.    But why aren‚Äôt these things checked? I don‚Äôt book a nice suite in a decent hotel only to have to spend each day chasing housekeeping and maintenance.    Fortunately the WiFi here is pretty good so you can get all the TV and news you need on your own devices. The TV that did work lets you cast from your mobile device too that‚Äôs good.    Our terrace views were off a tennis court some maintenance area and the highway. The grounds of the resort are quite nice so it‚Äôs a pity we didn‚Äôt get to see any of it.    Nice things:    The staff are very friendly and generally quite helpful when you do engage them.  Breakfast is so-so but included in price so no real complaints there.  It was a bit chilly when we stayed but you could breakfast outside if you wanted.    Spa:    We didn‚Äôt use many of the spa facilities but the pool area was nice as were the various steam rooms/saunas etc. Very relaxing.    Other:    We used the Egyptan Bar (lobby bar) and the Cour du Lions Moroccan restaurant. I‚Äôll cover those in different reviews but the food and drink options are limited in the bar (and room service).    Alcohol is VERY expensive but there are two Carrefour supermarkets nearby where bought some basic provisions and made use of the fridge. Beer/wine is actually not that expensive in Marrakech even compared to the UK.    Overall a pleasant and relaxing stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandra C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I can say enough good things about Es Saadi the service food rooms and attention to detail were fantastic. We had a great time looking forward to come back as soon as we get an opportunity. We have need it a few extra things that we forgot at home... we asked for them and before we got to our room there were there. WOW they are just great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rob W wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Palace in nice, hotel is OK
Review_Text: Stayed 1 night in the Palace then moved to the hotel for a week during a meeting. Palace was very nice. Hotel was OK. Hotel room was on 3rd floor facing. the street. You had to choose either to be hot with the patio door closed or cool and not sleep due to the street noise (rain motorcycles people horses...). Room always smelled like cigarette or cigar smoke. Ventiltion system provide no cooling nor any fresh air. Ask for a room that faces the courtyard and not the street.

Review_Title: A couple quirks, but still one of the best
Review_Text: We've traveled all over the world even stayed in six hotels on this Morocco trip!    The Es Salado hotel is one of the nicest hotels in many ways:    The staff greets you in a traditional Moroccan outfit white head to toe sporting a dagger in his belt. They offer Moroccan tea and some cookies while you wait.    Lobby and hotel interior is incredible majestic. High ceilings elaborate tile walls and stone & marble everywhere. Looks like the set of a movie. Everywhere you look there are comfortable couches and seating areas that invite you to relax.    Exterior grounds feature beautiful green gardens tall palm trees and an amazing pool.    The room is huge. Stone tile floor raised ceiling and a beautiful bathroom featuring a large tub very large shower with rain fixture and a separate toilet space. Also there you'll find a towel-warming rack! The room even offers a large walk-in closet. The whole thing is very spacious and has a balcony overlooking the gardens.    The quirks we encountered were:  A rushed and confusing check in process where the quickly processed our group but then we were ignored an left in our own to find our room. This wouldn't normally be a problem but to get to our room (on the third floor) we had to take a elevator to the first floor (reception was in Look Level 0) walk down a hall take a separate elevator to a different third floor. It was confusing and there was no way we would have found it on our own especially with no directional signage. After we tried and failed we retired to reception and requested assistance. Just be sure to ask for assistance at check in.    Enjoy your trip! This is an amazing hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Overall it has been a very enjoyable stay and Marrakech experience.  Just a pity that for the Spa treatment the usual ¬¥zen mood‚Äô was missing as the treatment has been a quite fast performance... seemed under time pressure.  Location of the hotel comfort and staff‚Äôs politeness was excellent.  Marrakech & Es Saadi is worth a trip!

Review_Date: Trevor D wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We have just returned from a short break away in Marrakech and cannot recommend the Es Saadi Palace enough. I had booked through secret escapes and despite the break getting off to a bad start due to missing our flight (traffic due to an accident on the slip road at Gatwick) we tagged a day on with the hotel by paying direct. We were more than happy to be told on arrival that we had been upgraded from a Junior Suite to a private villa with Butler! From the moment we were picked up at the airport in a beautiful air conditioned e class mercedes with cold water and and a hot towel the resort and staff could do nothing more to make our stay more pleasant. A wide variety of choice for breakfast a large pool and a separate heated pool (28 degrees) we had the most amazing stay. Please note this is a review of the palace resort as we did not stay at the hotel.

Classic older hotel. Great location easy to walk to the medina but reasonable quiet location. Room was huge with great balcony overlooking one of the largest hotel pools I have seen set in beautiful gardens.    Service was excellent.

Review_Date: Lefteris E wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: A great thanks to the hotels accommodation! Everything was over expecting starting from the polite staff and finally the wonderful facilities offering us a very pleasant stay. Even the tennis Instructer was a great challenge .  Thank you and wishing to come back again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mariana C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: One of the best hotel that I have ever stayed. Rooms were huge and confortable with a beautiful view of the pool. Services incredible including delicious dinner at the Moroccan restaurant.    Staff super super helpful and friendly all the time they make you feel welcome.    One of the best thing to recommend is the tour to the Atlas mountain. The concierge suggested Hamid for a day tour. Hamid was the best he took us to visit a local market even helped us to buy local products. He was absolutely warm knowledgeable and kind. One of the best tours that I have ever had.  Ask for him for any kind of tour that you want to do in Marrakesh.  Would love to come back here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is equipped with all what you need it provides you with comfort and security. The staff is very polite and ready to help with everything anytime. There are restaurants in the complex spa with all imaginable services cash dispenser and WiFi working perfectly. The concierge is ready to help you with trips. Everything you would expect from an excellent hotel. But we made an experience with great help in a difficulty. Namely having a little health problem (already before arriving) that agravated. The hotel organised visits of doctors and fetching of medication so the we could recover quickly. In situations like this you will recognise the quality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Es Saadi Palace is a beautiful peaceful luxurious resort. The swimming pools and extensive grounds and palatial lobby and common areas are spectacular. The rooms are spacious and tasteful the beds extremely comfortable. I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing. But what makes a stay here so special is the people. I have never encountered such uniformly considerate friendly helpful efficient kind and charming staff at any hotel.  They do everything in a thoughtful personal but unobtrusive way. I feel extremely welcome and well looked after there. I look forward to my next visit.

Review_Date: Clare M wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: A nice hotel but we are unlikely to return
Review_Text: We stayed here over New Year. The hotel is lovely with a good breakfast (waiting for eggs could be a random event - sometimes they were raw and sometimes overcooked). Some of the staff were incredibly helpful and polite. The pool was good too and big. We also used the tennis court which is worth booking when you arrive if you want sociable hours. We were disappointed with a couple of things; room service could be a bit random although mainly very good. Unfortunately one of our children was given a hat as a new year's gift by the hotel which we tried to exchange for some leather slippers that the rest of us received as the hat was too small. Unfortunately the hotel kept the hat and told us they would get back to us....we're still waiting. The hotel is walking distance (just) to the centre which we did several times. We are a fit family so it wasn't a problem for us - but a 20 minute walk plus. We enjoyed our first visit to Marrakech and will leave with loads of memories.    However the worst thing was that I had food poisoning there which we reported to the hotel with no action at all. I barely ate for two days and lots 3-4kg so it was vicious. This was following the outrageously priced New Year's banquet dinner so a double disappointment. It was the following morning that I was ill and hadn't eaten outside of the hotel since so must have been within the hotel. We were amazed by the hotel's lack of action given the severity of my illness and I basically lost 2 days of the holiday out of a week. Not good. Thus my comment that we are unlikely to return.

Review_Date: Mark N wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Very Nice Property, Excellent Spa and Service
Review_Text: I spend five nights at the Es Saadi in Marrakesh during a work trip in November 2018. The hotel is very nice with an excellent spa and nice dining options. It is located near the city center a walking distance or a short cab ride away and is a short drive from the airport.    I would definitely secure a rate with breakfast included the breakfast was excellent and can be enjoyed indoors our outdoors. Nice spot for a stay in Marrakesh.

It felt like returning home when I stayed at Es Saadi for a second time. I saw familiar faces everywhere from the door men to the reception to the restaurant and the the waiters. They remembered me as well and welcomed me back warmly and generously and with a special personalised treat from the owner Mme Elisabeth herself:-)    The spa has seven different steam baths with different treatments and effects so I was in spa heaven!!! My spa treatments and the products used were all luxurious and natural.    Everyone here from the owner to the staff exudes grace and warmth. Es Saadi's name apparently means contented one I left the hotel pampered and very very content.

Review_Title: Nice rooms around the swiming pool
Review_Text: Chosen on internet and it was a good choice. Easy to reach from airport and 10 minutes away from the center of Marrakech. Good price and very clean. Breakfast served in the main lobby or in the room without any surcharges. If you want you can have meals around the swimming pool.

Stayed at Palace. It is a beautiful property huge room 80 m2 + 3 meter high ceiling classical Moorish deco good breakfast fine spa. Guests can enjoy their indoor pool  steam rooms and sauna for free. The lagoon pool was too cold to use but the smaller outdoor pool was heated to 28 degrees which was lovely to swim in especially in December. The garden is lovely though not as big as the one in La Mamounia. I especially loved the library which has a good collection of fine books on photography and fashion. They offer free pickup and drop off service from the airport. Make sure you choose the Palace not the Hotel to stay the hotel seem to have more negative reviews. Don‚Äôt forget to try their beautiful restaurant la Cour des Lions.

Review_Date: Lars-Anders L wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Arrival to this fantastic palace in the afternoon. Not crowded but silent elegant and welcoming atmosphere. Warm tea while waiting for formalities and tour of the facilities prior to going to our beautiful junior suite on 3¬¥d floor overlooking the guarden and pool area. The garden itself beautiful and big enough for a walk to enjoy both silence and privacy. The Palace proves to be different from a standard 5 star hotel. The SPA the bar the restaurants as well as the staff provides unexpected good service when you almost are not aware of your own needs. This is a romantic nice place close to the center of a busy city very different from any European city. The Palace is clean and welcoming - like a luxury home away from home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My travel agent surprised us with a 3 night stay at this luxury resort about halfway through our extended trip through Morocco. There were mostly French families there when we visited and I felt as if I were having a vacation within a vacation. I spent an entire day in the herbal steam room and at the pool. Lunch by the heated pool was so relaxing. One night we had a dinner at the bar that was one of the best meals we had on our trip. We could walk anywhere we wanted to go yet once inside the hotel we felt as if we were in a true resort. Truly a 5 star experience.

Review_Date: Christina T wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We booked a room in the palace. Entering the hotel the first thing we sought was ‚Äû1001 night‚Äú. The entry hall looks stunning. Our room had 70m2 and was the best room I‚Äôve ever had. The bathroom was like being in a film and the view on the Pool was also wonderful. The breakfast has everything one can wish for - from traditional Marocain food to different versions of eggs. The bar with a piano player I also can recommend in the evening.  I totally will stay again there if I am coming back to Marrakech!!

Our second time staying at Es Saadi Palace it is very much a 5 star resort. All the staff are so nice and friendly and do anything they can to help. The guys at the pool reception maids breakfast team everyone does everything they can to help you don't have to ask.    The rooms are beautiful and luxurious lots of space very very clean towels changed twice a day. Lots of art around the hotel to look at including a gallery. Breakfast is excellent with lots of choice hot and cold.    The gardens are amazing and so well looked after so many plants so well cared for it really is beautiful. Sitting by the pool is so special as there is so much space enabling you to have a private spot.    We visited end of October and the weather was poor a lot of rain. Out of 6 days we had 1 good day but staying at Es Saadi made it a great holiday.    A truly unique place which we will visit again thank you so much for a great time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a wonderful hotel  service is 5 star  food amazing and the most attentive staff  lovely little touches in your room  flowers  biscuits and roses . Just need a kettle in the room for coffee and teas.  The bar is lovely with the most wonderful cocktails. Lovely pool and the spa is great .  Definitely feel relaxed and pampered after leaving here and would return soon to wonderful Marrakech the people made it the best holiday .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leyla G wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: The hotel was superb .  From the minute we got there we were treated and greeted like VIP‚Äôs . The transfer from the airport was in a nice vehicle water and fresh hand towels were provided . The staff greeted us with mint tea and and cakes and allowed an early check in .  The rooms were outstanding incl walk in wardrobe  double sinks  huge kingsize beds  balconies and great views .  The resort is beautiful. One of the outdoors pools is heated . The grounds were gorgeous. The breakfast first class . The casino  restaurants  night club  spa all fantastic . The art work outstanding. We could not find any fault at all. Room service  bell boys all prompt.  Location is great .  I would recommend this hotel on every level .

The resort is located a few minutes from the city center. the resort hosts several buildings labeled as Hotel palace villa and so on. I stayed in the palace and I loved the suite that was assigned to me. it was a very comfortable spacious and classic suite with a big balcony.    I have been to many 5 star hotels but I have never seen one like this one. As I arrived at the palace I was able to check in quickly. I was given some forms to sign; yet I was never informed of my breakfast location nor given any further instructions about the hotel. it seemed a busy day. for this reason one concierge was given the task of accompanying me along with other clients. since my room was before the other client's room the concierge dropped my luggage and left without bothering to show me around ( this is the 5-star treatment that I always get in other hotels).    The majority of the staff are unbearable and rude. From the day I entered the palace until the last day most of them were very grumpy and they seemed as if they were doing a favor to their clients. They were very unprofessional and not trained to work in a five-star hotel.    Both the staff at the reception and the breakfast staff assumed that everybody could speak and understand French. All the time I asked something in English the staff always responded in French.    The funny part of my experience was that the more I spoke English the more the breakfast staff got upset.    I have had the chance to use one of their conference room as well. It was really dated and the air conditioning system did not work properly.    Although my experience with most of the staff was stressful there is one particular staff ( concierge Hicham ) that made my stay better. He smiled continuously and helped me calm down.    a beautiful Resort with grumpy and unprofessional staff has no value.

cannot fault the service  staff  and food especially othello restaurant . the breakfast wasmagnificent and the pool area was good . one comment that i would suggest is to make the minibar more attractive even maybe some crisps or peanuts and provide coffee in the room .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Situated close enough to the medina to walk but far enough away that you don't have to leave if you don't want to.    A very spacious hotel with large grounds but very quiet - which could be what you are looking for. Apart from the main entrance which serves as the entrance to the the casino as well - this gets busy and a little over-whelmed with cars at times.    The spa is fantastic and the staff throughout are lovely - albeit service is typically Moroccan and can need to a good amount of encouragement to speed up!

This was our third time staying at the Palace and it was always good for what we are booking it for: spacious rooms convenient to Medina and our conference as well as The Pool (almost a pond :)  However here are few details we would like to improve - pool service: the staff keeps taking cushions around 6 PM and the bar closes too early. Not nice as the pool is one of the main features for us.We were there for a week.  No ammenities in the room like bottled water after maid service; only in the evening. But all good.  Also they did not remember my birthday this year :(  But these are not any siginiciant details. More guidelines to improve for the future.  We will be back for sure!

Exceeded my expectations. Super lovely resort and with an amazing staff. Our room was upgraded by the most wonderful gentleman that checked us in. I really appreciate it! The beauty and comfort of this resort was extraordinary. I will recommend this resort to all my friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 'This was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed it. It was an amazing hotel the staff was so accommodating. They were incredibly nice and had made our trip so great. One of the staff members saw our daughter in our car and told her to come out couldn't the car so she wouldn't overheat in the hot car. When my husband left uscouldn't move the car bc I didn't know stick shift someone came out and moved our car. They were just so increcible. DEF STAY HERE

Everything was Great unbelivable!! The stuff very helpfull and friendly the room was huge and the bed very comfortable the pool and the garden very big and clean and beautiful and the Spa...well that was a real suprise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent four night in the Es Saadi and enjoyed every minute. They have a huge pool wich offers relaxation and refreshment after a hot day in the souks. Breakfast and staff is excellent. There is nothing more to say even though TripAdvisor tries to force me ‚Ä¶
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joseph Traveller wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Our two night stay at the Es Saadi Palace was quite frankly by far the best hotel stay we have had in Morocco (and we have travelled a lot in Morocco over many years). We found the staff to be utterly professional and clearly very well managed. The magical thing about staying here is that one benefits from all the advantages of a premium class 5* de-luxe palace hotel whilst enjoying an intimate atmosphere more often found in smaller boutique hotels. As a family of 2 adults and 4 children we could not have chosen better as the kids LOVED gardens and pool we all thoroughly enjoyed the absolute luxury of our Ksar Suite with 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and a delightful sitting room with private terrace and garden. The butler service worked beautifully. Abdou was always on call and quickly delivered breakfast sun downer drinks snacks and even first aid when we needed it. We ate one night in the Moroccan restaurant "Coeur des Lions" which was AMAZING. The second night we dined at the Gastronomic French restaurant at the sister Es Saadi hotel on the other side of the beautiful manicured gardens. What amazing food and great selection of Moroccan and French wines. The cocktail bar at the Palace makes a great Thai Daikirai but the way!  We were ad to leave today but most definitely will be back with more family and friends. This place is an absolute MUST for anyone looking for a quiet peaceful palm grove experience within minutes of all the excitement of Marrakech. Thank you all for making our stay an unforgettable one.

Review_Date: Aicha Selhi wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Tr√®s jolie h√¥tel. All the staff was nice. Always helpful and very good service!  The room was big clean and very nice. Also the pool and the area around the pool was fantastic. A good place to relax on without many people.

We originally stayed in May 2018; visiting Marrakech for a wedding. We stayed at the Palace and were quite literally blown away by its magnificence. Rooms were incredible staff very friendly and the extra attention to detail was what made it 5*. For example staff noting we had tea for breakfast and then hand delivering a box of tea to our room one afternoon! Helping us with excursions. And setting us up with a private dining area in the grounds so we could enjoy a romantic evening together. The restaurants at the Palace are fantastic - the Moroccan restaurant on the roof has the best tagines but the Italian (Othello) knocked us off our feet - 5* dining at its best with a menu that rivalled the finest we‚Äôve experienced around the world. The spa and fitness areas are impressive too and worth a visit.  We were so happy with the Palace that we returned in mid June for 5 days and will be returning again next year as our favourite place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have been coming to Es Saadi Palace during last 4 years - always in May - June and we always loved it. The hotel has a very good location where it‚Äôs not in he middle of Medina but is close enough to even walk or just a short taxi ride away. The junior suites are spacious and traditionally furnished - one feels immediately at ease there. The higher category rooms are even bigger so this is an excellent choice for one that requires a bit more space. The service is good and the garden is beautiful. It is really a nice oasis in Marrakech if one wants an option to stay out of Medina and very reasonably priced too. One thing is that the pool although beautiful is always quite cold. ))) there is a Spa are and very nice indoor wellness area - I can imagine it should also be very nice in winter months. We are spoiled travelers who only take the best but in Marrakech we love this place and won‚Äôt need to go to our usual four seasons - this hotel is excellent for the money one pays and is more authentic. So definitely the one to come back to.

Review_Date: Ana C wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Complete rip off - Scam after Scam.
Review_Text: We have no words to describe this hotel-resort... but we will try: fraud and really bad experience. I will start with the booking process... they advertise it as a 5* resort with some nice pools and infrastructure all the photos and comments they provide correspond to the ‚ÄúEs Saadi Palace‚Äù -which is not what you are actually booking. So since they think it is ok to mix them both my review will also be of both hotels. Once you get to the hotel you have a worn down building that would not even get 3* in the 60s; dirty walls prison-grade bathroom sticky carpets cleaning-product smelling shampoo/lotion. The whole installations (both of the ‚Äúhotel‚Äù and the ‚Äúpalace‚Äù) are covered with flies... just nasty!  The pools again... horrible experience. To get a towel in the advertised pool you‚Äôve got to pay 500MAD per person per day the staff of both the pool and reception (‚ÄúPalace‚Äù) have the worst condescending attitude looking down to guest and making extremely rude comments. They aggressively laugh at your face... this is NOT a 5* treatment the whole treatment is just dreadful.  The SPA... after paying +1200MAD per person most of the steam rooms were not working again... no advise.  The bar another nightmare you‚Äôre either completely ignored by the staff (Palace) or they serve you a drink of a much lower quality (Hotel) than the ordered and they still pretend to charge you 240MAD per glass (when not even the full bottle is 150MAD) - note that they don‚Äôt inform you of the change on the product until after it‚Äôs poured and served! you only notice if you actually know your champagne! We clearly refused to accept/pay for it.  The taxis they arrange for you also a fraud! Extremely pushy drivers and very old cars for gold prices (I guess aligned with the whole philosophy of the resort). They took us to places we didn‚Äôt ask for (random shop in the middle of nowhere) and then pretended us to pay for that.  Every segment of the day (morning afternoon evening) you are jumped with a new unpleasant surprise. From having to pay ridiculous prices for basic services ill-mannered staff (with a few exceptions like the room cleaning lady/guy) to shattered rooms rusted bathrooms patched lobby...  The 1* of this rank is given to the bed (quite comfortable) and the grounds of the ‚ÄúPalace‚Äù (which would be very nice if you get rid of all the staff).  Conclusion: bad bad bad we would NEVER come back.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roderick H wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Emphasis on Moroccan art - and Gambling
Review_Text: We had a Junior Suite at the Palace very clean and spacious with views (in clear weather) of the Atlas Mountains in the distance. The hotel staff are welcoming and helpful.  Examples of Moroccan art can be seen on every wall and corridor.. Some is surprisingly challenging for a Muslim country but it all shows the energy and optimism (and sense of fun) of young artists in the country. The grounds are well maintained and the pool area is extensive. The sister hotel is more conventional and its grounds much more limited.  Between the two is the original casino in Marrakesh. On the day we were leaving both hotels were filling up with poker players. Even so there was no intrusion on the calm and quiet of the Palace and its grounds. The concierge staff were very efficient.  We did not use the Spa but I used the gym which was up to a good standard.  Others have commented about breakfast service. We found the food to be of high quality and the coffee good and hot served promptly.  Getting to the main sites in the old town is best done by taxi at an agreed price - easily arranged and not expensive by Western standards.  Overall we were very happy with the hotel.

Review_Title: What's Not to like at this excellent Hotel
Review_Text: A fabulous Hotel with super facilities beautiful grounds enormous swimming pool part of which is heated plenty of sun lounges well spread out in the gardens a tennis court & table tennis also available.
