The Food is excellent in their Restaurants and a wonderful breakfast is served alfresco with a vast choice of different foods.  The Hotel is in a quiet area with a Casino and Night Club in the grounds.There are also plenty of restaurants nearby..

One of the resorts that worth every penny. good staff well maintained Rooms  If you go there just ask about Lamia she's "General Relationship" she can well advice you about anything you want .  Then you got the placement of this hotel which close to everything possibly needed.

Review_Title: es saadi palace - can't think of a reason not to
Review_Text: maybe this was the 4th or 5th stay at our ' new' find in Marrakech and it won't be the last. the feeling of being family owned rather than a dehumanised unit of an international chain is to be cherished - the family loves their hotel so guests can love it too - staff are well trained and charming - the food from the hotel's farm is fresh and unlike any 5* de luxe hotel l have ever stayed in. it is seasonal local prepared and cooked traditionally with care and thoughtfulness. the gardens are full of roses and huge mature trees so rare in a city in a desert. very comfortable suite and really good value - always happy the  moment i book a trip - could put a night light or dimmer for the bathroom

Review_Date: Barbi B wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Like a dream world. Nice room with beautiful view friendly staff delicious food. Great mix of trandition and modern world. We enjoyed every minute spending there. The hotel is located neer from the airport about 10 minutes by car. The old town is about 25 minutes on foot. I can recommend.

Review_Title: Very nice overall but could be improved
Review_Text: Pros:  Nice Moroccan style hotel; grounds & swimming pool are pretty well maintained; complimentary transfer from hotel is very welcoming; most of the staff are nice and do their best; very nice bathroom; good breakfast; not a 5 star palace for sure (but we obviously can‚Äôt expect it to be at the level of the Mamounia) but an overall nice place for sure.    Cons:  Was there for a birthday & had organized a couple of surprises: 2 emails and they still forgot... room was not as described on pictures when I booked the room (6months in advance) way simpler (definitely not as richly decorated as on the pictures) and far from the swimming pool view we were promised. Dinner at the Cours des Lions was disappointing: food definitely not as good as Gastro type they pretend to be and they remembered (in extremis) after we finished our tea and desert about the birthday cake... The cake was delicious though! We did appreciate it as it was also complimentary and that is a nice gesture.  Young woman at the reception was totally helpless couldn‚Äôt answer any of our very simple questions (taxis distance to Majorelle gardens etc) and this for every single day (we decided to go to the concierge instead very efficient).  While at the swimming pool we tried several time to order some drinks but they never payed attention to us.  On the overall would go back but with way more limited expectations...

Review_Title: Overall a great stay with some quirks
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and although I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs a 5 star resort by any means it‚Äôs a great place with attentive staff that really tries to give luxury accommodations.  Pros-  Safety: This place was a bit on the outskirts. It‚Äôs also gated with security.  Location: close to the airport and a 40 minute walk into the Medina which we did regularly (rarely took a taxi in a lot of traffic). It was also close to super nice restaurants and clubs  Getting a taxi is super easy. They greeters call the taxis over and set a fixed price with the driver and you so you don‚Äôt have to be weary of that awkward taxi interaction.  The grounds are beautiful. The pool and garden areas were superb.  Cons-  Rooms were a little run down. It seems like an older building but you can tell that they do try to make it the best experience.  Service at breakfast was questionable. We had to wave down the servers multiple times just to get coffee almost every day.  Restaurant and excursion prices are steep. They are good but you could get most of that outside for the resort and it‚Äôd be 1/3 of the cost. There were times we craved convenience over price and other times we didn‚Äôt.  There wasn‚Äôt a lot of Moroccan charm if you are looking for that stay at a riad.    Overall a great place to stay. Like I said it was a little run down and at times trying to hard to be more luxury than what it‚Äôs capable of. Wouldn‚Äôt call it a 5 Star but definitely nice.

Review_Title: Lovely hotel with beautiful pool & gardens.
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay in this beautiful hotel but it's not quite as good as other 5 star hotels we've stayed in. The main areas of the palace were beautiful and the gardens and pool area were superb there were just a few tiny niggles that make it not quite right as a 5 star hotel in our view...    We stayed 5 nights in a Ksar villa which worked well for us as a family of 4 (travellers with young families may need to check the suitability though as the twin room was upstairs with an open staircase and no door leading into it). Generally the Ksar was nice although it was a bit 'tired' with some damp patches and slightly odd 'conference centre' chairs. Complimentary mini bar with soft drinks and pastries each afternoon was nice. We felt it was reasonable value for money for a hotel of this quality.    Housekeeping had an uncanny knack of waiting until we returned to our villa in the evenings between 6-7pm to ask if they could come and service it - slightly odd timing given most guests would have left the pool area at 6pm or would have returned at that time to get ready to go out for the evening.    Breakfast was good a reasonable choice with eggs cooked to order. The waiting staff though seemed overrun with no obvious process or system in place things regularly seemed to be spilled or slopped everywhere. They could also do with sorting out the birds that live in the dining room regularly flying down to help themselves to cake from the buffet table - after the first day we learned only to go for items that were under cover...    We ate in both the palace restaurants which were nice and the food was good but atmosphere was lacking in both and whilst convenient they're not value for money. We found much nicer places to eat out locally and in the old town.    The spa area was lovely with great service and really nice treatments on a slightly cooler day an afternoon spent in the indoor pool and steam rooms was very welcome. The pool area was also lovely and the heated pool was very welcome the larger pool was too cold to use during our stay (being unheated) but I suspect it would be lovely in the summer when it's warmer.    Despite all of the niggles Es Saadi was very convenient rooms are good value and it's somewhere we would definitely return to.

First time in Marrakech and we decided to play it safe and stay outside the medina hence chose the Essaadi Palace for its convenient location to Jema El Fana and souks. The three of us stayed for 5 nights in one of their Ksar. The lobby and common areas are spectacular very well maintained and clean. You are totally mesmerized by the grandeur colors and smells. This creates an expectation for the finest however that‚Äôs not quite the case or at least was not for us.    Pros:  - Ksar was huge it had 2 levels with 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms 2 living areas 1 terrace and 1 patio. Enough space for a family of 4 and more.  - Nice bathroom amenities  - Mini bar was restocked daily with water juice and soft drinks (complimentary)  - Complimentary sweets left in the ksar by housekeeping  - Friendly staff  - Location is very convenient to get to souks    Cons:  - Rooms not so well maintained. There is wear and tear. The day we checked in we realized two out of three bathroom sinks were not draining well. They tried to fix both one even started to leak so we left it at that and just used the working one the whole time.  - The AC on the second floor did not work three out of the five nights. We complained after the second night but no one came to check till we complained again in evening it was finally fixed after the third night.  - Sketchy service at breakfast. Some days the service during was impeccable and some days it was not so great. Also birds fly inside the breakfast area and settle down on open food. They do try to keep things covered but not everything is.  - Limited restaurant choice on property    We ate at their Moroccan restaurant Cours De Lions two nights. Limited menu but the food was good yet overpriced. One night we ate at the Es Saadi Hotel restaurant and that was decent food service there was great.  Overall a nice place to stay in Marrakesh

Review_Text: We spent a week on a yoga retreat with Yoga Escapes at the Es Saadi Palace in March 2018 and it was an absolutely wonderful experience! The hotel is beautiful everything was taken care of the rooms were spacious and full of Moroccan charm the breakfast buffet was delicious and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been nicer and more welcoming. It was a peaceful oasis from the hustle and bustle of the Medina - the perfect refuge after a day shopping in the souks! Highly recommended hotel and a perfect yoga holiday experience thank you Es Saadi! We will surely be back next year with another yoga group in March already looking forward to it.

The interior design at the palace is breathtaking with so much attention to detail in the design and you get such an authentic Moroccan feel when walking through the main building and an island vibe walking through the main garden and pool area. Es Saadi also has a 5 star hotel located just next to the palace and ten private villas.    I was so happy with the suite I stayed in. The bed was beyond comfortable that I didn‚Äôt want to get out in the morning it has a huge walk in robe and my favourite part was the stunning bathroom. I also had a great view of their huge swimming pool from the balcony which was also the perfect place to watch the sun go down. The resort also offers access to its hydrothermal spa and a huge gym (if you‚Äôre into keeping fit like I am) and they‚Äôve really thought of everything by providing free little snacks at the gym such as fresh apples raisins and nuts. You can also book yourself into one of their gorgeous spa treatments with so much on offer you‚Äôre bound to feel even more relaxed!

Review_Text: I stayed at Es Saadi for 2 nights with my friend and I have to say that it's one of my favourite hotels I've stayed in. The staff were so warm and friendly from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. Our suite was stunning - I still can't get over the incredible bathroom! There are so many great facilities including the spa area (which is just beautiful) a HUGE outdoor swimming pool a big gym that even provides little snacks (dried fruit nuts apples) which was such a cute idea! We also had a great view of the pool from our balcony which was the perfect place to watch the sun set. I also can't forget to mention the delicious food from the room service menu (the lamb tagine was to die for) and the delicious buffet breakfast served each morning. The resort is really just so so beautiful from the hotel lobby to the pool and garden area through to the rooms. I loved Es Saadi and hope to return one day. Highly recommend staying here when visiting Marrakech!

Review_Date: Pekka V wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Opulence just outside the Medina walls
Review_Text: Luxury abounds in this hotel. Very nice rooms with balcony to the garden and many good restaurants to choose from e.g. Venetian. Beautiful and large pool area and huge garden. We spent some time in a Riad in Medina and rest of the time here a great combination for a holiday! Only minus is the closeness to the airport that makes some unwanted noise.

Es Saadi Palace offers warm and thoughtful service in the most luxurious setting. The spa and the range of treatments offered there are out of this world. Everyone from the concierge desk to reception to the restaurant and the spa is attentive without being overbearing. The toiletries are amazing including the black soap and the invitation to attempt a hamam on yourself.    The rooms are large with a doorway that leads to the spectacular bathroom (with a jacuzzi type bath tub) and a separate dressing room. The suite offers a double bed a seating area desk and a balcony with a seating area too.    The reception were generous and allowed me a late checkout after I overslept from the effects of the previous night's partying.

Es Saadi Palace is conveniently located right in the heart of Marrakech only 15 minutes drive from the airport a short walk away from Medina and Souk and yet it's far enough for one to feel truly in a resort surrounded by palm trees.  Magnificent property beautifully designed very comfortable and spacious accommodation stunning Dior Institute and Spa wonderful pool very impressive art display all around.  Fabulous service very attentive but not overwhelming discreet genuine and very welcoming. Very nicely maintained cleanliness to the highest standards.  Very good food. Great selection at breakfast buffet.  It's truly a fantastic spot all year round. We stayed at the end of November and the weather was fantastic sunny but not too hot (27 Celsius). For anyone looking for a few sunny days in the middle of winter - simply a perfect choice.  I'm a hotelier myself and I highly recommend it !

Review_Date: Kevin G wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: We stayed in one of the Ksars in the garden of the palace. A beautiful place to relax with plenty of space and peace. Very comfortable and great service.    Location is brilliant with close proximity to the old Medina some of the best restaurants and a busy casino.    We highly recommend this place

Review_Title: New to trip advisor but was so good i came back to write a review
Review_Text: This hotel was literally the best hotel ive ever stayed in! After currently being conned into what i thought was a 5 star hotel i decided to write a review of how good this hotel was! The people were amazing and to this day i still have contact with some staff members
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When a hotel uses words like refinement unique sumptuous exquisite distinguished contemporary ultimate and exotic in its marketing brochures your expectations are high. Many don‚Äôt deliver on promises but The Palace in the Es Saadi Gardens and Resort possibly could have used even more superlatives. I loved my time her in the heart of Hivernage. A few days was not enough! The grand lobby began my impression as did the heartfelt welcome of a staff so obviously trained in the specifics of treating guests as family. Looking around the lobby the first thing I saw was an abundance of green and blue. I was taught the colors of green and blue should never be seen together; yet in the lobby lounge bar area fireside where you can relax in a space of refinement and contentment with a gin and tonic or Moroccan tea the combination of these two colors in tiles fabrics and soft furnishings are as warm and inviting as a Berber welcome to the Sahara.    There are three floors of generous-size rooms all with balconies that look over the Palace's gardens of palms citrus and lush lawn surrounding an over-sized swimming pool with its novel architecture of bridges that take you to the central Island Bar where one drink usually becomes two because of the friendly persuasions of the bar waiter. Children will love this pool. With your balcony doors wide open you can lie in bed and look out toward the snow-peaked Atlas Mountains. I did this one morning and somehow my morning became my afternoon. My reward was a peace and calm I‚Äôd forgotten how to taste because of the white noise of my busy life.    Each floor of The Palace has a different color theme. Ruby Red. Majorelle Blue. Fresh Mint Green. I stayed on the red floor. The walls of the wide passageway leading to rooms are adorned with modern vibrant art from all over Africa. A gallery exists with even more art of the first floor and is well worth your time. Each suite has its own unique majestic entrance of beautiful hand-carved or hand-painted doors made from reclaimed cedar with intricate exquisite designs adorned with raised three dimensional brass carvings and embellishments of camel bone and lacquer-aged to produce an antique appearance. Large knockers give the doors a Moorish touch. Even before entering my room the word opulent hardly seems enough!    Once inside my room everything was as the marketing brochure had promised. Extras like full bar fridge of water and soft drinks espresso machine with coffee capsules vases full of stunning roses a plate of decadent sweets a bowl of fresh fruits and in the bathroom black soap and scrub mitts was a signal that this hotel was big on small details.    A substantial breakfast fir for royalty was included in my package. I ate it in the garden but just as easily it could have been delivered to my room. All manner of breads decadent cakes (I particularly loved the mini-cheesecakes) pancakes and pastries as well as freshly squeezed juices a cooked breakfast of my choosing and the best coffee began another great day in Marrakech. This accommodation is perfect for the solo traveler a couple celebrating a honeymoon or special anniversary or for a family holiday. I hope I can find many reasons to return to this accommodation.

We actually booked a room in the Es Saadi hotel and got upgraded to the Palace where the rooms are double the size and the garden pool and spa are infinitely better. It was a really lovely place to stay light (some Moroccan hotels seem to value living in very low light) spacious attentive staff. I couldn't fault it! Really enjoyed the collection of contemporary Moroccan art on all the walls.

I loved it all:  the palace: very beautiful but not pretentious  the location: walking distance from the center  the room: a beautiful junior suite overlooking the garden & the huge piscine and soundproof  and most of all the service: at times a bit slow but otherwise smily courteous and efficacious  I have only one regret I did not have time to visit their moroccan art gallery but i will be back!

Substantial and comfortable room. Awesome breakfast under palm trees opposite the pool. A good base and comfortable and convenient.  The art exhibition is worth a visit and there are also interesting pictures and artefacts throughout the building.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirsten M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Make 5 days feel like forever at this amazing Resort!
Review_Text: Es Saadi ticked all the boxes when I looked it online we emailed the reservation department big shout out to Lamia Alfa who was just awesome and so on the ball we chopped and changed our dates due to flights and delays so thank you Lamia we will be back oh also ... when after all the hassle you were more than happy to book us in the best room with the best price.    A family owned resort that the likes of Leo Di Caprio has visited.. who are we to judge when they have put the family have put their heart and soul into this hotel and resort!    We stayed at the Palace and what an apt name this was everything a Palace should be the service impeccable and the rooms traditionally gorgeous. I have nothing bad to say about the beautiful place only that no matter how much time you have there you will be sad to leave.    The staff make you feel like family and the location and buildings make you feel like you are a Prince or Princess. The Spa is something I have never experienced and Ive seen a lot of Spas in my time but this is something else surrounding an old tree respecting nature and a nod to the merge of city life and wildlife wild birds soar through the skies as you sip chilled drinks on you sun lounger admiring the lagoon the biggest in Marrakech and also this hotel was the location where they filmed 'The Night Manager' so all you film buffs out there this ones for you..    I have no comments or concern just that as soon as I get the chance ill be back!!!    I would love to thank all the staff and management who made my stay and made it so relaxing and comfortable you guys truly are awesome my favourite hotel...im wearing my complimentary slippers as I write this.    P.S THE BREAKFAST IS AWESOME!    K x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Takako A wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Luxury but at the same time so comfortable. Great location. Very elegant hotel. Rooms are very comfortable. Junior suite is big enough for a couple and good space for clothing. Great pools for relaxation. If there is another option of the restaurant it would be even better for casual meal. We will go back there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John t wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: A great choice very very good
Review_Text: This was a lucky pick the 'palace' is all suites whereas the Es Saadi Hotel (next door) mostly standard rooms. Well worth the extra to have more space everywhere.The service and friendliness are unsurpassed. Unsurprisingly the big pool is called 'the Lagoon' 20C smaller heated pool 26C. Proper mattressed Sunbeds. Breakfast very good mixture of buffet and table service.  Quibbles? Of course. Two Restaurants very upmarket Morrocan in The Palace and an upmarket French in the Hotel. Almost too good for every night. Another option would be great.A hotel of this quality should have coffee facilities in the room. But we can't wait to go back it's that good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The paradise on the Earth. Very good hotel. There is a lovely woman at there on the name of FATIHA she is so lovely she will do anything she can for guests and she is so kind. We stayed at one of their imaginary villas and the quality of service was very good. The staffs are well trained and specialist on their part. Hope to come back soon

Review_Title: First impressions are not always right
Review_Text: Driving to the Es Saadi we passed the Sofitel where many luxury cars were parked and which looks impressive from the outside and arrived at our hotel which looked rather run down in comparison. Bad choice we thought. But we were proven wrong.    The inside looks like a luxury hotel with the ambiance of an Arab palace. The decor of the rooms is more classical Italian but nice. They are very large not only our suite but also the regular rooms. Everything was in working order. W-LAN is free and very fast. Excellent housekeeping. A few nice suprises here and there that are signs of good hospitality.    Service varies depending on the wait staff. The wait for the food around the pool can be quite long at times. Service during breakfast is spotty too and some of the staff. ould be a bit more friendly. On the other hand dinner service at the excellent Cour de Lions is very good. Same applies to El Saadi at the Saadi Hotel.    The Spa is large and nice with a lot of different Sauna options. And the pool is very large as well and nicely laid out.    All in all we had a very enjoyable stay. If you are looking for an Arab style grand hotel in walking distance to the main square but with a spacious resort feeling the El Saadi Palace ranks among the top choices in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Howard B wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Went for a long weekend and these would be our key observations    Positives    - lovely large clean pool with no chemicals  - nice large rooms but missing coffee and tea  - gardens are well kept relaxing with lots of shade if need it  - nice Moroccan restaurant had excellent meal  - Hotel location good as can walk in to the old part if want to but not too noisy at night    Negatives    - no drinks on arrival a miss for first impressions ....left hanging about to process passports and credit cards    - breakfast fairly basic in choice and random process to be seated or not. Seems staff have to rush in and out of building to get everything making service ineffective    - gym was very warm and air conditioning not working    - main gripe was the food and drinks service around the pool. Had to wait 30 mins for drinks to arrive having to order twice. Next day went to order directly from the bar and still 15 mins to get drinks. Lots of staff with headphones but shocking service. Again having staff run over bridges to get back to the bar a poor design if want better service. No one asked us for a drink while we sat round the pool for 3 days.    - managers in suits stroll around looking like FBI agents but don't seem to notice the obvious frustrations of the customers    In summary it is a nice hotel let down by poor service outside not helped by poor design layout with staff having to walk too far to get a spoon glass or anything you might need.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our fifth visit to this hotel in the Spring. From the moment you are met at the airport until your return you are truly spoilt. All the staff go out of their way to look after you. Breakfast in the magnificent gardens is a delight with so many things to choose from. The suites are comfortable and large. The gardens are beautifully kept with warm extensive swimming pools. The gastronomic restaurant has a very varied menu and excellent service. In short although Marrakech centre is within walking distance with so much to see it is hard to drag oneself away from the hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment I arrived with my family we experienced 5 star service. Check in was incredibly smooth a very warm welcome from the reception team. Our bedroom room was exceptional - a huge bedroom with an equally huge bathroom finished to a very high standard. All the staff were very helpful. A special mention to the concierge - who booked and recommend some fantastic restaurants. We ate at the restaurant on the 3rd floor - a truly memorable evening - stunning food with a fantastic view looking out over Marrakech . We all look forward to returning again.

Elegant calm beautiful place to stay in Marrakech. Close to anything you would want to do here (A+ restaurants clubs souk) but a tranquil oasis when you want to slow down. One of the best Spa/Hamam experiences in Morocco.  The staff were welcoming and extremely helpful.

Review_Title: An outstanding stay in a palace
Review_Text: The Es Saadi resort is a beautifully landscaped 20 acre development including the Palace Hotel Casino and Night Club. The Palace was stylish impressive with superb rooms pool area and gardens. The staff were discreet and extremely helpful. There was only one dining room in the evenings La Cour des Lions which was formal and served only Moroccan food; for a change in menu/formality I used the Gastronomique Restaurant in the Es Saadi Hotel some nights a 3 minute walk.

Review_Date: Ecaterina A wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Great attitude of the staff starting from driver front desk and bar in the lobby  Spa area lovey  we had moroccan hammam  and in the Dior Institute I had face spa and massage amazing  the breakfast was okay  we did enjoy the view in the evening from the restaurant that food could be better  The outside garden and pool are totally like from the story's with Scheherazade 1001 nights :)  Rooms are spectacular lot of space for all you ever wish  Is second time when we came to Marrakech and we enjoy a lot

The restaurant is pretty the service is very attentive the food is very good. So why did I only award three stars to the restaurant? The reason is that even though smoking is not allowed they still allowed it which is not only disgusting but a disservice to the other diners. 2 different tables had smokers. When I asked about it the answer was that they have guests who have come here for many years and they don't want to offend them. That's BS.

As part of the Es Saadi resort in Marrakech The Palace offers refined luxury accommodations for guests looking for elegance and culture mixed with comfort and modern amenities. Situated in the heart of Marrakech The Palace is in a perfect location as you‚Äôre close to anything you may need during your stay. And as part of the Es Saadi Resort the Clefs d‚ÄôOr Concierge service is happy to assist guests with anything they may need whether small or detailed.    I had the privilege of spending a night at The Palace which was one of the most luxurious experiences I‚Äôve ever had. Upon arrival I felt like royalty as I gazed upon the beautiful grounds of the property. Filled with luscious greenery and gardens The Palace brings Moroccan influence to the forefront.    The staff was incredibly helpful and super friendly. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a warmer welcome when I checked-in and I really felt comfortable.    I stayed in a junior suite which was intimate and cozy. The suite even had a rivate terrace which provided a spectacular view of the Atlas Mountains. The terrace was furnished which made sitting and enjoying the sights comfortable.    My booking allowed me unlimited access to the Oriental Thermae a detoxifying array of different baths and a truly unique experience. From differed steam baths to an ice fountain to a sauna and other spa chambers the music colors and scents of the Orient take relaxation to a new level.    The bathroom featured real marble which really added an air of sophistication and luxury. I enjoyed a refreshing soak in the tub and then made myself comfortable in the king-size bed. Probably the best night sleep I‚Äôve gotten in a long time!    I loved the included breakfast in the morning as the buffet was filled with delicious pastries and other hot/cold offerings. The Es Saadi Palace is the best place for a relaxing oasis of elegance within the center of the city. There‚Äôs nothing more I could have wanted from my stay as the service and accommodations were outstanding!

Review_Date: Paul L wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: A stunning place you won't want to leave.
Review_Text: I stayed here recently with my wife for a weekend break. What a fantastic place - everything was perfect from the free airport limo pickupthe mint tea on arrival the stunning decor the beautiful room the ever-helpful staff the fantastic pool and restaurantsthe spa....I could go on and on. This has to rank amongst the best hotels that I have visited anywhere inthe world - I could not fault it in any way. It goes without saying that the next time we feel like a weekend break the Es Saadi Palace will be at the top of our list.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just spent 4 wonderful nights in the Es Saadi palace. From the pick up from the airport the stay was excellent. A lovely hotel that was spotlessly clean. Staff were very polite and attentive to our every need. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was excellent each morning with a very good selection. Hotel staff arranged a guide to the old town and a trip to the Atlas Mountains. They made our stay in Marrakesh memorable. Highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: beautiful gardens and pool, great service
Review_Text: Spent a fantastic past week here. Service was great - quick check in/out helpful and polite staff very good restaurants on the grounds (though expensive as many seem to be in this area). Highlights of the hotel are the huge suites with balconies and the stunning gardens - full of palm trees orange trees rose bushes and beautiful pools. Loved the outdoor heated pool. Would definitely come back here. The hotel is beautifully designed as well with a stunning lobby and even an art exhibition upstairs. The indoor pool is nice too although they often had the many different steam rooms off well before the pool closed - but minor complaint.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marion A wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: We stayed in a suite in The Palace and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a wonderful view of the pool and gardens with Atlas Mountains beyond. We found the service excellent and the breakfast was superb with a huge range of pastries each day and wonderful pancakes. The restaurant manager went out of his way to ensure we had everything we needed and introduced us to the local delicacies. The hotel was in a great location and I would definitely visit again and recommend it. We ate in both restaurants and although the food was of a high standard we did feel that the prices were quite high and not really any options for children. It would have been good to have the option of a simpler or cheaper menu.

Review_Title: Great location, Need a better breakfast selection!
Review_Text: Great location! Very easy to Get into Jemaa Al Fina and 5 mins walk to Koutobia Mosque!  Exchange your Pounds in the Casino - great rates!!    Our room was very clean and dressed up daily!  Only complaint is the breakfast options were fairly limited!    The reception staff were very helpful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Liza F wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Great service lovely facilities and garden outstanding art collection spa and organic food menu. Very welcoming. Great location. Quiet but central. Spacious. Unusual devoration. Oppulent lobby. Great interior design.

Review_Date: Andr√©s R wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Wonderful hotel I tried for the first time
Review_Text: I enjoyed a short stay at the Es Saadi Palace Hotel. Service was excellent rooms were spacious and more like suites than deluxe average hotel rooms. All the amenities one could want and an excellent buffet breakfast in the Lobby dining room. I didn't have the opportunity of using the pool spa or casino but all are available to hotel guests.

Review_Date: Garion D wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: The most amazing hotel I have stayed in to date. The staff were amazing and really went the extra mile even ordering a cake and doing up the room for a 21st birthday. The room was spectacular with more than you could ever need. The pools (outside and inside) are exquisite and beautifully lit the downstairs spa was incredible with an incredible range of saunas and showers for every need. Breakfasts in the morning are delicious every day. The hotel really takes care of its guests from larger requests to the small things like making sure you have a glass of water and a cookie next to your bed every night. All this within a very convenient distance to the bustling nightlife clubs and casinos as well as the busy markets and old Medina of Marrakech so that you can still have the true Morrocan experience and see both sides of this wonderful city. I would recommend it to anybody.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed anywhere in the world the staff are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble the smallest details taken care of the suites are amazing the views of snow capped the Atlas Mountains breathtaking the food was amazing and the spa one of the best. The overall I would fully recommend staying here if your visiting Marrakesh. I will certainly be coming back.

Review_Date: J P wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: excellent facilities with a wonderful room for a 5 night stay. great position fairly close to Medina and easy walk. only downside was only one restaurant open at Palace in winter and we used room service as there are not many other choices close by. menu for room service not very extensive. concierge very helpful organising tours for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First class great service very secure staff are lovely empowered chatty beautiful suite and nicely outside of the effervescent central souk to chill relax in the ace spa before diving back in for more barter!!! You will love the serenity of the Es Saadi Palaceenjoy we did
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nadia w wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: I'm a globetrotter and this hotel was one of the best hotels I have ever visited. Location was very good poolarea was excellent service was top the food was amazing and everything was excellent I will be back soon

Review_Date: Tina M wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Amazing setting for an inspiring event.  The service at the Palace was excellent friendly and helpful. Rooms garden and pool just the perfect place to be if you are looking for a bit relaxing time between your adventures into the vivid Center of Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Olga V wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Had a wonderful stay! Staff was very friendly and helpful. From the start until the departure we have been treated exceptionally! The maroccon restaurant with an amazing view was very good! Pool area is super beautiful! Big thank you to the restaurant manager who made my friend Birthday surprise superb specially birthday song and if you have any allergies defiantly if you will say about them the day before you will try all dishes which catched your eyes on the menu then:)

Review_Title: Very Nice Hotel with a few quirks
Review_Text: We have stayed in Riads in the heart of the Medina in previous trips to Marrakesh so this was a different experience. Obviously the grounds were more spacious the rooms airier  the pool much bigger than anything you would find in side the walled city. All of that was very nice and Es Saadi Resort is well placed among a number of the top end hotels and perhaps slightly better value for the money. On the down side we were about a 15 minute walk to Jamaa el Fnaa. We loved the Es Saadi location when we were going out of town to play golf but found it less appealing when we wanted to spend the day in the Medina. For anyone who has been to the Marrakesh Medina it is a daunting and exhausting experience. On those days we wished we were in a charming Riad within 5 minutes of our wanderings...usually carrying bags or even a rug.  But that is not a negative about Es Saadi which was an oasis when we finally made it back. The Staff were friendly and helpful which was useful since we had an electrical problem and lost lights for several hours.

Great event thanks to Andrea bury . 2017 will be a must if you are looking for inspiring people and good conversations .perfect location to make Summer a bit longer ..just have a look at the programme yourself

BEWARE! I booked this hotel through trip advisor and Cancelon. My email confirmation stated the reservation was confirmed at the Es Saadi Palace but when we arrived they said our reservation was for the other hotel. After waiting several hours while Cancelon and the hotel discussed the situation they took us to our room. I specifically asked if I had to pay any more money. They assured me all was fine and I did not owe anything. At this moment I am trying to check out and they will not allow us to leave because they want us to pay alot more money.

Es Saadi Palace is an oasis in the heart of Marrakech!!  Strategically located moments away from the hustle and bustle but very close to everything you want to do.  The main building itself is a memorial of architecture with a very nice garden and a swimming pool that it takes your breath away.  But the biggest value is it's people.  Every single one from the staff is friendly and helpful always with a big smile.  Taking this opportunity I would like to thank the reception staff and especially Mr Mohsine Mohamed who made our stay there dreamy from the very first time  Truly the definition of hospitality!!!    Aris Tranakas

Pretty hard to explain how amazing the experience of staying here is. The property is just unreal in terms of architecture and history and the service and amenities match. A must-stay in place if you're heading to Marrakech.

Review_Title: Wonderful setting with a huge garden
Review_Text: Would stay here again big rooms very elegant. Food is nice. The buffet breakfast is very special small but only special delicacies. Huge garden with swimming pools friendly service. Good location.

There was an event going on at the sister hotel so our room was moved to the Palace. Right away upon entering the grand lobby way I had a hunch that we were in one of the most gorgeous hotels in Marrakech.  i have NEVER in my life been so blown away by a hotel room. Not one detail was spared in decoration accommodation cleanliness etc. The minute we walked into the room I was taken aback by the size and luxury of the space. We slept soundly on the magnificent beds had wonderful showers enjoyed the black soap and the really appreciated the fresh roses in the room. We absolutely loved every second.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel and gardens are beautiful and staff are friendly and helpful. We'll located away from the hussle but still very close to everything. Only issues were the strange hard pillows lack of top sheet on the bed and the shower that did not work very well. Staff fixed the problem to some degree very quickly

I went to the Palace for New Years Eve. The food was fabulous although the service was slightly slow given the night of the year. Altogether much better value than La Mamounia or the other 5* restaurants with similar menus for the night

Review_Date: Jonny G wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Luxurious Palace with beautiful gardens, walkable to Medina
Review_Text: We stayed in the Palace in a corner suite which was more like an apartment. Unique rooms and decor which you'll be familiar with if you saw BBC's 'The Night Manager'.  Food and drinks expensive but you're paying for the surroundings and excellent service. If you want a quick and dirty meal then Extrablatt is 3 minutes walk around the corner.  You can walk to The Medina in 20 minutes with plenty of other hotels and bars on the way if you need a pit stop but the cabs were only 50dirhams in any case.  There's a cash point in the lobby offering decent exchange rates.  This is an excellent hotel providing a quiet and calm oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We did not stay here but visited the main bar and restaurant having been inspired by a recent BBC drama. The restaurant was wonderful. An extensive menu in French with lots of choice of wines and drinks. The food was exquisite and the presentation was mouth watering. Very attentive staff. I was even given a small table for my handbag rather than put it under the table. We had a small tour of the ground floor of this hotel and were taken by the pool and grounds. So much so that we are considering a stay here in the near future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ahmed R wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Mr Ahmed Raza and Mrs Rubina Raza
Review_Text: The hotel Es Saadi was absolutely amazing  it had beautiful gardens and swimming pools. The room we had was so lovely and comfortable. The entire hotel was stunning and we thoughly enjoyed our stay.  The staff were very nice and helpful at all times. The breakfast spread was wonderful and had so much choice.  We would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to going again.

I would like to thank all the staff of the hotel. They have been polite at my disposal and very professional. At my arrival they upgrade my room. I have booked a superior suite and they gave me a villa with private pool (villa la favorite) that was absolutely astonishing. Our private butler has been amazeing he satisfied every request.  The hotel in general is very beautiful with wonderful gardens and very big halls. The Spa is enourmous and my treament has been very relaxing.  Also the position of the hotel was perfect just fifteen minutes by walking from the main square.  I will defenetevly come back.

Review_Date: Mark G wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Beautiful place with very friendly staff. We got executive which had to single beds pushed together which made trying to sleep horrible. Food and drink in the palace completely over priced. The thermal spa suite had a lot of rooms not working. My guess is there not really bothered by people staying this time of year. We will return to Marrakech but not to Es Saadi gardens palace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Recommendable very nice hotel in the Moroccan style. We had a large room overlooking the pool. Room also the bathroom very clean and nicely furnished. Friendly and competent staff which is not so obvious in Marrakech. Very nice and large swimming pool beautiful gardens where you can rest. Food was just excellent. The location is also very good. I would recommend this hotel to people who like oriental friendly atmosphere and excellent food! I cordially greet the nice man serving Moroccan tea in the hotel lobby! Thank you guys we had very pleasant stay at your hotel!

Review_Date: SHANI P wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: The Palace was a great start to our vacation in Morocco
Review_Text: We enjoyed our 2 nights' stay at the Palace. Absolutely everything has been thought of. On Arrival we were seated in the lobby and offered mint tea and Moroccan cookies. It is a lovely property and well maintained.    The staff was nice courteous and helpful. It is a lovely property and well maintained.  We were very happy with the quality of the room was excellent possibly one of the best rooms we have ever stayed in. Spacious and the quality of the furnishings were excellent; lovely soft sheets towels and bathrobes (felt new). We loved the bathroom with large bath and rain shower with marble bench. Also included a great range of shower gels shampoo body scrub etc.    In terms of food breakfast was very good. They served a few traditional Moroccan dishes fresh fruit pastries etc. We ordered room service because we were trying to wind down after such a long flight my fianc√© and I loved the lamb tagine but everything else was disappointing - limited choices and food not up to the mark (what you would expect from a high end hotel like this) and it was very expensive.    On our second day we woke up to a flooded bathroom. The bidet was spewing water everywhere when we woke up. They managed to get it fixed fairly quickly and the staff was helpful.    One of the highlights of this trip for my better half was the gym. Very modern and was equipped with everything he needed.    We spent both nights in the Egyptian Bar where we met an extremely kind and welcoming bartender name Youssef. He and his boss made us specialty drinks and conversed with us for hours about Morocco and gave us great tips!    We wanted to have a night out to visit a well-known restaurant within the Medina. Concierge called us a taxi and told us that the restaurant was a 15 min. walk from where the driver could drop us and that the driver would walk us. Once we got in the taxi the driver started showing us other restaurants on the way. He said it wasn‚Äôt safe to walk at night (we found out later in the week that we were very safe to walk around at 9 pm and did it for our last few days). Long story short after going back to Es Saadi he told the concierge that he was taking us to a different restaurant that was closer. This restaurant is a place where Taxi drivers get commission for bringing in patrons and the food was not great. The concierge was actually surprised that he took us there as this was not the place he was told we were going to.    All in all the staff should be aware of shady taxi drivers especially those that they call upon for the hotels patrons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bettina B wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Our 3th time in Marrakech and our 1th time at Es Saadi Palace. We had the most fantastic stay and we really love this hotel. Everything was great; the airport transfer the suites swimmingpools one of these are nice heated spa tennis breakfast and most of all the beautiful park and all the people who works there especially in the reception area/lobby. Top service at all! 10 minutes by car to both old or new town and about 25 minutes by walk. Thanks for all to ES Saadi Palace - we will definitely get back!

Review_Date: Ritu S wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: We enjoyed our 4 nights' stay at the hotel. It is a lovely property and well maintained. The staff were nice courteous and helpful.    In terms of food breakfast is a amazing and you enjoy both indoor and outdoor seating (by the pool). We ate dinner on day 1 in one of their restaurants. It was very tasty but expensive. We ordered through room service one night as we were too tired to go out and that was disappointing - limited choices and food not up to the mark (what you would expect from a high end hotel like this). On our last day there was some problem with water supply in our block with no water available for approx 2 hours. They managed to get it fixed fairly quickly and the staff were helpful. They let us check out slightly later without any fuss.

We visited Marrakesh in Feb 16 after reading most of the reviews here we decided on the Es Saddi Palace and Gardens.  We expected this hotel to be one of the better ones in Marrakesh as it was to cost over ‚Ç¨4000 for a one week stay.    On Arrival we were seated in the lobby and offered mint tea the lobby seemed quite dated and some of the seating is grubby and not up to 5 star stadard. We were upgraded to the Ksar suites which was a nice surprise as they were very spacious (as you would expect if you paid the advertised price of ‚Ç¨10000!!)    We ate dinner in the hotels gourmet restaurant on the Tuesday night and found it very disappointing and overpriced. The service was extremely poor and most of the dishes arrived at the table cold. The guest beside us an elderly gentleman from England was extremely upset by the way he was being treated and how he was being ignored after waiting over an hour for his dinner. It came out cold and he had to send it back. The waitress also insisted that you must order your desert at the beginning of the meal otherwise you can‚Äôt get desert. this was also clearly written on the menu‚Ä¶.Bizarre requirement in a 5 star hotel restaurant.    We ate lunch most days in the Palace restaurant and found the staff were lovely and couldn‚Äôt do enough to help you. Just don‚Äôt order a bowl of plain pasta for a child as you will be charge ‚Ç¨19.    My biggest complaint about this hotel is the reception staff and the Concierge.  We were checking out on our last day and our transportation was outside ready to take us to the Airport. We could not locate one of our room keys  so we asked the staff to check the room as we were sure we had left it behind. They insisted that we empty all of our suitcases to look for the key before we could leave. We searched our cases as best you can in a hotel luggage area we also took great care checking all of the children‚Äôs hand luggage. I promised the concierge that I would post the key back to him if it turned up in one of our cases when we arrived home. When we said we couldn‚Äôt find it the Concierge said we must pay 1200 Dhirams (approx. ‚Ç¨120) . I at this point asked to speak to the manager.  I found this extremely unusual that a hotel would look for such an extortionate amount of money for a lost key. I understand it had a fancy key ring (which I am sure you could get in any Souk for under ‚Ç¨5) .  We were not allowed leave the hotel and they refused to let us load our suitcases into our waiting taxi until we paid 1200 Dhirams (aprox ‚Ç¨120).  When I insisted on taking my suitcases I was physically prevented by doing so as one of the porters tried to drag the cases back. Eventually the manager came out to speak with me just as I had finally managed to get my cases to the front door.  She basically accused us of stealing the room key as the concierge kept repeating ‚Äúyou have the key you have the key‚Äù .  I had just spent over 57000 Dhirams (‚Ç¨5700)in their hotel‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.why would I steal a key that would be no use to me!!!!    They eventually allowed us to leave on the promise we would post the key back if we found it. On our return the key turned up in a childs coat pocket buried at the bottom of a suitcase. We have since posted it back.    For reception staff of a 5 star Hotel to detain a family with small children in this way against their will while running the risk of them missing their flight and causing them great distress would lead to instant dismissal in any western country.    You have been warned stay away.

Review_Date: Jennifer V wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: This really is a palace! Absolutely everything has been thought of. There are a few restaurants with different types of food all of which are lovely. The service is the best I've ever had. The lagoon is massive and stunning but it isn't heated so was a bit cold when we went but there is a very large heated pool too. We went with our young son and wanted to go to the casino so the hotel arranged a babysitter on two occasions for us and both times they sent lovely ladies. We stayed in a garden duplex and the room was again probably the best hotel room I've ever stayed in. They put fresh petals on the floor every day and when they turn down the room they left a bottle of water by the bed. The grounds were lovely and very large it took about 1520 minutes to walk around the whole hotel. I can't wait to return!

Review_Date: LINDA J wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: We spend 5 days in this fantastic hotel. The staff was very kind and helpfull. Never seen a bigger and more beautiful room in a hotel before. The Breakfast was delicious with lots of choices and the presentation of the food was lovely.  It's great after spending time in the Medina to come back "home" in the hotel and to relax in the sun at the swimmingpool and the spa.  The hotel is situated very well nice restaurants bars in the neighborhood and it is just a short walk to the Medina.  We definitely come back!

Review_Date: Stefano P wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: We spent a long week end at Es Saadi Palace (22/25 January). I reserved a Junior Suite and when we arrived at the hotel we had a free upgrade for a beautiful pool view executive suite. Everything was perfect. The accomodation awesome and the food great. The weather was fantastic (28 celsius on January) and we went for a swim in the beautiful swimmingpool . All the staff was very kind with us. In few words: Go there if you are planning to stay in Marrakech!!! We will be back for sure!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great service staff very polite and helpful. Fantastic hotel with children. At the swimming pool the staff very helpful with the children preserving the safety and security.Heated exterior swimming pool.  Near the City Center / Medina.  The Concierge really helpful booked and advised several restaurants help with information to our exits.  Do not miss a visit to the SPA however the the treatments are quite expensive.  The minus is the Breakfast really plain and simple comparing wiht the Hotel quality and luxury. On may personal opinion the breakfast quality and diversity really underexpectation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lindsey M wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Having booked an Atlas View Suite in the hotel we were 'upgraded ' on arrival to a suite in the palace. It was beautifully appointed and maintained but soundproofing was not good between rooms and floors.    Prior to our arrival we had booked a 'cosy and romantic' gala dinner in the hotel's restaurant for New Year's Eve. A live wannabe rock band was not what we expected or wanted! So that was very disappointing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew V wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: I took my wife and 4month old baby to the Es Saadi Palace for some winter sun in early December for 8 nights. It was very quiet with what seemed only a handful of other guests. Overall we were very happy with our stay and will definitely consider returning.    The room:  We were given a substantial upgrade to a deluxe duplex suite and we were very happy with the quality of the room was excellent possibly one of the best rooms we have ever stayed in. Spacious and the quality of the furnishings was excellent; lovely soft sheets towels and bathrobes (felt new). We loved the bathroom with large bath and rain shower with marble bench. Also included a great range of shower gels shampoo body scrub etc.    The hotel:  Nicely decorated with a traditional feel and a nice atmosphere. The grounds are large luscious and very green and a nice place to have a walk with the baby. Some nice market style boutiques are located within these grounds if you want to purchase gifts/ souvenirs. A very high level of security can make you feel at ease when inside but will also mean you can get an overly intimate frisk search if you return from a walk outside the hotel.    The staff:  Very friendly and helpful always greeted with a friendly and welcoming approach by all within the resort except the front entrance security.    The food and drinks:    Breakfast was always a buffet with freshly cooked egg options available. Whilst it was not a large selection mainly due to how quiet the hotel was but there was still many options and it was always nicely presented. I think the content of the breakfast depended on the occupancy at the time    For dinner the hotel has two main restaurants fro dinner the expensive cours de lions restaurant in the palace and the more reasonable french restaurant I forget the name in the hotel part. We ate dinner twice at both restaurants and had excellent food and service in both except the french restaurant feels dated. I should add the quality of the meat is excellent.    Lunches were always eaten in the Palace restaurant by the pool which was very expensive by comparison to the dinner but the quality of the food and service was always excellent.    Pool Area:  They have a smaller outside heated pool 28c and a massive unheated one. the main pool area is stunning with a central bar island. perfect place to relax catch some sun and have a swim. They made some awesome drinks especially their kiwichitos.    The Spa:  the palace has its own internal spa and then an oriental spa within the hotel. the spa within the palace is without a doubt the most expensive spa I have ever been to and when i say been toi mean looked at the prices and thought no chance of going there at all. Decided to use the other option oriental spa in the hotel part as was more reasonably priced about half the price of the other but that felt dated and the walk between the two locations meant we didn't go more than once.    Overall Cost:  This is the most expensive hotel/ resort we have ever stayed. We did a full room and board and only ate out once and food drinks tax bill came to just over ¬£300 per day for us. However everything was of a 5* quality and when you pay c.¬£20 for a club sandwich and more for a burger you expect it to be very very good and it was. So be warned it is massively expensive horrifically so when you consider the price of restaurants in the town BUT if you want to be pampered and you are not watching what you are spending then you cant help but love it.

Review_Date: Ida S wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: I had an amazing 4 days at Es Saadi and I can really recommend the hotel to anybody travelling to Marrakech.  Great service very polite and helpful staff. All in all: best hotel I have ever visited. ;)

I booked directly with the hotel by phone as we had certain needs that weren't addressed by booking sites. The reservation team were great and the welcome on arrival was first class (thank you Loubna and the team!). In order to accommodate our requests we were given a lovely room generously adorned with vases of roses.    The hotel is beautifully decorated well laid out and easy to navigate. The extended gardens are quite wonderful and include boutiques villas and a palace branch of the hotel that is veritably luxurious.    The city facing rooms did suffer somewhat from external noise throughout the night although I personally barely noticed it and had two very good nights' sleep.    The staff were very good overall despite the hotel's status the service was warm courteous and friendly.

Review_Date: Brigid S wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I visited Marrakech Morocco in September and stayed at this hotel. The experience felt like a scene from the Arabian nights. The hotel is luxurious while staying authentic to the environment. The service was exemplary. The only concern we had was with the fact that the walls are quite thin consequently the noise from the rooms above and next door travels quite clearly.

Review_Date: Ines H wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Es Saadi in October 2015 (two families with two children) and are regular guests there. We are always warmly greeted by a staff that stays the same over the years which makes the guests feel like at home. The reception is very professional and reacts quickly to the guests' requests. The magnificent gardens are complemented by beautifully designed and huge suites. Food breakfast bars and restaurant are all high quality and swimming pools sparkling clean and enormous.  Overall we highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing stay in a spaceous place while remaining close to the city center.  Many thanks to Karima the chief receptionist who makes our stay wonderful each time.  Ines H Pully Suisse

After 3 days of travelling to arrive in Marrakech we arrived at our oasis. As tired as we were the foyer was breathtaking.  The following day We spent a couple of hours just exploring the hotel and grounds and enjoying the beautiful pool area. The gardens are beautifully maintained with masses of roses and orange trees.  Where else would you find a gym with chandeliers.  Delicious cakes and fresh fruit were in our room together with complimentary bottled water.  Our suite was extensive including a walk in closet lounges balcony and a large modern bathroom strewn with rose petals.  An amazing place to regenerate before exploring morocco so take time to enjoy the facilities.  Free wifi and pillow menu is available.  The hotel spa is a luxury In beautiful surroundings that should not be missed.  The indoor pool built around an ancient eucalypt tree is a wonderful sight.  Service while always polite is in the restaurant is slightly less than you'd expect in a hotel of its class.  Only recommendation for improvement is some coffee and tea making facility in the room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A palace that is due to upgrade
Review_Text: Hotel: local 5 stars all suites hotel; next door is es saadi garden hotel normal hotel rooms; divided by oldest casino in between 3 properties are belongs to same family  Location: quite ok about 15 mins walk to latest small shopping mall--menara mall; 15 to 20mins walk to old town--medina  Bellman n reception: good service friendly n polite  Room: very big about 60 to 70 sq m! Dated but well maintained; no coffee/tea making facilities; WIFI quite weak n not stable; bed quite comfy but pillow too small n thin; bad sound isolation can hear next door talking; no drinking water provided until turn down service  Bathroom: very big wz bathtub; organic toiletries ( according to d manager but not written on bottle); strong water pressure  Facilities: varieties of steam baths (lavender eucalyptus herbal leaves) free for palace hotel; heated swimming pool

Review_Date: Nicki D wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: When we arrived at the Es Saadi Resort we were told that we had been upgraded for free to the Palace which was a wonderful start to our holiday. The hotel was absolutely superb and helpful with everything from directions to lending us things we had forgotten (adapter etc). The outdoor and indoor pool complexes were beautiful and very clean and breakfast was amazing. It really made our holiday perfect and I would thoroughly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Palace section of Es Saadi was absolutely flawless. We went for a relaxing 5 days and got exactly that. The staff could not have been more helpful the rooms were beautiful spacious (Junior Suite) and comfortable. Pillow menu two cleans a day with turndown service water in the room each evening etc. Breakfast was great. We have dinner in the Moroccan restaurant one evening very quiet so atmosphere was not the best but food excellent. Pool area is extremely relaxing - great loungers and bed pods. Very good location for Hivernage which has some cool restaurants and bars a 5 minute walk away. Taxis into the old town 50 dirham.

Review_Date: Khalil K wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: The rooms are old and the facilities in the room are poor. The hotel has a nice garden with beautiful green area and trees. The palace is a nice addition with the nice Moroccan tea and Arabic singer in the lobby. The spa was very nice with a very cool waterbed relaxation area on the top floor. The hotel is a close walk to nearby cafes and nightlife.

Spent 5 nights in this aptly named palace. Our suite was beautiful and traditionally appointed with views over the pool and manicured gardens to the Atlas Mountains. Staff were friendly and helpful and the whole experience was 1st class. The location was perfect just a brief walk to the Medina but an oasis of calm at the end of a day in the souks.

Review_Date: Robert B wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Very peaceful with excellent rooms but ice cold pool
Review_Text: The rooms were definitely 5 star and compare better than other 5 star hotels we have stayed at in Marrakech. The reception on arrival is perfunctory and could be more informative but you sense immediately an overwhelmingly peaceful atmosphere. The bar can seat 150 but there was only 4 of us there in the evenings. The Hotel (A walk across the gardens from the Palace) is run down and not worth the visit which leaves evening meals a problem since there is only one restaurant in the Palace serving Moroccan food - most 5 stars include a choice of restaurants within the hotel. The main issue is the temperature of the pool water which is not warm enough to describe as heated. Overall a good experience with the room the highlight - with warmer pool water this would be the perfect place for 'recharging the batteries'
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My review of this hotel is not as positive as the other reviewers im afraid. I find it rather jaded throughout but readers I am staying in the gardens as part of a package deal. Its clean enough but not impressively so the food is just about ok there is nothing outstanding served for breakfast or dinner the staff are friendly amd helpful. There is a pool which is well tended and the resort is within easy reach of the Medina by taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dean C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: best hotel i stayed at on 5 week trip.
Review_Text: Absolutely incredible. This was the best hotel I stayed at during my 5 week holiday in Portugal Spain Gibraltar and Morocco. The rooms was huge and spotless. The food was incredible. The pool was superb. The casino was - well it was a casino. I never won any money. the hotel might be rated as 4 stars but it should be a 5 star. It is not conveniently located as there is a really high end mall about 15 minutes walk away and the other older parts are about 20 to 30 minutes walk away. Taxis are easy to get right at the front door. The housekeeping is spotless and the food excellent - oh I already said that!. WiFi worked in my room. Would love to stay here longer than 3 days next time.

Review_Date: AJ The Player wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: The family run feel is evident throughout!
Review_Text: I would highly recommend the resort. The location is perfect only 10 mins from the airport and a few minutes drive from the Medina and shopping areas. Service is excellent! Food and amenities are superb especially the spa which is well appointed. However on my trip the rain showers were not working. The Casino is well worth a visit especially the al fresco dining section where the food is excellent. The nightclub has to be experienced even midweek it was a great atmosphere. Shisha bar is one of the best I have tried although slightly limited on flavours. The owners are delightful and have a hands on approach which is rare these days. This is the place to stay for a relaxing true Moroccan experience.

There are 2 main buildings: hotel and palace. We went to palace it‚Äôs better one more expansive though. We stayed at the 2d floor with garden view. Great room with high ceiling and good facilities. The gym is fabulous. There were several things of no go though:  1. Pick up from the airport did not work. We were held at the security for 15 h. All other hotels ha their drivers waiting but ours.  2. we went grocery shopping. The concierge hold us at the lobby and told us it is not acceptable to bring own food to the hotel. No go for 5* hotel!! It never happened to us before and have stayed at several 5* hotels around the world.  3. Flash of the toilet did not work we had to wait for 2 days to get it fixed.  4. First day at breakfast ‚Äì we were asked if we would like omelet or other warm stuff. After this day we were never asked again and the waiters were kind of rude. Maybe we were supposed to leave tips to them. Weird  All in all nice stay with couple of slightly unpleasant things
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Only moved out of hotel to eat at restaurant round corner
Review_Text: Being uplifted from airport in a luxury hotel car starts things well!! Heavily ornate in reception the room was fabulously big with a bed to match. The pool and gardens re to die for. Having had a quick walk round the market/souk we just used the pool from dawn to dusk. The Spa is pretty good as well. Only bad point for us was that we were disppointed in restaurant but we found a Great one just round e corner Only a three hour flight from London and with guaranteed sun and heat even in early May we will probably return. Not cheap but worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great stay. Totally relaxing from start to finish.
Review_Text: ‚Ä¢ We live in Morocco and visit Marrakech 3-4 times a year so we know what to expect for our money. I had looked at Es Saadi before but never stayed due to some bad reviews on Booking.com and TripAdvisor. I felt it necessary to write a thorough review after seeing the several negative reviews of this resort.  ‚Ä¢ For those that won‚Äôt read this entire review I can only say that the Es Saadi exceeded our expectations and then some. We will definitely return.  ‚Ä¢ I know that people like to complain about high drink and food prices at hotels including this one. All I can say is that prices for drinks and eating at the hotel were reasonable considering the environment you are staying in and the service you are getting.  ‚Ä¢ It was a fantastic stay from the time we arrived until we left. We paid ~$290/nt for our junior suite and I have to say that for our experience it was worth every cent. I have also stayed in La Mamounia in Marrakech for twice the cost and in my opinion the Es Saadi was a better experience. The pool and garden are magnificent. The resort is not ‚Äúoutdated‚Äù or ‚Äúnot kept up‚Äù as some reviews seem to imply.  ‚Ä¢ We walked in every part of the Palace interior and the d√©cor and fixtures are in excellent condition. Everything was very clean and freshly painted.  ‚Ä¢ Every member of the staff was 100% professional and as courteous as I have ever encountered anywhere in my travels. We were treated like royalty from our arrival at the front door until we were shown to our car at check-out.  ‚Ä¢ Our room was a junior suite of 75m2 (750 ft2) with a garden view. Large marble bath with 2 sinks shower garden tub and a separate changing room. A bedroom/salon area with a very comfortable full king bed with a sofa and table/chair for eating. Nice terrace with room for a chaise and 2 chairs with a great view of the pool area and the mountains beyond.  ‚Ä¢ The pool is huge and the area around the pool is beautiful and well kept. There is an island bar in the middle of the pool for drinks and sandwiches.  ‚Ä¢ The garden has a great walkway among some big trees and flowers that passes by the villas. A nice 20 minute stroll over to the Es Saadi Hotel pool area.  ‚Ä¢ Breakfast offerings were good with great service and a view of the pool.  ‚Ä¢ We had dinner on the terrace at the Couer de Lion Moroccan restaurant. Great service and view and the food met our expectations. Cost for 2 with wine was <$70.  ‚Ä¢ Also had dinner at the Es Saadi Hotel restaurant Restaurant Gatronomique. A nice varied menu and the food and service were again excellent. ~$70.  ‚Ä¢ The Egyptian bar in the Palace had a piano player at night but the bar at the Hotel was more open and lighted and close to the pool. It also had a piano player and singer at night.  ‚Ä¢ The casino is very small but enjoyable. We didn‚Äôt try the Theatro disco.  ‚Ä¢ Full massage treatment for 2 hrs. at the Palace spa and the personnel could not have been nicer. There are also at least 7-8 separate small rooms (3-5 people) with different types of steam and sauna.  Cons  The spa had a large selection of steam and sauna rooms but I was puzzled why they do not have a Jacuzzi.  No coffee maker in room.  Need more chaise lounges around the pool. They fill up fairly quickly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deborah A wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Great hotel with fabulous room, beautiful gardens and a gorgeous, large pool
Review_Text: We stayed in the Palace for 6 nights and were delighted with our choice. We had a deluxe suite which was very good indeed with a huge bathroom and separate walk-in dressing room/wardrobe. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we were well situated to explore the Medina. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorna R wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Lovely hotel, can highly recommend but let down by reception staff
Review_Text: We booked this hotel through booking.com and had decided to stay here rather than the Four Seasons. We were really pleased win our choice-our transfer was waiting for us at the airport we were checked in quickly and our room was huge with a great view over the gardens and pool. Breakfast was wonderful sat outside enjoying the morning sun staff very pleasant. We played tennis every morning on the clay court that they had swept for us beforehand. Most days were spent by the pool which is huge-one recommendation is they could make the smaller pool near the children's play area a children's pool and allow adults without children to relax at the far end of the pool. They could definitely up sell drinks etc from the pool bar by coming around and asking if we wanted anything. In the evenings we used the gym or the spa-both really well equipped and worth a visit. The walk into town was easy and took about 15 minutes. We also ate locally at a roof top bar above extrablatt which is a cafe nearby that you can go to for lunch. The casino wasn't that great and everyone was smoking so we decided not to hang around.  The only thing stopping this being a 5 star review was the attitude of the reception staff on check out. We had booked a non refundable reservation through booking.com and I saw during the week my credit card had been pre authorised which I expected. During our stay we checked with reception that my card would not be fully charged and we could pay on another on check out which they assured us could be done. When we came to check out they had already fully charged my card and would not refund it to allow us to pay on another card. Since we stayed there (early Sept) I have had to make countless calls to them to sort out the refund and paying on another card which has been very costly and time consuming. I am very happy for a card to be pre authorised but I have travelled many times and have never not been allowed to pay on a different card at the end of the stay. This problem was very unique to us and all other staff were most polite and helpful therefore I do really recommend this stay for a relaxing trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic hotel, beautiful gardens, friendly staff
Review_Text: We stayed in a deluxe suite so this may have skewed my perceptions but this is an exceptionally good hotel. The interior is in a traditional Morroccan style with high arched ceilings mosaic tiled floors and hand painted doors. The pool area is lovely with a large irregular curved pool palm trees a pool bar and lots of sunbeds. Pool assistants bring towels as you require put up umbrellas etc all with a smile. The gardens are beautiful and in my opinion the nicest in Marrakech. The piano bar is stylish but when we stayed there very quiet. It is expensive but we actually preferred it to Mamounia which was twice as expensive mainly because the staff are more "human" here. It is within 15 minutes walk of the old town but a taxi only costs 50 dirhams anyway. The free wi-fi is good in public areas inside the hotel but a little patchy in bedrooms and at the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very nice facility with all the amenities on-site
Review_Text: Located within the city of Marrakech this luxury hotel provides all the amenities of a spa resort. Great swimming pool situated near the patio dining and breakfast area next-door to the local casino spa facilities on site and very good breakfast offerings with dining on the patio among the beautiful bougainvillea.    Accessing the main attractions of the downtown can only be reached by tour bus or car as this is definitely a residential area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Phillip V wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Wonderful hotel and stay ruined by front desk without integrity, care or honesty
Review_Text: This hotel presents as a five star palace and it is every detail is refined the rooms am amazing and grounds fantastic. You would think that going to pay a bill in cash would not present a problem but feigning "no change" does not rate with me as an appropriate answer. Following this discussion the staff member became rude accusatory and unpleasant. Train your staff better Es Saadi you are an establishment that should present the highest standards to your guests not gutter tactics like this.

Review_Title: Hidden Oasis in the Centre of Everywhere
Review_Text: We have stayed at the Es Saadi Palace twice now as a couple and with our 1 year old baby and always a guaranteed service.
