The Location is fantastic we were able to walk to koutoubia and the old town (Medina) in an enjoyable 10-15 min at the same time a whole bunch of very cool roof top bars clubs and restaurants are all in the area. The Resorts own night club is one of two top clubs in Marrakech and has an amazing cirque show. The live Jazz bar at the back of the casino is something very cool with an interesting cosmo croud. With all these places mention you are staying at the palace and immediately you get a VIP access. Security at the Resort is on the same league as Las Vegas.    Having mentioned the above the Palace itself is a peaceful relaxed oasis. The gardens and the pool is just breathtaking. The rooms are luxury in itself. The views from the balcony overlooking Marrakech is something to be seen. The pool is amazing with a fully stocked pool bar while the staff are really taking care of you. The Concierge service is top every booking they made for us we got the best table in the house and their recommendations never stopped to impress me and as an ex-New Yorker I am difficult :)    I have a feeling that the next visit to Marrakech will be at the Palace again.

Review_Date: Reggie C wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: This was my first time to Marrakech and the hotel is built inside a real palace . The restaurants are ok in food but stunning in design and the architecture is amazing . Great pools with our heated which is amazing . The gardens are grand n. Huge rooms with view if pools and gardens . About ten min by taxi to medina . Area is a bit bourgeoise but it's a nice break from madness in medina

Myself and my boyfriend have just returned from our stay at Es Saadi Gardens Resort yesterday. We stayed at the resort for 7 nights and we were very pleasantly surprised with our experience. The service was absolutely exceptional from the moment we arrived until the moment we left the resort surroundings was like paradise the location was perfect (about 1 mile from Medina town) and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful.    The cleanliness off our room and the resort was outstanding and our room was offered to be serviced twice per day.    All in all our experience was probably the most pleasant and enjoyable experience we have ever had on holiday and I cannot recommend this resort more. Needless to say we will most definitely be returning in the future!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hamoodi A wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Amazing place only one problem the air conditioner
Review_Text: My friend and I went stayed in this hotel honestly the place is amazing the rooms were clean the staff were super nice and very welcoming and very truthful I gave them my shorts for laundry and I forgot there was money in my shorts they returned it we moved from one room to another my friend forgot his watch in the old room they returned it back the made us feel home the only problem we had in the hotel was with the air conditioner for some reason it wasn't working it was not cooling and the weather was hot outside so the room were hot that was our only issue with the hotel I would definitely stay again in the same hotel but not in the summer

Review_Title: The best place you will ever stay at
Review_Text: Had the executive suite and it's amazing breakfast was served into out room daily ( thks to room sce guys by the way) . My wife and daughter enjoyed the indoor pool and different spas available at the palace. Staff extremely polite and helpful. Spent one week there and I wished I could've stayed longer. I will be back for sure  it is the best hotel you can stay at  thanks to everybody

Myself and three friends were originally booked to stay at Es Saadi hotel resort but was upgraded to the palace upon arrival due to work being done on the hotel. It was such an experience as being four girls in our 20's would never have been able to afford to stay here by choice! The staff treated us no different than paying customers of the palace. The staff were friendly attentive and helpful and offered advice on where to eat and what to see/do in Marrakech. The palace itself is absolutely beautiful from the decor to the pool side. The palace is only a 10 minute walk from the Madina and also only a 10-15 minute walk to the new town so its location is brilliant. Myself and friends had a lovely stay!

Review_Date: laura j wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful and amazing staff especially the poolside staff
Review_Text: Es Saadi Palace is the most beautiful place we have stayed so far. The garden pool and pool side is pristine and maintained every day sun loungers are very spaced out which makes it a pleasure to sunbathe and relax around the pool.    We would like to especially mention the pool/island bar staff they were amazing. Extremely friendly and approachable. Please mention this to them! there was one in particular we did not get his name but he had braces and short wavy hair- we loved him!    The only downside was when we went to a local shop for bottles of water (which we do on every holiday we go on) we were told no drink could be bought in to the palace from the outside. It was 40 degrees outside and the man was quite rude to us when he informed us that drink purchased from outside of the facility was banned. We felt he looked down on us from that point with very snide looks.    Overall a great place to go for a relaxing holiday- we went as 3 girls however i would definitely recommend this holiday to a couple

Review_Date: Helen C wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Es Saadi Gardens and Resort Palace and had the most relaxing holiday ever. It's 10 mins or so from the airport and the hotel themselves o the transfer. The staff are all extremely pleasant and cannot do enough for you. All facilities within and outside the building are superbly clean and found was amazing. The breakfast buffet has to be seen to be believed. The space between sunbeds / pod mean that you can relax totally without feeling that you are crammed in around the pool. The spa facilities are second to none - we used these daily.  Overall a superb place to stay in Marrakech. We will be back!

Review_Title: "The Palace" is a good hotel, somewhat pricey, a great place to relax and rest, very comfortable.
Review_Text: We had 2 connecting suites one for my wife and I the other for our 3 daughters 20 19 and 16. The rooms were very good spacious cool relaxing. Bathrooms were sprinkled with fresh rose petals daily. The pools are great service was slightly variable but good on the whole. Breakfast selection was wide ranging and good quality. Pool side food range was restrictive but okay. We mainly ate out in the evening the concierge always providing good advice and service. He also hired a good guide for the Souk. I had a very enjoyable "Gents" day in the Spa. Also enjoyed the art exhibition celebrating Moroccan independence. A very enjoyable return to Marrakech after 10 years. Don't stay in the sister hotel "The Gardens" unless you have restricted funds treat yourself to "The Palace"

Review_Date: Patrick L wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Stayed for a long weekend with my wife and her sister & brother-in-law. We had high expectations which I'm sorry to say we're not met and overall we were rather disappointed.    Don't get me wrong the hotel has good points - great location nice grounds lovely pool and the rooms are pleasant enough (not sure I would describe them as suites though). Unfortunately we had some issues with the service which in all honesty was shocking. On arrival we had a complimentary bottle of water in our room but our friends did not - mentioned this at reception and they promised to send one immediately. It actually took 48 hours despite a number of reminders and to add insult to injury we were told that we couldn't bring a bottle of water into the hotel from outside.    On one occasion our room key broke off in the lock. This was fixed but they wouldn't give us a replacement and we had to go to reception and have them call someone to let us in every time we wanted to get into the room.    Food was generally poor quality and overpriced - recommend eating at the 'sister' hotel next door which we found much nicer (special mention to Khalid who was a star).    We certainly wouldn't return to the Es Saadi Palace and recommend you don't either!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amy C wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We said here for the first few days of our honeymoon and it was wonderful. A perfect oasis from the crazy hot Souks. The staff were very attentive and they took a lot of care over us as they knew it was our honeymoon. It was very quiet when we went but I imagine the service is always to a high standard.    Special mention to the bar manager who made us the most fabulous tea infused cocktails one evening and kept us thoroughly entertained.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a fabulous 5 night stay at the Es Saddi Palace the rooms were spacious and we had a view of the pool from our balcony the staff could not do enough to help without being pushy I would recommend a visit to the restaurant on the 3rd floor serving traditional Moroccan food very tastefully decorated with an outside balcony to eat if you choose we had a very relaxing time and look forward to returning soon.

Review_Title: really poor service by staff for such amenities
Review_Text: Service was so cheapless for such a standard hotel. Staff is really not on top not helpful and not respectful of clientele. Won't choose this place again for my future stays. Staff is mixing work and leisure many small incidents didn't made my experience so enjoyable for a palace.

Review_Date: Cathy P wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Enjoyed the Es Saadi Palace and our upgrade!
Review_Text: Arrived for a 4 day break and had booked the normal hotel but upon check-in was immediately upgraded to the Palace hotel. This wS due to the construction ongoing at the first hotel.  Was quiet perhaps due to Ramadan but we could not fault the Hotel the rooms or the staff.  Breakfast was brilliant and lots of choice and served by the poolside. We had Half-Board basis and had to go the the sister hotel for dinner.  Dinner and restaurants did not open until 7.30pm which is a bit late for us but that could have been due to Ramadan. One thing we were informed by a member of the Hotel staff that we could eat in the beautiful Morrocan restaurant for a 100 dirham per person surcharge so we booked a table and we went and was just about to order when we were told that this was not true! Was embarrassing and we left even though we were the only persons in the whole restaurant.  Drink prices are a bit steep and poolside drinks served in plastic beakers....understand plastic but did they have to be so ugly and 'old' looking?  Loved our rooms very quiet with just birdsong as many birds in the beautiful garden.  Would definitely stay again...perhaps not during Ramadan and we really appreciated the automatic upgrade. Thankyou Es Saadi Palace.

I invested a considerable amount of time doing my research into which hotel to stay for my first trip to Marrakech. After careful thought I decided to stay at the Es Saadi Palace.    It was the best decision I made. We were picked up by the hotel transfer we had arranged beforehand which was smooth. Upon arrival at the hotel I was impressed by the architecture design and grandness of the lobby. The check in process was smooth and we were quickly escorted to our rooms. We had booked a junior suite. The room itself was awesome spacious and had a comfortable bed separate lounge area with a small balcony. The bathroom was great with a separate bath tub which looked ideal for having a hot soak. It also had a large walk in shower.    The rooms are somewhat lacking in modern design but do compensate for this in their moraccan themed design infused with luxury.    The swimming pool at the Palace is one of it's highlights. It is huge and stretches from one end to the other. We never had any problems finding sun loungers and always managed to get a good spot by the pool. There is a pool bar in the middle but we hardly used this facility.    The hotel gardens and landscape are pretty good with lots of greenery in sight. The breakfast was good but I found it lacking in variety compared to the 5* hotels I have stayed in at Antalya or Dubai. In addition the service at breakfast time was poor for a fine hotel like this. I always found it took the staff a long time to get our tea etc & this was a consistent theme over a weeks stay.    The hotel is located in the trendy hivernage area and has some excellent restaurants nearby. I would recommend Le Comptoir Namaszake at the Pearl Marrakech & Arkech lounge. There is a carrefour approximately within 15 minutes walking distance.    The only negative experience to report was due to the room keys. To my surprise this hotel did not use cards to open the door. They gave us big keys which can be awkward to leave in the pocket. On the first night my friend snapped the key trying to open the door. They never supplied him with a key until there was 1 night left in our stay. Also our room key went missing in our room due to the cleaner misplacing it. We were not given a replacement key. Also I found the hotels attitude towards this incident quite poor. We should have been provided with a key sooner rather than having to go to reception & ask to be let into our rooms every time.    Overall we enjoyed our stay and the Palace proved to be a spectacular place for us to explore Marrakech & escape the hustle and bustle and retreat into luxury.

There were some good attributes about this hotel but unfortunately the horrible management completely overshadowed them for us and I would never stay at this place again.    Apart from the general disorganization of the front desk the slow service and the passive concierge (recommends only the hotel restauraunts?) we had a very bad experience with the hotel manager. On the first day we unpacked and noticed our safe was not working. We were on our way out and decided we would address it later-BIG MISTAKE. The next day 800 euros were missing from an envelope I had hidden in my suitcase. We informed the hotel manager and his response was a shrug of the shoulders (literally) and a comment that we should have declared the safe wasn't working-and that the only thing he would do is call the police IF we wanted him too. He said he had no proof that we had that money (accusing us of lying) and didn't offer and in fact refused any type of restitution to at least make us feel a little better about getting robbed on our first day staying there (perhaps a meal at the hotel a spa service...a drink...a "sorry"?).  Nothing.    The strange thing is that we had overheard another man on the first day complaining that his safe didn't work. Smells fishy to me especially with the way we were treated after being robbed.    Not a 5 star hotel. The place is not a palace.The grounds are indeed beautiful but if you don't get out to the pool early enough they have to scramble to find you a spot....doesn't seem like there is enough space for all the clients...    Because you can smoke inside lobby areas have a strong smell of smoke. I know you have to expect that but I still found it unpleasant to say the least.    All in all VERY disappointing. With all the nice places to stay in the area (think Sofitel)-I don't recommend this one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent a very pleasant five days at this hotel.The location is perfect....within walking distance of the Medina but in a quiet residential area.After a hectic time sight seeing it was like a oasis of calm to return to the hotel and enjoy the pool and gardens.  We had a room overlooking the pool and yes there is some noise in the early hours from the casino but this is by far outweighed by the delight of looking out and seeing the snow capped Atlas Mountains.  We stayed in the lead up to the Easter holidays and the hotel became progressively busier so it became evident that they did need more staff during the breakfast period.  Overall the staff were extremely pleasant and were always attentive to your needs....I would definitely recommend.

Review_Title: Pool, SPA et location Excellent! Some small imperfections.
Review_Text: Starting by the begining Bellman service good then arriving at Reception and you get the feeling that they kind of dont want you there... the feeling go away as long as the stay advance and they start smile at you a bit more every day... Overall they are available and effective (which is the most important after all).  Very good points of this hotel:  - Swimming Pool side: beautiful area within a luxurious gardens and oasis of freshness. One of the most beautifull I have seen up to now. If you are the type to like getting lazy near water this is the place!  - SPA: modern well equiped with a nice staff (only annoying thing you have to fill up a form about your health and stress when you arrive of 2 long pages kind of intruding!)  - Evening Restauration: We tried 2 restaurants; La cour des lions (Morrocan): very beautiful restaurant with excellent food and nice service: EXCELLENT. Also the EPICURIEN (modern bistro/lounge serving French/Morrocan food by the Casino): simple efficient price fair very good for an evening which you want easy...    Things to improve:  - Despite the excellent location where the breakfast is served (Under the trees outside) the breakfast is nothing amazing food is fresh but not especially tasty.. dont get me wrong it is not bad ... just like any other places.. service smiling but a bit disorganised.  - lunch food by the pool is pricy long to arrive and the result is NOT Worth the price (about 20Euros for a club sandwich which is up to now the smallest I have ever seen!).  Overall this hotel has a lot of good points and a good location (10/15 min walk to the Medina). A nice place to relax and enjoy Marrakech.. it just lack a little something to be a real High class Palace. Still better than most of 5 stars there...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Service and best located Hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: 5th Business stay and also with large family and Parents  super value great staff and stunning rooms food and Pool with good Wifi.  Haven in a great City and walking distance to the Square/Medina and all of the best Restaurants.

Review_Date: wendy d wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: ABSOLUTELY STUNNING ,BEAUTIFUL HOTEL- BUT SERVICE COULD BE BETTER
Review_Text: We stayed at Es Saadi Palace in HivernageMarrakech between 4th and 14th April this year .The Palace itself and the landscaped gardens/pool area are absolutely beautiful .The "lobby " in the Palace is jaw droppingly gorgeous ;immaculately presented .Very stylish modern and with a real Moroccan feel . The interior is simply delightful.When we first arrived it provided a real "wow" factor .We had booked one of the Ksars which is essentially a Moroccan "duplex".The accommodation suited our needs perfectly as we were travelling with our 2 sons aged 6 and 8 .They had the run of a very spacious area upstairs comprising bedroom living area and separate bathroom with French doors onto an enclosed and thus safe elevated sun deck .Downstairs was a separate bedroom for my husband and I  a bathroom and a living area with French doors onto a sun lounger area with views to the pool .The Ksar was Moroccan themed with a rustic feel : painted shutters tiled floors and the like .It was very clean with comfortable beds and regularly maintained to a high standard during our stay. I cannot fault the accommodation or the Palace in any way however I was disappointed to learn on our first evening that the Lagon et Jardin restaurant which served a buffet breakfast and lunch and which was ideal (if rather expensive ) for children was not open in the evenings . My only real complaint about our stay (apart from the disappointing weather- only 4 days sun out of 10 -which I accept is outwith the control of the hotel !) concerned the level of service and a rather "laissez faire" approach by some staff .At the breakfast buffet it was often left to us to request cutlery/cups and saucers/etc (on sometimes more than one occasion ) and often there were no cereal bowls/plates available .During our stay this happened certainly more than half the time .The lunchtime buffet was not hugely inspiring for ¬£30 a head /¬£15 for a child and was considerably less exciting than we have encountered at similar 5 star resorts in Turkey or Dubai for example .We attempted lunch at the Island bar/restaurant on a couple of occasions however on the last visit we had waited 40 minutes from ordering and had yet to even receive our drinks and we therefore went to the snack bar at the older Es Saadi hotel where we found the service( and speed in particular) to be far superior .At the snack bar drinks were delivered along with tapenade olives and fresh bread rolls as standard however the same niceties did not happen at the Island /pool bar in the Palace which was disappointing .The manager of the Island bar seemed to spend a lot of his time shouting at his staff and rushing around which did not make for a restful experience .Finally when we asked on our last day for chicken nuggets for our boys(having seen another child being served them) we were told that they were too busy and that there was "no childrens menu that day" !.To be honest up until that point no one had informed us that there was a kids menu and we had been ordering lunch from the standard menu paying around ¬£15 for a pretty average bowl of pasta which was too large a portion for children .  I do not think that the hotel was really geared up for families needs and would better suit a couple who could enjoy the delicious food that was offered in the French and Moroccan restaurants .These opened for dinner at 730pm and so generally you would expect to be eating around 815pm which is a little late for younger children . In summary a gorgeous hotel faultlessly presented and well located that could be really impressive if it improved its customer service-particularly in the Lagon restaurant and Island bar areas.  Mrs Hampton

Review_Date: Inese J wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: The hotel is very gracious with all its spacious halls Moroccan style designed doors and meticulously landscaped gardens. The hotel has many truly beautiful spaces - inside pool numerous steam rooms restaurant terrace on the upper floor reception area with live local performers and many more. Breakfast terrace with the pool view is very enjoyable also. Very clean and spacious rooms Moroccan design with massive furniture beautiful bathroom. Extremely attentive attitude of all personnel!!    I highly recommend location in this area of Marakesh - Hivernage - it is a peaceful very modern area which is at the same time in 15 minutes walk to the medina hassle.    I have noticed many small unfortunate drawbacks which prevent the hotel from being just perfect so please mind the following:  - slow & unstable wifi  - no coffee/tea in the room  - several times after cleaning only part of clean towels were provided  - in some evenings only 2 of 5 steam rooms work  - tea in the spa area is not being looked after and refilled  - breakfast did not offer any local specialities (apart of cheese and desert)  - breakfast does not change from day to day the variety is too small  - birds are flying in the breakfast room and.. eating from the pastries table and nobody cared about it  - when moving or lifting sun beds one can feel they are sticky and a little dirty

We only stayed in the hotel for 5 hours as we drove from Agadir to fly back from Marrakech late at night. We wish we could have stayed as it was absolute perfection so quiet peaceful and accommodating. We had room service before we left that was brought onto our balcony looking over to the mountains absolute dream.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We went for a short break and had a fantastic time in Marrakesh in spite of a lot of rain. I would say half the time the rain was heavy.We were there at the end of March so it could also be pretty hot. The Es Saadi Resort was great. Beautiful groundsexcellent service and a gorgeous room/suite with a view of rooftops and the Atlas Mountains. It was amazing when the sun came out. There is lots to do and the atmosphere of Marrakesh is exotic and exciting.

I spent a week at the palace with my wife this is our first time here  but third overall as we normally went to the hotel es saadi;  We were extremely happy the service natural and warm The swimming pool excellent and easy to find a quiet corner with privacy to sunbath.  Breakfast excellent all you need to start the day.  The only critic is the ambiance a little subdued in the bar although probably to do with the period we were there. Also small point if you offer a pool table in the bar then really it should be equipped correctly or just take out. Also shame the Palace does not have any little shops or boutiques and other than the gastro restaurant no other restaurant however the hotel restaurant is of excellent standard as it had always been.  In general we would reccomend a stay here and we will certainly be coming back later in the year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a truly amazing place. From the moment you arrive you are treated like a special guest. The Palace is an amazing building beautifully furnished extensive areas to sit and very spacious. Rooms are huge immaculately clean comfortable four poster beds and with a view of the garden pool and Atlas Mountains.    The garden in 20 acres is fabulous lots of flowers all of it carefully designed with walkways and paths. There is always an abundance of gardeners keeping it immaculate. The extensive pools are well designed and spacious you always have plenty of space around it has the feel of an exclusive country club.    All of the staff are polite and helpful you are not allowed to open a door nothing is too much trouble. A truly five star experience we will certainly return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sara A wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: My husband 15 year old son and I stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and then an extra night at then end of our week. We were picked up at the airport in a lovely clean people carrier and taken to the hotel. We were served mint tea and pastries while we waited to check in to the sound of a man in traditional dress playing an equally as traditional an instrument. As we went off peak we were up graded to a duplex apartment. It was on the ground floor and huge!! There was an entrance area with a large toilet coming off it then another small room with a sofa and all the wardrobes and safe. WE used this as a dressing room for my son as it had curtains separating it from the main lounge. This had a writing desk mini bar TV large sofa dining table and chairs and the stairs leading to the bedroom. Patio doors led onto a patio area with table and chairs. The ceiling here was about 25 feet high so a lot of glass. AT night we used automatic shutter which came down and blocked out all the light. Upstairs there was a bedroom with a bed which I think was bigger than a UK super king size. More wardrobes a flat screen TV and the biggest bathroom I have ever seen. The rain shower room with marble bench was lovely and large. Rose petals were scattered in here twice a day. In the evenings a small cake was left on either side of the bed a lovely touch. The beds were too hard for my liking.  Breakfasts were amazing the best freshly squeezed orange juice and an omelette station. The staff here struggled with English but there was one lady who could speak English and I would always ask her for what I wanted and she was very attentive and helpful.  Room service was delicious but over priced.  My son played tennis with the amiable tennis coach for 150MAD he really enjoyed it.  The concierge is the only real negative I think they were on commission. He insisted I could not do a half day quad bike only a full day after arguing for some time I went back to the room and booked it myself on the phone and got a discount!  We asked to look around one of the villas and the butler kindly took us on a tour which was lovely.  We left our luggage here when we left for a few days reception staff was very helpful. We left our cash with them and they had a wall full of safes. Our belongings were put in and locked using 2 different keys they kept one and so did we.  When we had our final check out they tried to give us an extended check out time as our fight was not until 8pm but they couldn't as they were full. I explained that I only needed this as I would need to pray before leaving. They assured me not to worry and that they would provide a room to pray in. I was so pleased with this consideration but I was quite shocked when they gave me the luggage room to pray in! After all the luxury and care I had expected something better!  I can't fault the hotel however be warned I loved it because we went off peak and practically got the room half price if we had paid more I would not be so pleased.

The hotel is gorgeous. Big high ceilings huge rooms immaculately clean the staff can't do enough for you without pestering you or expecting tips every time.    The pool area is very luxurious and again the staff are very pleasant. The large round double sun loungers were a particular favourite.    We loved the free airport transfer in a Bentley!    Drawbacks would be the costs of drinks/food within the hotel (we kept going to nearby cafe ExtraBlatt just around the corner which was a fraction of the price and great vibe).    Finally the lack of atmosphere within the hotel was a little disappointing...but perhaps this was because we weren't in peak season in March? Plus the medina is not far to walk so there's plenty to find on your doorstep.    I would definitely stay again when looking for a quiet relaxing break.

Blown away by the quality of service which is not to be taken for granted in Morocco. Staff was very well trained courteous prompt discreet and reliable. During breakfast great attention to customers' requests promptly served loved the scented water (with Jasmine Rosemary will try it at home). I ordered a Chicken Ceaser salad as a room service it was delivered within 30" fresh ingredients freshly baked bread

Review_Title: Very nice stay...... Would come back again definitely :-)
Review_Text: We were upgraded to the palace suite and it was lovely. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was tasty. The palace room was large and beautifully decorated with big four poster bed big dresser  massive bath and shower etc etc. We loved staying in this beautiful hotel and would definitely recommend it. It's close to they city centre. We avoided taxis and travelled by horse cart to and from city. Very quiet location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Can't fault this hotel one bit had a wonderful time in morocco everything about this hotel was perfect food was great staff was brilliant the club and casino was good and a special thank you to the concierge that came to the hospital with me and waited until I was ok to leave "Thank You so much" defiantly would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Loved this Hotel, you will too.
Review_Text: I've seen a lot of suggestions so I'll offer up this one as a very recent and accurate review for your consideration.    The room was very clean and the staff came a couple times to check it a day. A chocolate or pastry was left each night by the bedside table. I saw waters in the room and consumed a couple and I was ready for someone to pull the 'gotcha that actually cost money' but that never happened and I was pleasantly surprised. Breakfast was included every morning with my room and it was a very nice continental breakfast. Not limited at all.    Sitting pool side was awesome. The pool was extremely cold but I liked it. I would take turns sun bathing and then icing myself in the pool.    Very close to everything. Easy walk into the Medina did it many times. Woke up every morning and had coffee on our very expansive outdoor porch which had a view of the pool and the mountains. I liked to sleep in and the black out curtains did an excellent job of keeping out the light in the mornings so we could sleep in.    One of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. Bathroom had a massive room for a shower and an awesome bathtub that we used. They also had ample hotel amenities including some really nice black exfoliating scrub.    I would highly recommend this hotel I was very pleased with the experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were due to stay in the Palace Hotel and were upgraded to one of the Ksar villas in the beautiful gardens. This was luxurious accommodation with plenty of space and everything of the highest quality added to by faultless service from staff who are courteous helpful and welcoming. Lovely additional touches such as complimentary Morroccan delicacies and fresh rose petals decorating the bath mats etc were greatly appreciated. The breakfast was superb with plenty of choice and the spa is excellent. You can tell this is still a family-run business with owners who care passionatly about providing outstanding service. A fabulous stay in all respects.

Review_Title: My most amazing hotel stay so far...
Review_Text: I stayed at the Es Saadi Palace a couple of weeks ago for just two nights while on business. How I wished I could have stayed longer to enjoy this fantastic hotel! I was in a truly palatial suite on the 1st floor with a lovely view of the gardens and pool. The Moroccan decor colors and textures were rich and soothing. The spa bathroom was beyond compare and I enjoyed the black soap and scrub mitt they thoughtfully provided as well as the cozy robe and slippers. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and the pillow menu extensive! I was delighted to find a tray of fruit on the small dining table and enjoyed relaxing on the comfortable sofa in my few free moments. While I wasn't able to go swimming I did feel the water in the pool which was heated to a very warm temperature - nice for a February day! The lobbies and public rooms in the hotel are exquisitely designed and decorated and the music in the evenings is wonderful. The restaurant is also quite good with an extensive array of items at breakfast and lunch. My experience of the staff and service is also first-rate. I would absolutely stay here again on holiday or business!

Five family and friends stayed here for a week in January 2015 and thoroughly enjoyed it the hotel is excellent the staff service and food were very good the buffet breakfast is extensive and excellent. Staff are very attentive and efficient and the hotel and facilities are really good nothing seemed to be too much trouble certainly will return.

We spent a week as a family. Stayed in one of the rooms (not cottage). Service was good easy access to tourist areas & a relaxed way to spend the days.  The main pool was closed for renovation but the smaller one was available.

Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel and excellent welcoming service !
Review_Text: Am here now !  Arrived today and our welcome could not have been any better ! The staff are superb! Friendly and welcoming ! Could not do enough for us to make us feel welcome !  Had a beautiful meal in the restaurant here and the service is faultless !!!! I don't ever want to leave !!!! Hope the next 3 days are just as good !!! Definately 5 star all the way !

My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and we had a brilliant experience. It was our anniversary so the hotel arranged for a cake and we got other treats delivered to the room everyday.    The staff were very friendly and welcoming picking us up from the airport for free and offering us mint tea and a musician playing to us on arrival. Our room was huge with a balcony overlooking the swimming pool. The weather was hot enough to sunbathe by the pool on sunlounger bed and one section of the pool was heated. The main part of the pool was too cold to swim in.    We used the gym indoor pool and spa/ steam room every day all of which were included in the price and we almost always had it to ourselves. The only down point was no Jacuzzi and the temperature of the pool was a bit too cold.    The continental buffet breakfast in the morning sat overlooking the pool was great with pastries eggs and hot/cold options. The location was also good about 5 mins taxi ride or 15-20 mins walk from the main square.    Overall we were very impressed with this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We didn't get off to a good start. We were greeted nicely and given tea but then there was a long delay when we were left just sitting there with no explanation. We had booked 3 rooms and were finally given a tour of the public areas and shown two of the rooms and had to wait another half an hour for the 3rd room (it was late afternoon).    The public areas are cavernous and in the winter months at least rather dark and dreary. The restaurant is also enormous making it rather characterless. There is a lot of contemporary art which was all very interesting and did improve the overall look. The rooms are lovely - very spacious with large comfortable beds and nice linens. All rooms had a vase of fresh roses which was a nice touch. The bathrooms are also lovely with bathtubs big enough for two and separate walk-in showers although our son's bath was ringed with cigarette burns which looked horrible. The housekeeping was excellent. We had one complimentary bottle of water on arrival and then each got a small bottle (330ml) at turndown but any water after that was chargeable. This seemed rather mean at the high price we were paying and especially as we had come from another hotel where we had a complimentary stock of several large bottles of water. As other people have said the wifi is very patchy.    The outdoor pool is huge with guys on duty to help organise your sunbeds and bring towels etc. The sunbeds were mostly all used so I think in warmer months it must get very busy. We were told the hotel was in 20 acres of gardens and it was a little disappointing that you couldn't wander round and find a quiet spot to sit - the gardens were dotted with private villas (which you can book rather than a hotel room) and they had private gardens but other than the path that wound round them to take you to the villas you couldn't access them. So it was sit by the pool or on your balcony.    We found the food to be very expensive and mediocre. We went over to the hotel on our first evening where we were offered a very limited menu and although there were quite a few interesting desserts on it we were told that the only desserts on offer were those on the sweet trolley. I can't say that the service was bad but I would say that we were served with very bad grace and we did not feel that our custom was appreciated in any way. We could also see that there was a degree of bullying going on amongst the staff which wasn't very pleasant to see.    We did a city walking tour the next morning and so were tired and hungry when we arrived back at the hotel and decided on the buffet lunch in the Palace. No one explained what the form was so we didn't really have an idea of exactly what was on offer. After a while they started cooking food on a bbq but none of us got the actual things we'd chosen - there seemed to be no system in place. This meal was even more expensive than the dinner the night before.    We gave the food one last try and ordered items like burgers and club sandwiches out by the pool one day. The food arrived very cold and the club sandwiches were made with very thin very dry (and cold) toasted bread. We had a similar meal in a local cafe one day which cost a fraction of the cost here and was far superior.    The breakfast staff had thawed out a little by the end of our 5 night stay but although all very efficient I would not describe any of the staff as cheerful other than one delightful doorman and one of the receptionists Hanane who was very helpful.    We had booked through a travel agent on a Bed & Breakfast basis but there was apparently a New Years Eve dinner included but this was never explained to us and we had made arrangements to go out. When we were asked about the dinner (well given a letter about it that they demanded we sign) and we asked for more details the lady we were talking to actually stopped mid-sentence and turned to speak to other guests who were at the desk.    Our daughter had to come back to England early and because we had booked through an agent and paid in advance we weren't expecting the hotel to offer any sort of a refund. However they did re-let her room so we felt that as a gesture of goodwill most businesses would have offered something in those circumstances but nothing was forthcoming either to us or our travel agent.    All in all a disappointing experience for a 5 star hotel.

Review_Date: Marian F wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Es Saadi Gardens is far from being a 5 star hotel. Non proffesional sttaf hotel
Review_Text: The staff hotel professionalism must to be improved and it doesn‚Äôt correspond to a 5 star hotel. We travelled with a small child and we had to order for an extra bed for 4 TIMES: the first time was at check in time at 13 am and the fourth time was at 23 hours at night. Otherwise the bed application was previously made on the online reservation . We felt a total lack of control in this regard.  Reception staff was very unfriendly and unable to outline a minimum smile; even seemed that they had to do an enormous effort to greet customers.  Moreover in the breakfast restaurant (buffet) there were birds and that would not have anything special but the birds were constantly eating over the dishes that we were serving our breakfast under the impassive gaze of the numerous waiters. We couldn‚Äôt believe our eyes.  In our opinion Es Saadi Gardens is far from being a 5 star hotel.

Review_Title: Very, very nice place to stay
Review_Text: We visited Marrakesh for about 1 week and stayed in the Palace a Ksar with two floors/bedrooms. Service is top from the airport pick up to return. Food is also great I especially liked the high quality of the meat which I tend to eat almost raw(ish). Our kids were well thought after and even brought back/forth between the Ksar and the Kids club on request.  Only (minor) comment is that the restaurants are less for small(er) children a bit too stiff...a pity because the food is great.  Note: predominantly the guests speak French (which should not be a surprise)

My fist visit to Marrakech and we decided to book this hotel. We were left astonished by its premises nice staff and location. We can certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who decides to visit the wonderful city of Marrakech. It's a charming and relaxed atmosphere with a great garden to explore as well as excellent swimming pools. The staff was very service minded and took good care of us in every way. This hotel is suitable for couples as well as for families. You also have the casino next door although you won't be bothered with any kind of noise or sound. The rooms showed signs of wearing but were still very clean and neat. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marc Lemmers wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We went a week ago for a week to Marrakesh and stayed at Es Saadi Palace resort in one of their suites . Its been one of the best hotels we have stayed and its location at Hilvernage is great.  From the pick up at the Airport at the hotel at the SPA all was excellent.  The suite and its bathroom is wonderful and the staff are all very kind. The hotel offers beautiful gardens and a great spa.    We highly recommend Es Saadi Palace resort.

Review_Date: Gabriele S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: A wonderful hotel set in wonderful gardens in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: I stayed at the Es Saadi Palace for a few days in November and loved it. My accommodation was one of the Ksars away from hotel's main building. It was quiet and sheltered and very spacious. My own little house with an upstairs bed and bathroom and a balcony and an entrance hall bedroom  large bathroom and lounge downstairs leading onto a patio backed onto the pool area.  Yes its very 'morrocan' in its decor and had everything ( including a Nespresso Machine) one needed as well as a butler and buggy service should you wish to not want to walk through the beautiful gardens. The breakfast was good and I loved to sit outside in the morning sun overlooking the pools and gardens. One of the pools was heated great for an early morning dip.  Another benefit is the extensive Spa featuring an Oriental Thermae  a large pool and offering all things relaxing and beautiful. I tried the Haman Experience and was transported into a different world followed by some lovely tea afterwards.  Once you step outside you are right in the centre of the city next to the Casino and the Sofitel and in walking distance to the Square and Medina. Highly recommendable.

Review_Date: Tolga T wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: The hotel rooms are beyond the expectations. We stayed at a junior suit and it was around 80-90 metersquare with a small garden a big bathroom. The swimming pool is also nice the garden is fantastic. Decoration of the hotel is a bit too authentic but its better for feeling the real Moroccan style.

We just returned from Marrakech and had an absolutly wonderful time at Es Saadi - The Palace!    My first impression was not so good though - I tried e-mailing the hotel about a pick-up at the airport but never got an answer. My husband called and booked it and although our booking said that airport transport was included the hotel said it would be 150 dirhams. But we never got a chance to argue about this beacuse there was never anybody at the airport to pick us up. And when we tried calling the hotel we didn't get an answer. So we had to pay for a taxi to get there. So that's why this hotel don't get a full score form me. The funny thing is that the transportation back to the airport was included. So I'm assuming somebody messed up when we got there.    Bu when that being said after we arrived at the hotel we had a very pleasant time. We got tea and a pastry while checking in. The suites are very spacious and we got a nice view down at the pool. The included Wifi worked very well most of our stay - it was a bit slow during the weekend and I'm guessing it's beacuse there were more guests there then. We got water every night and wonderful pastry. We also enjoyed the breakfast and though it had quite a good selection.    The gardens around the hotel are beautiful and the same goes for the pools. We only tried the heated one the other felt way too cold. The sunbeds where nice and we enjoyed our time here. But I'm pretty sure the guys working by the pool could do a better job. They were pretty slow to get you a towl and they didn't really remove towls after people left. Most of the time they sat on a bed and talked to eachother. But maybe that's just how it is during low season.    The hotel is a quick walk form the Medina and in a very quiet and nice neigborhood. We felt very safe all the time and it was amazing to get away from all the hussel in the old town.    We would love to stay here again and have already recommended it to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a week in Marrakech staying at Es Saadi Palace hotel as a family of four with teenage children. The hotel scored highly on all fronts - gorgeous rooms which were spacious and very clean. Excellent bedlinens and towels and very good room service. The included breakfast was pretty good made better by being served on a wonderful terrace in the garden. The best member of staff was Aziz the restaurant manager who was friendly and helpful. The least good staff members had to be the concierge and his stand in when he was off duty. Both of them were sour faced and made you feel like they were doing you a favour helping you. The tennis court which we used everyday was pretty grotty but better than nothing - but the coach was rude and unhelpful. However the majority of staff were great and we would certainly return - once we've saved enough pennies - a very expensive holiday!

Review_Date: ronan s wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: This hotel probably isn't a 5 star when compared to what is on offer in other countries but that shouldn't take away from the fact that is a lovely place to spend few days.    We were picked up at the airport in an air conditioned Bentley which made a good start to our visit.    The hotel - the approach and main entrance comes across as a bit shabby (compared to the Sofitel next door) and could do with some TLC and investment. However the interior is beautiful and tasteful - very tranquil.It was a pleasure coming into the main lobby - check out the art gallery and the doomed ceiling area very unexpected.    We opted for a first floor junior suite and weren't disappointed - the interior finishes and furnishings were exceptional and the view over the gardens and pool was super - go for a room with a garden view. The bed was large and comfortable. Large L shaped sofa was laden with perfectly placed pillows. 2 flat screen TVs with English speaking channels limited to CNN and BBC News. The suite was cleaned twice daily with complimentary water each evening. Wi-Fi access in room was very good.    The gardens are superb and tended by a small army of gardeners - the pool area likewise; and our only minor complaint would be that the pool service was a bit slow at times.    Breakfast was served on the terrace leading to the pool and garden - very pleasant. The buffet was good not exceptional and didn't vary during our stay.    We did not have dinner in the hotel - although busy during the day the hotel was extremely quiet at night. We only noticed a couple of people in the very large bar. Each evening we took a short taxi trip to the new town - 5 minutes or a 15 minute walk. The old city is about the same distance.    The hotel staff were all very pleasant but don't come across as really going the extra mile to satisfy...we enquired about getting coffee facilities in our suite - but no-one actually bothered to come back and confirm what was happening. Having asked a third time we dropped it...but it would have been nice to have been told whether our request was being dealt with.    These are very minor issues and in the scheme of things aren't important. This hotel has a lovely atmosphere and we really enjoyed our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you like a great breakfast wonderful service and a break from the organized chaos that is fabulous Marrakech - this is a good place to begin your adventure.  Our large room was clean with a lovely view room service was delicious and and the canapied bed was a nice touch.  I loved the musician in the lobby and the gracious gentleman who served Mint Tea and pastries everyday.  It helps to speak Arabic or French but they try very hard to speak English.

I personally selected this Hotel for the size & the quality of the Rooms & location.  Its good Hotel for weekend escape & full relaxation.  close attention & coaching  training to the staff services.  i think i will go back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We attended a medical conference here for a week. The hotel was a gloriously nice and unexpectedly luxurious. We were absolutely blown away. The rooms were impeccable the food was fabulous the service was on match. It gave us an entirely new perspective on Morocco.    My son was with us and he thinks that is the best vacation he ever had. I would agree.    With all the turmoil in the world I frankly expected some issues in Morocco. We had none. The people were extraordinarily nice.

Review_Date: lorna h wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We spent 3 nights at the Es Saadi and were very impressed by the high standard. The hotel rooms are large and quiet. The staff are very helpful and polite. It was an oasis to escape to after the madness of the medina! Very happy to get back to the hotel. The pool was very cold but with 40 degree heat it was a great place to cool off. I would definitely come back.

There are two hotels at this resort - the palace and e saadi - which is the more down market of the two and has a slighter smaller pool - we stayed at E Saadi and we were really happy!    The hotels and resort are beautiful lovely gardens to wander filled with herbs flowers fruits and sculptures perfect for a 30 min wander any time of the day complete with tennis courts pin pon table and childrens play area kids club massages hair dresser and a few small shops.    All of the pools were big enough to swim in and work out in.    The staff are lovely well trained fluent in English french Italian ect hard working pleasant only too happy to fetch any thing you want. Mint tea at 2am no problem!    The hotel is very clean the maids honest the food lovely breakfast huge comfy bed with balcony fridge ect.    10 mins walk to city center pretty gardens markets places to eat.    Taxi hotel to airport around ¬£10.00-¬£20.00 depending on who you ask.    We would happily stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is a classic but just shortly lacking from 5 star on our previous visit we had tea and coffee facilities in the room by way of a Nespresso machine this time it was not there also I was disappointed that the hotel had run out of Room Service breakfast cards so could not order breakfast the night before. No point in phoning room service after you have gotten up.    Generally excellent but felt the overall attitude was slipping for example staff were inattentive and everything was available providing you had 30 minutes to wait it would help if staff were a little more proactive instead of reactive

Review_Date: phillip g wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Stay at the palace and not the hotel ! The suites here are huge and very sensibly priced . It is about a 15min walk to the Medina  the hop on hop off bus passes the palace and there are great restaurants a short walk across the road . The staff are very helpful  we stayed in early September and had the pool area almost to ourselves  lots of comfortable loungers and more staff than guests . We forgot to take our plug adaptor to charge our iPhones and asked the concierge where we could buy one  he promptly unplugged his phone that was charging and said use this  the next day he brought a spare with him from his home and let use it until we left .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: a bit worse for wear, but still quiet and convenient
Review_Text: I was here last year and thought the place was good albeit a bit tacky. This time the wifi didn't work so well and I was in a different wing of the hotel. The room really isn't well maintained- there are a lot of minor issues which add up to something more significant. The staff is generally quite good especially the butler and room service. It's not really worth the premium price though even in nutty Marrakech.

Review_Title: Good place for a first night in Morocco
Review_Text: The Es Saadi Hotel is reasonably near the airport and therefore worth considering as a stop over. This hotel is feels like a standard luxury hotel that you find across the world but with a Moroccan twist. It's all fine rooms comfortable swimming pool lovely first thing in the morning and breakfast really excellent.

Review_Date: Jill H wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: The Es Saadi Palace is an oasis of friendliness and graciousness serenity and refinement with a quality of service that is second to none.    The architecture of the building and the design of the interior are eyecatching and there is an array of excellent local handiwork and handicraft throughout the building: handwoven carpets and sumptuous fabrics tiles and mosaics woodcarving and metalwork and original paintings. In the lobby one can listen to soft exotic music played by a musician while sipping freshly brewed mint tea.    The hotel is set in a tranquil tropical garden of palms and palmettos orange and pomegranate trees roses and bougainvilleas which surround a large freeform lagoon pool with an island bar. Parasols and very comfortable sunloungers surround the lagoon and large soft towels are provided for swimmers. There are two other swimming pools: one outside and another in the spa both heated. The spa provides a sensual sanctuary with a comprehensive range of pampering beauty treatments massages thermae and a traditional hammam; and there is a superbly equipped fitness room. The hotel garden and pools are immaculately upkept by a large team of staff.    The generous buffet breakfast is laid out in a restaurant that opens onto a garden terrace and guests can eat inside or at the tables outside. Delicious light meals are available in the Bio du Bled and the Lagon & Jardin restaurants and there are two bars.    Dining in the Cours des Lions restaurant is a memorable experience. The talented chef and his excellent team of kitchen staff provide a delicious feast of tagines couscous and artistically presented desserts. Dining at a table on the terrace affords a view of Marrakech as the night sky darkens and the city lights come on; and dining inside allows one to feel the breeze wafting through the doors that open onto the terrace. The impeccably trained waiters the stunning decor soft music candles beautiful tableware and very comfortable chairs enhance the dining experience. This is very fine dining indeed.    Staying in a spacious suite with a balcony overlooking the gardens allows for a truly restful stay. My superbly appointed executive suite had a luxurious bathroom; a dressing room; a sumptuous four-poster bed; a dining table set with complementary wine bottled water fruit and honey cakes; a desk; two large televisions; a wonderfully comfortable divan; handwoven carpets; and fully adjustable airconditioning; and the balcony was furnished with a sunlounger a table and two chairs.    Overall the Es Saadi Palace is a base for exploring the exotic city of Marrakech and is a place for indulgent relaxation.

I just want to start by saying: Please do not mistake the PALACE for the HOTEL. they are two different properties although they are located on the same grounds.    I will start by posting the "Con's" of the Palace (since most of the reviews pretty much repeat themselves by saying how great the Palace is):    1) there is no iron. you have to pay to get your clothes ironed and you need to at least give them 24 hours notice.  2) there is no clock in the room. (that's if you need one... i like to know what time it is every now and again lol so it was a little bother to me)    With that being said i LOVE the Palace Es Saadi. It's located 10 minutes walking distance from the Medina (which is in the center of Marrakech). that's where all the spice markets are located.    The service is Incredible. Breakfast was delicious every morning. The waiters are extremely nice.  It's worth the price as opposed to the less expensive hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Clare M wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: A week in Marrakech at Es Saadi Gardens and Resort. Special thanks to Fatiha!
Review_Text: Very pleasant hotel good restaurantlovely pool. Staff most welcoming and attentive. The air conditioning in the room was good. Normally you can adjust this but we couldn't do so so luckily it was just right.  We will return here.  Special thanks to Fatiha.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at the Es Saadi for a week-long business trip to Marrakech. One thing to keep in mind is that both the Hotel Es Saadi (cheaper less luxurious) and the Palace (5-star treatment) are advertised on the same page which can be very confusing. I stayed at the Palace (upon arrival we were surprised with an upgrade which was wonderful) which came with all the facilities and comforts you'd expect from a 5-star hotel. The spa is actually really good - I had a hammam (divine) and used the indoor pool regularly (there's also a huge outdoor pool). Highlights for me: the staff (always friendly always helpful); the breakfast (generous and delicious); spa facilities; spacious room; free/great wifi connection (key if/when on a business trip); location - this was a major bonus as the hotel was close enough to the medina (old town) but far enough so you feel you're getting away from the hustle and bustle of the square and souks.

The hotel is conveniently located about a 20 minute walk from Jemaa Square. It has an excellent large pool in an attractive garden surrounding with plenty of room between the sun loungers. My room was large with a nice view over the pool. Access to the spa is included in the price in particular use of the water jet pool and saunas. All the staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly. The only drawback was a weakness in the organisation of housekeeping which meant that one sometime had to chase to get things done.

Review_Title: The best Birthday ever at the Es Saadi Palace Villas
Review_Text: This is my second visit to the Es Essadi Palace and again we stayed in one of the beautiful villas we booked the Maharaja Villa and I had friends staying in the Blue Villa and suites in the Palace. We had the time of our lives. The attention to detail at the palace was second to none. We had 14 of us staying there to celebrate my birthday we stayed for 4 days and everyone had an amazing time. Highlights of the stay are the staff and the butlers they are great and very attentive.The villa's are truly out of this world and amazing the chef for making me the best birthday cake I have ever eaten it was sublime the only small issue was the nightclub we had booked and the staff couldn't find our VIP booking and we had to wait a long time to get a drink but saying that the club the music and experience was greatbetter than in Ibiza!.    So all in all if you want a real luxury experience in Marrakesh the only place to stay is the Es Ssaadi we are going back again for Christmas and all my firiends are booking too!!!!

Review_Date: Nawal D wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: A review of the palace NOT the hotel
Review_Text: I booked a long weekend at the hotel for the 12-15th of June. When I arrived at the airport I was met by a lovely man ready to take us to the hotel. I was taken with my friend to the Palace part of the resort only to be told I was being surprised with an extremely generous upgrade from 5 star hotel to an Executive suite. The suite was payed out over 2 floors with a beautiful terrace facing the infamous palace pool. Since the moment I arrived at this resort I do not think I could fault any service of this palace. From the amazing reception staff Zakariya to the fabulous pool staff Redwan and Hakim there was not one person who was not willing to help all you have to do is ask. The proximity of the hotel to the Casino de Marrakesh and Theatro is lovely and even though there was a famous comedy festival (Marrakesh du Rire) going on in the hotel you could not tell it was fully booked. I spent a lovely weekend and left with beautiful memories. I would definitely recommend this palace again and urge others to see it for themselves. How it has received bad reviews I cannot understand. 6 stars from me a very happy client and hope to see it again soon!!!

Review_Date: Matthew J wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: How on earth did this Hotel attain 5 stars? Threadbare rugs stained carpets cheap 60s furniture. At ¬£1200 for 3 nights I feel robbed.  There are so many great places to stay at this level but this one was misleading.  The pool area is insufficient for the amount of guests - thus feels cramped. The main entrance lobby has been neglected and is scruffy I'm trying really hard to find something good to say but can't !!  So disappointed. Won't ever go back. Stay at The Sultana!!

Review_Date: Marie-Laure S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: This hotel has everything you need if you are looking for calm refinement and well being. The food is amazing the spa is resourceful the pool area is very quiet with a lot of green and only the birds to hear.    Service is good: if you need anything just ask.    Room is comfortable and clean with a beautiful and spacious bathroom.    For people who love art the hotel is a gallery itself with numerous moroccan paintings and sculptures.

Excellent venue big green space with swimming pools great food and villas. Staff was very helpful private swimming pool inside villa is remarkable. Nice decoration and totally calm. It is great for honeymoon or romantic event.

Flew out on the Saturday for three nights airport very busy compared to a Friday will not make that mistake again. Flight good only just over 3 hours landed around 5.00pm car waiting to take us to the hotel. Arrived at the hotel good welcome and offered Moroccan Tea seated in reception. Met the concierge and booked a few things. Room good very clean and comfortable bed the dressing room was small but a nice open terrace on two sides one overlooking the pool. The air conditioning is a must. A lot of pigeon mess on the terrace ‚Äì that is a problem lots of trees and a lot of birds all very nice but comes with a price - needs to be washed down each day but was not. Pool bar has a nice area to sit with shade snack lunch ok food service is slow ‚Äìpossibly the kitchen but go to the bar for drinks to speed things up. The main bar is good for sundown and later drinks sat outside - watch out for the pigeons sitting on the balconies. The bar staff are very good.  Cour De Lions food very good staff very good ‚Äì ate there twice. Casino Brassiere - again the food and staff were very good. Private tour arranged by the concierge very good did Marrakech then up into the Atlas Mountains four to five hours English speaking driver again very good. French language would be an advantage but we got by and met a lot of very friendly French speaking people ‚Äì what a breath of fresh air and so different to France.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carol W wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Luxurious, calm and so very friendly.
Review_Text: Our family of 6 stayed here for 5 nights from the 3rd of May. We were very fortunate to be upgraded on arrival to 2 connecting Ksars. What an experience! Each one set over 2 floors so close to the fabulous pool and with butler service - it certainly made our holiday unforgettable. After exploring the old city and the bustling Souks it was sheer heaven to return to the tranquil Es Saadi. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and their recommendations for eating out were most welcome even arranging taxis for us.    I cannot recommend thisbeautiful hotel enough. If you're looking for a luxury retreat in a truly magical country then this is the place

Stayed here three nights in April. Flight was delayed but the pre-arranged car was waiting and we were soon in the hotel to be ushered straight into the dining room. Room was at the front but quiet. Food in the restaurant was waiter service good choice of menu (with a vegetarian option each day) and plentiful. We also had lunch one day at the pool bar - again a good light meal. Nothing was too much trouble in this hotel and it well located close to the horse drawn carriages and the open top city tour bus about 5 minutes walk.

Review_Date: Emma D wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: I came with 3 girlfriends for a semi bachlorette/hen party. We had 2 adjoining rooms in the Palace (note the Hotel is a different building) and the rooms were truly impressive. great size great bedding and beautiful styling. If you want the romantic or intense cultural experience of Marrakech this place probably isn't right but if you want the feel and expectations of a large resort (with the styling of morocco) this place is for you.    We had dinner in the Cour De Lions restaurant which I would recommend fully as the interiors are stunning. I would also recommend a traditional Hamman treatment at the Palace SPA. very hot but great to prep the skin for some sun.    The other thing nice about this hotel is that due to its size and international flair you are a bit more free to behave liberally and as you would at other European reports. We spent a good amount of time at the pool having cocktails (as we were predominately there for a girls weekend and to get some sun). Although the drinks service was a bit slow the attitudes of the staff were helpful and positive.    Do learn a bit of french before travelling- we were able to communicate effectively with everyone but with no french speaker in the group...this sometimes took a few efforts.

Review_Date: Angela D wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here for a week. We had a very comfortable large room with balcony overlooking the city. The beds were very comfortable. The staff were excellent throughout the hotel very friendly and attentive. This includes the housekeeping staff with their lovely smiles the pool staff who kept an eye on everything and were quick to respond to requests and the restaurant staff who were attentive humorous and very hard working. The buffet breakfast which we enjoyed on the terrace each day had a very good selection and the staff were quick to come round for tea/coffee orders etc. the grounds are beautiful and the boutiques were an added bonus. The pool area was very pleasant and we always managed to find sun loungers. The location of the hotel is excellent being only 20 minute walk to the Medina and approximately 20 minute drive to the airport. The road outside was a little noisy at night. The whole week was very good value for money. Would I return to Es Saadi - definitely.

Review_Date: Elaine F wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at the palace for 1 week. We wanted a peaceful but interesting break. We had both. What a fabulous time we had. Excellent service from the moment we arrived all staff were friendly and attentive. Nothing was too much trouble. The grounds and poolside were immaculate. It was the most tranquil experience I've enjoyed for a long time! We used the spa facilities it was again perfect. We were in a suite big traditional rooms. One evening we asked for 2 wine glasses as we had bought a bottle of wine from supermarket. They arrived at our room with an ice bucket and crisps and nuts for us ! What a lovely touch!! The hotel is in the more up market area with great choices for places to eat and drink. A little more expensive but well worth it. It's a 15 minute walk to medina and souks. So your close enough but not too close with all the hustle and bustle it has. Our only little complaint was that there is no tea or coffee in room. But I'm sure if we had asked it would have been organised. As a rule we don't go back to the same hotels but we would definitely return to the Es Saadi palace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucy A wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: I have been lucky enough to have just returned from a week long stay in the Es Saadi Palace. WOW! What a place. An oasis of calm but just 20 mins walk from the centre of the mind boggling Marrakesh. The hotel itself is beautiful expensive but if you want luxury and location you cannot ask for better. Catering mainly for adult French guests as you'd expect lounge poolside in a vast manicured garden (look out for the tortoises) and gaze up at the burgeoning orange trees with the snow capped Atlas mountains in the background. I agree that the evenings were very quiet here for the nights that you don't fancy the bustle of the centre - we found a great little Cafe round the corner - Extrablatt which was fun and relaxed. The junior suite we were in was amazing - huge and every detail seemed to be thought of including a menu of 12 pillow types to choose from to ensure your comfort. A meal on the 3rd floor restaurant is a treat - stunning settings and a very pleasing view - not to be missed.    Overall this holiday was just what we were looking for. Luxury and location.    Thanks.

Review_Title: Memorable stay in a truly amazing hotel
Review_Text: I was lucky enough to stay in one of the villas with my boyfriend for my birthday and I could not really fault anything. The villa itself was beautiful and private we woke up to the sounds of birds in the beautiful gardens service was attentive and friendly the rose petals on the bath mat and the addition of Moroccan soap and products in the bathroom were a nice touch. For those who are peculiar about pillows there was even a pillow menu if we wanted to change for something more specific (we didn't but I was definitely curious).  The Palace nearby is quite a stunning place with ornate walls and ceilings and beautiful Moroccan furniture and details everywhere it is beautiful both inside and out.  The entire hotel felt like a little oasis of peace and greenery only a few minutes cab drive from the craziness of the Medina. All the staff was friendly and helpful from the staff at the breakfast bar to just about anyone else we saw even the gardeners said hello with a smile! The garden has a heated pool which was perfect for the sunny (but not yet too hot) warm weather. We had a hamman (with traditional black soap) at the spa which was really relaxing and leaves you with incredibly soft skin definitely worth trying!! The pool and choice of steam baths were also pretty good especially after a day walking around the souk and the Medina. Needless to say I (well we both) could have stayed there longer rather than fly back to reality and work. Would definitely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeremy S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Stayed 5 nights at the hotel in one of their poolside villas - well a house actually with butler service!! Unable to fault anything. Great experience in terms of service and dining. Hotel a little quiet in the evenings but with Marrakesh a stones throw away...who cares!!    Cant wait to go back

nice hotel walking distance to El Fnaa place and most important hystorical locations swimming pool excellent buffet breakfast in a beautiful palm garden comfortable rooms wifi...definitely a good place to be out of the crowded center but very close!

Review_Date: Steve H wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: I stayed her for 3 nights for a business conference. The rooms are VERY spacious with comfortable beds large and clean bathrooms. My room had a lovely view of the distant snow covered peaks of the Atlas Mountains. The conference facilities are fine as are the lunches. We had a private dinner in the 3rd floor function room which was a great setting with views over the gardens. The Medina is about 500m away if you feel the urge to be hassled and ripped off.

Review_Date: David F wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Set in large gardens just 15 minutes walk from the Medina this recent addition to the Es Saadi Resort is a joy. Offering only suites and all with a garden and mountain view this is the perfect retreat from the chaos of the city. Wonderful pool facilities indoors and out. Free access to its own 'hammam' with many different water treatments - and few customers is a welcome bonus. Above all the service was faultless happy and polite. The bar and restaurant are a little quiet but you can always relax on your balcony watching the sunset over The Atlas Mountains.  A more prosperous predominantly French crowd when we visited set the tone for an upmarket but relaxed break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my company a quite large crowd of sun hungry Norwegians! We entered the hotel before sunset and was met with luxury beyond. The atmosphere the ornate detailing in every corridor stairway doors tiles rooms and outside garden and pool area just stunned us all. My collegue and I roomed together and ended up staying in a 2 story house each allowing us to spread out in our own individual queen size bed like starfish. The bathrooms were decorated with maroccan details floor rugs laid out with rose petals spread out onto them. Just the little extra. Each night 3 chocolates were set on the night table and bottled water bedsheets pulled aside and curtains drawn. My other collegues in gorgeous rooms with spacious balconys overlooking the garden area. Friendly staff everywhere giving me opportunity to freshen up my french vocabulary. My company enjoyed the heated pool and poolbar. Hard to know what a glass of wine actually cost prices differed a bit..also the nespresso capsules in the room were not for free as we thought...these were possibly the only thing I could put my finger on. Delicious meals good selection of fruits and absence of fatty bacon for breakfast...I like! Clean premises romantic light at night from beautiful lanterns! Short ride to the market place about 100mad for taxi or horse carriage ride. No problem. Also  easy walking distance to other hotels with lucious restaurants in the european neighborhood. Would come back any time great also for children!

Review_Title: I am reviewing the Dior Spa. Don't waste your money
Review_Text: I visited the Spa for a massage as we were looking for a luxurious spa. Not worth it at all. The white folder in which the information form to fill is kept into was so dirty the lady change rooms were so smelly and no toilet paper. With my friend we had a couple's massage in room which so cold. We kept asking them to warm it up in vain. We didn't enjoy our hour and half at the spa and couldn't wait to leave. The Royal Mansour Spa is wayyyyy better and much cleaner and pleasant.

Review_Title: Hotel heaven, totally amazing and the best experience ever
Review_Text: We have just came back after a week in Marrakesh having spent 4 nights of our week at the Es Saadi Palace Spa and Resort over Christmas. Having read negative reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor I don't get it I just think some people are never happy we could not fault our stay from the second we arrived to the second we left it was perfect. Having travelled all over the world and stayed in some of the best hotels this has to be the most amazing hotel experience ever.    We booked a superior suite and when we arrived the front of house manager Karima (she is a true professional and great fun all the guests just love her) upgraded us to a corner suite on the 3rd floor of the Palace which was magnificent with a huge terrace balcony huge lounge dining and sitting room and bedroom not one but two walk in wardrobes and a bathroom the size of a small London apartment.
