The room design was a perfect blend of traditional Moroccan with a twist of modern Paris chic (the owners are a French family) really stunning with great attention to detail.    We came across the villas whilst walking around the immaculate landscaped gardens there are over eight hectares to wander around and kept beautiful by a team of gardeners I did see them on the website and thought they would be way out of our price range. We asked if we could have a look at one or two them Karima arranged a visit for us and we were shown around by one of the butlers and instantly fell in love with them so much so we booked in for our last two nights. We moved into the Sultane Villa and it was just heaven with its own 50 Sqm private pool 500 sqm of landscaped gardens the interior was designed for a Sultan. From the handcrafted fireplace hand carved stone ceiling marble and stone bathroom with sunken Jacuzzi huge drapes separating the rooms dressing room with the most amazing hand crafted wooden wardrobes it was like we had stepped onto amazing film set it was truly luxurious.    Our butler put a Christmas tree in our room and even left our Xmas presents and a few extra gifts from the hotel under the tree. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff or butlers they were always on hand to help. We went out for a walk in the Medina and when we got back our butler had built a roaring fire and brought us some amazing canapes and a bottle of champagne as we got ready to go to dinner.    The hotel was built by and to this day is run by the same family since 1956. They have built a business on delighting and exceeding guests expectations and it really does show. They hosted a champagne jazz and canap√© reception for all the guests in the lobby next to the biggest Xmas tree I have ever seen (it was designed by a famous French designer) where they greeted all the guests we met the all three generations of the family and every guest was treated like a member of their family. This is so rare in today's world of branded hotel chains you don't come across such personal service to me it's on par with Sandy Lane in Barbados. On Christmas day the butler delivered an amazing breakfast by our pool (like in the suites where we had breakfast on the terrace the food was outstanding). Again he lit the fire while we ate it was picture perfect opening our presents on Xmas day in front of a roaring fire glass of champagne in hand the sun shining it was truly magical.    We paid several visits to the spa again the service was awesome if you stay in the palace you can use all the facilities in the spa from herbal steam to the ice bath they have a great gym also. The staff are a credit to the hotel and its owners it was even a joy to lose money in the casino which is also within the grounds so you don't even have to pay for the cab fare if you lose all your money!. There are several restaurants with in the hotel but we just lounged around the villa and ordered room service.    If you want to be spoilt and treated like a Sultan then look no further than the Es Saadi we loved it so much we are planning my birthday in some of the two bed villas in June with a group of friends. Compared to places like the Burj in Dubai or the Versace Villa in Miami it's a faction of the cost and worth every single penny but the big difference is you get your own oasis of luxury and don't have to share with others!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hilary H wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: We had a lovely week at this hotel despite concerns over negative reviews. Yes it maybe isn't a five star hotel  there were a few issues with it being dated but all the staff were friendly and very helpful which made our stay enjoyable. For us the location was great- away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina- but very walkable.  If you go to the hotel visit the small boutiques on site. They are not well signposted but the assistants are great and the prices comparable to what you would pay in the Medina without the hassle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leanne T wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Fabulous stay here in July. Hotel is breathtaking as I'm sure are the villa's in the grounds. Two hotel sites one with a casino. The hotel grounds have long winding walks along palm tree lined paths so it was surprising to take a long stroll without actually leaving the hotel one night! Every now and then you come across one of the hotel's gated villa's.    The hotel is only a short walk from both the old town and the new town.    Two hotel pools (one is much better than the other although both absolutely amazing for a dip from the hot weather). Pools are manned by people asking if you would like any refreshments or food from the cafe which is brought to your lounger.    The little boutique shops tucked away on site were very pleasant and I got two great paintings from there.    Breakfast each morning was extensive and stunning. Fruit yogurts cooked breakfasts and continental options and pastries. So good and very well catered for.    We also visited the spa for hammam and massage. Hammam was unceremonious (it was my first time and I wasn't expecting it to be as rough!) but massage was lovely and in a lovely building just next to the pool.    Tip - people do expect tips in Marrakech so take a couple of extra notes and be prepared to have to ask for change back if you order pool service.    We're hoping to visit again this time going with a big group of friends to use one of the villa's with a private pool :)

Review_Date: Victor C wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We went to this hotel for two weeks with Saga. It is a pleasant hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Our package was half-board and we paid for an upgrade to a pool facing room rather than the standard city facing room. This had the benefits of a quieter location (day time) and a south facing view which meant that we could sit on our balcony in the sunshine. The downside was that our room also faced the Casino which played loud music until four or five in the morning. Much of the noise could be drowned out by using the very efficient air con. however if you are a light sleeper you may have difficulties.    The half-board dinner menu was rather limited in choice although the quality of food was always good. Service however was quite slow. Unfortunately we arrived at the start of a three day religious festival which was not indicated in the guide books or by our operator. This resulted in less staff available and a considerably longer wait for menu items. Fortunately after the festival things speeded up to just slow.    Breakfast was not good particularly if a hot meal was required. A reasonable choice of cold food was available but watching the flies running over the cold meats is rather off-putting.    Prices for extras e.g. drinks at meals or in the bar were extremely high. We overcame this by shopping locally at shops or supermarkets. Apparently the hotel is quite happy for you to buy wine water etc. outside and consume it within the hotel.    We usually holiday all-inclusive and I found that this was a much more expensive option.    Finally this is not a five star hotel except in pricing. Bedroom furnishings are not just 'tired' but positively 'weary'. Their sister hotel next door is five star and although guests are told that facilities can be shared it is not really encouraged.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil Rickards wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Full disclosure: we won a weekend here in a raffle    A very luxurious hotel. The rooms are fantastic. The proprietress was often around to greet or say goodbye. Pool and breakfast both good. Bar and restaurants were good but expensive and quite deserted when we were there    Around half the spa rooms weren't operating but those that were were good. And the spa treatments were well done    Note: if you find a deal that's too-good-to-be-true check if you're at the "Hotel" on the same site. It's also nice but not quite the same level of luxury    Good location for walking into the market and central square for the evening
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent 3 days here. We stayed in the palace. Beautiful grounds and magnificent pool! Excellent accommodations wonderful friendly staff. Staff went above and beyond to help us in everything we needed! We arrived at 10pm in the evening without having dinner. We asked if there was some place we could get dinner in the hotel and they accommodated us at one of their restaurants even tho it was closed. The staff prepared an authentic Moroccan meal which was delicious we were entertained by the musician playing a Moroccan instrument. It was amazing that they kept the restaurant open for us along with their staff without feeling rushed. Will stay there again when we go back for our next visit! Thank you to all the staff at Es Saadi you did a fantastic job!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emily S wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Well what can we say - the hotel was just perfect for our 5 day trip to Marrakech. The swimming pool at the hotel was perfect in the afternoon after a morning of shopping or visiting the tourist attractions. Please note that the hotel pool on this resort is smaller than the palace pool and look into this before booking to avoid confusion. It's still very nice though and always a bed available. The service was impeccable and they looked after me and my dear friend for the whole 5 days. Nothing was ever too much trouble and everything was delivered with a smile even giving us a room to shower in after we checked out so that we were fresh for our night flight home. The breakfast buffet was also so very suitable with a great choice from continental and warm food. Finally book into the spa if you have time or visit the casino on the complex - this was great value for money and the treatments were fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel and I have to all my friends and family booking a trip to Marrakech.

What and excellent resort. Our visit was for three days and our daughter selected the Es Saadi Resort for us as she is working in Marrakesh and is staying in the Es Saadi Hotel. The service is excellent. The breakfast buffet was superb with every type of tropical fresh fruit that you could ask for. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Enjoy the enormous pool and the spa is second to none.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There is an element of understated grandeur about the Es Saadi gardens. It's all old world chic and standards. Subsequently that is reflected in the level of service that you get here. It's impeccable. Nothing is too much trouble and everything is delivered with a smile. But the real star of the show is the food. We booked on a half board basis rather than full board. A choice that certainly stood us in good stead. Breakfast is a veritable feast of fruit pastries and cooked food that will sustain you until much later in the day. The dinner menu changed on a daily basis and was a three course serving with plenty of choice between local Moroccan dishes and Western classics. The weather is pretty much guaranteed sunshine from May to September. The food and the sunshine will have you coming back time and time again.

Review_Date: Ben M wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: Main pool empty with no announcement or refund from management
Review_Text: Terrible. The main lagoon pool was drained empty with no warning. We complained to reception and emailed and still have not been answered to the compensation we seek. Without the pool we were left with a much smaller pool barely a quarter of the size. The hotel would have been much nicer to stay in perhaps 10-20yrs ago where the would have been more than 25 guests in the palace. The bars and lounges were empty leaving no atmosphere to socialise with other guests. The belly dancing and snake charming dinner was not running either due to the low level of guests. The restaurant prices were also absurd. About 4-5 more expensive than the food in the medina. A (very) simple lunch costing ‚Ç¨40 compared to medina prices of ‚Ç¨15 for 2. Stay at the Sofitel next door much nicer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susan G wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel from the 27th June until the 11th July so we were there at the same time as the couple who said people were fighting for sunbeds how strange we did not have any trouble getting any sunbeds in fact a lot of them were empty the hotel only had a 60% occupancy at the time. Were they at the same hotel as us!! Top marks to all the staff who were friendly and courteous the food excellent we had a very enjoyable holiday with no complaints at all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just a few minutes walking distance from the city (10- 15 min). The rooms are Amazing and the spa is quite big and good.The breakfast perfect and the they have a well trained service that will help you with everything.    The pool is really big. Perfect place to rest some days in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katherine H wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: I was able to go to Marrakech on a fluke. It was Ramadan and I was flying solo so I thought a Hotel would be best. Not only was the Hotel decorated like a Raid but it had all the modern convenience one could ever need. The food was to die for and the service was excellent (even though they were fasting). The casino was more fun than a barrel of monkeys! Maybe not a truly 5 star but neither are the prices. I highly recommend it!

Review_Date: Steve B wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: The Palace What can i say Well i have traveled round the world and been lucky enough to enjoy the spoils of some great destinations. I have to say that this place tips the lot. We also missed our transport link from the airport to the hotel but to experience the local taxi what a way to start our break. Both myself and partner arrived smiling to the resort. The welcome was great we where early and our room wasn't ready so a refreshing Moroccan tea later we where shown to our room and then given a choice of rooms. We stayed in the Junior Suit clean comfy huge and delightful. My partners birthday took place during our stay and the hotel staff couldn't do enough for us they where all brilliant. I went i search of the hotel GM Daniel to commend him on our experiences and he openly admitted things have gone by the wayside but he was managing this and implementing new things to make peoples stay better. Not really sure what this will en-tale as we just couldn't fault it. Stunning Pool Rooms and Staff. Would i recommend this hotel? YES without question. Oh forgot to mention the celebrity's staying there from France and the UK just added to probably the best break i have ever had. SEE YOU AGAIN SOON !!!!!! A Huge Thank You to you all..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: More like a resort on its own
Review_Text: Es Saadi Palace is a beautiful facility. They have an outdoor swimming pool indoor heated swimming pool "Oriental Thermae" which has dry steam aromatherapy sauna rooms and these all can be used free of charge. They also have a Moroccan person playing a guitar of some sort and serve mint tea by the musician all day long. The spa was a bit expensive for us so we didn't use it but it looks beautiful and I'm sure you would have a wonderful time if you want to be pampered. Also please eat at their restaurant though very pricey in Morocco (spent about 7000 MAD about $100) for two dishes for dinner but SO worth it. Have their lamb chop. Hope they never change their chef. It was seriously the best lamb chop I had anywhere in the world! My only "complaint" is that they don't serve free breakfast at the Palace but if you walk 3 blocks there's a restaurant that serves food all day long at a fairly reasonable price. The Palace is about 15 min walking distance from the Medina and about 20 min walking distance from Majorelle Garden. If you mention that you want to go here from train station they will charge 100 MAD for what really should cost 10 MAD for a 5 min ride so beware!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sally G wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel let down by some of the staff
Review_Text: No transport to meet us at the airport - not a very good start! We did eventually make contact with the hotel to come and meet us - they were "desole" and very apologetic which was nice but we still had a two hour wait while our room was made ready! When we finally got into it however it was gorgeous. View over the pool and lovely gardens just sensational. As was breakfast the following morning - but it was cleared away much before time and service was surly to say the least. The concierges - both of them - were not particularly helpful either and we did not manage to book any of the trips we had hoped for. Final disappointment was that our bill included items we had not had or signed for and when we pointed this out the reaction was hostile to say the least.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in the Palace for four nights. The hotel and suites are traditional and very spacious with a balcony and table and chairs. The bathroom is gorgeous slippers dressing gown toiletries and hairdryer (in the drawer) provided. Housekeeping did a great job cleaned in the mornings and changed towels and turned down sheets in the evening. The bed is extremely comfortable with extra soft pillows but we discovered a pillow menu on our last day! All the staff are friendly and helpful and will provide whatever you need; they mostly don't look for tips but are very happy to accept them if offered. The hotel is ideally situated as it's a 10-15 min walk to the square and is close to the main road but the noise didn't bother us or disturb our sleep. The grounds are vast beautiful and well tended. Pools are lovely surrounded by sunbeds with mattresses and the pool attendant will bring towels - 'baskets' with a canopy mattress and cushions provide extra comfort and privacy . Lunch time food is good big portions but pricey. We only had one issue during our stay in that we had no hot water on our second evening. I felt this was not dealt with correctly as once I had reported it there was an element of surprise and was told reception would get back to me. After 30 mins no call so I inquired again and was told it was the whole palace yet other people were going out all dressed up for dinner. I would expect a 5* hotel to supply hot water and certainly offer an apology for the inconvenience particularly as I had explained we had dinner reservations but the apology never came neither did an offer to use another room. We were offered the spa but I didn't feel having a shower and getting ready in a room with strangers was appropriate. As the hotel was not full I found this disappointing but it didn't spoil our stay. We settled for a cold shower in our room cancelled our reservation and ate locally at La Table du Marche (5 min walk from hotel) again which is very good and well worth a visit. On the whole we had a very pleasant stay at the Es Saadi Palace and apart from the water everything else was wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kelly J wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: The Palace offers large rooms complete with sectional couches small dining table desk large comfortable bed and a quaint balcony with lounges. The bathroom was wonderful as the large soaker tub was lovely. I have to say I just loved the long over-sized robe too! The service was outstanding. All staff were accommodating and eager to ensure your stay was without issue. The food was excellent and the choice of items on the menu sufficient. My favourite was the spa. The treatments and treatment rooms were better than most I've ever had or been in. The facilities atmosphere and products were first rate along with the technicians. I loved the room of beds as a waiting area in between treatments. Gorgeous gardens. Location was excellent even with the busy road running behind - it is in the middle of the city after all. Would stay again in a second.

Review_Date: Michiel G wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: plusses: fantastic garden lovely suites with nice Maroccan design swimming pool stunning quiet polite staff beautiful fitness excellent spa free wifi nice restaurant at the pool friendly staff very clean good advice for trips    room for improvement: overall maintenance bar rather outdated billiard not up to standard tennis court needs overhaul staff requires more service training restaurants not 5 star

Spent a week at this hotel in April. We could not fault it for value - the food service and facilities were excellent. The fact that it was in such fantastic surroundings - acres of gardens filled with roses leading to the Palace Hotel in which we were made so welcome - both for dinner and drinks if we chose to made the deal even better. The convenience of being able to get to the centre so quickly was an added bonus. Thank you Es Saadi Gardens for a memorable holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alice D wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Es Saadi is rather tired perhaps because we visited when it was a bit empty. However I think this just adds to its charm. The staff are phenomenally helpful and friendly I can't praise them enough. They're always ready with a "bonjour" or an "as-alymalykum" whenever they see you and are generally brilliant. The restaurants aren't great although the one by the pool is nice for lunch. I'd recommend going to Extrablatt (just a 5 minute walk away) for dinner instead or perhaps into the Medina. Definitely stay for the breakfast though; just make sure the birds don't drink your orange juice when you're not looking! All in all very nice especially if you get a room with a balcony overlooking the pool and Atlas mountains. Oh and like everywhere in Marrakech bring earplugs: if you're a light sleeper you risk being woken by either the beautiful song of the birds or the equally beautiful call to prayer!

Hotel is in a lovely setting with beautiful gardens  there is the choice if on half board to eat in sister hotel  however the food served was of variable quality main moan was the huge portions and they way it was served unappetising  Pool on a hot day lovely beware constant pestering in the medina though .If a little boy latches onto you he will want cash  Drinks western prices

When we were taken to our room I actually gasped when we entered the enormous painted door. The suite is just gorgeous with fresh roses around the room. We absolutely loved the huge comfy bed and waking up hearing the bird song from the garden each morning. The gardens are kept immaculate and are teeming with flowers and lush palms. We really enjoyed the breakfast each morning. It is beautifully presented and changes daily.    As far as staff they are professional and polite. I was assisted enormously by Samir the Head Concierge in respect of work I was trying to finalise. He could not have been more patient or helpful.    Other nice things about the hotel: I really enjoyed the playing of live music each day and the mint tea! In addition the Spa is one of the most lovely I have ever visited. I really do not know how you can fault this establishment. It is truly a wonderful place. I can only hope to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful stay - great value - beautiful gardens & pool setting
Review_Text: We have visited many countries over the world. Our party of 4 had a wonderful stay at this hotel (poolside view). Superb friendly and efficient staff. They could not have been more helpful - just be friendly and tip appropriately. Arab people are usually very friendly if you are the same. local wages are low and you should reward appropriately for good service. Very comfortable rooms. Wonderful buffet breakfast. Irresistible pastries. Good evening restaurant (delicious fish tajine). Gardens are large and impressive. Extra facilities available through the sister Palace hotel & casino. Very pleasant walk into town if you go left out of the hotel straight on past the cafe on the corner (good food) and through the hotel private road by the city walls. Taxis always available by the gate. Complaints about birds at breakfast? - must be nature haters. The birds are a joy. Sit in the sunshine and enjoy the breakfast. On some nights there can be noise for a short time when people leave the casino. It provides interest and all you have to do is close the balcony doors which give you a lovely view of the mountains from the upper floors. Sunsets and sunrises can be magical. Do take a trip up the Ourika Valley. Walk the falls.

Review_Date: Beverley D wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Lovely hotel staff very friendly nothing too much trouble. Lovely touch was the roses in room and bathroom complete with rose petals on towels was basin and bidet. I had a fall so had to have room service a couple of times and each time the trolley had more roses on it. Food was excellent lovely starter of marinated sea bream highly recommened as was the beef carpacchio nice presentation and just the right amount. Would certainly go there again.

It is a superb hotel with all the necessary amenities lovely pool nice gardens breakfasts are very good and offer all what one would expect (fresh orange all kinds of eggs "viennoiseries" fresh fruits...). Very helpful and attentive staff Rooms are nice and well furnished.  Security is low key and very efficient.  I did not visit the suites nor the rooms at the Palace but y apparently are outstanding.  The Spas which I did not experience (according to my companion) are first rate.  A low key luxury !  The shops are a bit disappointing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: debbie o wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: The Hotel has a lovely pool area and the gardens are well kept.Most of the staff are very helpful  some of the ladies on the desk are a bit sullen. The breakfasts are very good and lots of fresh fruit and fresh orange juice and nice breads  cereals and hot breakfasts are available  i didnt try them so i cant comment .    The worst part of the hotel is the noise that happens every night so you wake up as the people are leaving the casino  they love their hooters on the cars so they sit in the cars and wait for the people to come out. Our last night which was a Saturday night we were woken by lots and lots of cars hooting and people shouting at each other at 2 am there is a disco run by a nearby hotel so the locals go either to the night club or casino we looked out the window and saw lots of cars  it looked like New years eve in London  we were awake at least for an hour and a half  i phoned the reception but all they said would i like to change rooms?  you would have heard this noise in the whole hotel . So we were very tired by the time we got up for breakfast  i told the receptionist when we left and they just turned there noses up  they dont seem to care  so i hope this makes people think before they book this hotel.We booked a day trip to the Atlas mountains through the hotel which was nice  just a bit drawn out  they stopped too long for lunch but it was nice to see outside Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris A wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We just got back from our first trip to Marrakech and I can honestly say it was one of the best surprises we have had in a long time. We went looking for a bit of sunshine to escape the cold of London and instead found a place to stay that was just Great!! Es Saadi Palace. The staff were so incredibly attentive and helpful from the moment we arrived until we left. No request was too small or too big and the front desk and concierge were incredibly helpful in arranging transport making recommendations for dinner lining up a guide that gave us our tour instead of his and even directions to one of the numerous great restaurants that were literally a 10 min walk away. The room was large spacious clean and had a fantastic shower and gigantic bed. The spa was fantastic and the food in the restaurants was great as well. We also fell in love with mint tea while on the trip and they have a little collection of sweets in the front lobby all the time that are great--simple pleasures--but those really are the best. Thank you Samir and all the staff for a fantastic time--we will see you again soon.

we stayed in "favorite" villa. excellent service by butlers special thanks to concierge "sameer" for his recomendation for local restaurants and places to go in Marrakesh. only sad thing is that breakfast is too poor. we had option for breakfast at the room by butlers and that was superb BUT i feel sorry for other guest who would be having breakfast at the restaurant.  one of the best location in marrakesh. we spent minimum money on Taxi as complete city was reachable walking including old city and french side of the city. night club and casino additional advantage. I have been to many destinations in world for Spa and this hotel offers you one of the best Spa with huge indoor swimming pool.  truely a memorable experience.  Thank you all my butlers you guys made it best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wendy A wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: My friend and I decided to go to Es Saadi Palace for my birthday in early December 2012. We had an amazing time. From the very moment we arrived the staff there couldn't do enough for us. We were initially greeted by lovely and welcoming staff offering us tea and cakes. The rooms were also beautiful. The resort was beautiful and luxurious. Great location. It has a club and casino attached both of which were great. The concierge team were very helpful and we ended up going to amazing restaurants and on fantastic trips because of their recommendations. I would also highly recommend the quad biking and the traditional Moroccan cookery class in a Riad. The buffet at breakfast in the hotel was honestly one of the best I have ever seen in terms of quality and variety.  The only downside was that it could be quite noisy late at night when people came back from clubs in the early hours. Also the food in the restaurant or for room service was incredibly over priced. We had the same meals in local restaurants down the road for a fraction of the prices we paid in the hotel. The same goes for alcohol in the hotel.

Review_Date: Amardeep k wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: my cousin and i acquired an excellent deal to this resort and after reading the rave reviews we were not disappointed. upon arrival we were greeted to a friendly door man who served us tea we checked in quickly and were dazzled at the spacious luxurious and phenomenal palace. Our room was a decent size with a balcony overlooking the atlas mountains and exceptionally clean and comfortable. the palace boasts a huge spa along with 2 swimming pools a gym and 4 restaurants. the location is set in a desirable area not too far from the jema el fna and also has access to a casino and nightclub.    the staff were extremely helpful and overall the service was impeccable. would highly recommend this to anyone who may not want to be within the rush of the medina walls all the time. would stay again.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel but mind you don't get charged for things you didn't consume.
Review_Text: We really enjoyed this hotel until we were asked to pay for wine we had not drunk at dinner.  We asked for a receipt when we paid in the restaurant but the waiter gave us one for red wine not the bottle of white we had paid for and kept in the restaurant fridge overnight. Then the concierge said we hadn't paid until we remembered we never ordered red. Honest mistake?  We didn't think so and it left a nasty taste. Apart from that the hotel is very beautiful set in huge splendid gardens with great pools. Rooms are lovely too. Dinner service was sometimes somewhat surly and tips are assumed by not returning with change which annoys. Perhaps that was the reason for the wine deception. Such a shame because it is a stunning property.

Review_Date: Susi S wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: A wonderful oasis of calm in Marakkech
Review_Text: Beautiful rooms.......delicious food.....wonderful service. I'd return here with no hesitation. I enjoyed the spa and got to experience my first Hammam with a delightful and caring attendant. Everything about Es Saadi was superb.

One can only say "Wow!" (and "sorry I can't stay longer") after experiencing this exceptional property and service. "Wow" when entering the hotel room for the first time (and I was only staying in a "standard" room). "Wow" when venturing into the gardens and pool area. "Wow" about the exceptional service and offers to assist. Any shortfalls are only nitpicking but let's list them just to be totally transparent.    1) Only one elevator to the rooms .  2) No buffet breakfast (at least during my 2 night stay) -- everything was ordered a la carte. However service was generally speedy and accurate. Try the Moroccan pancakes!  3) Fitness room is huge with lots of brand new equipment. They have a small ant problem and so I decided not to do my stretches on the floor.    I heard the Spa was "very expensive" so I didn't venture in except to use the complimentary Fitness Room (only open from 9 a.m. - 9 pm).    None of the above detracts from my overall five star rating and great desire to return here. And for those who might be wondering although La Mamounia has the reputation (well deserved) for its full top-notch experience Es Saadi Gardens - Palace can be half the price and thus a much much better deal for basically the same experience.

This is an incredible five star experience. The rooms are huge - suites in fact and the bathrooms are the size of many hotel rooms. Gym was good and overall service was excellent. Breakfast was a large buffet. It was unfortunate I had no time to enjoy the incredible grounds and outside pool nor the spa.    If you want to spoil yourself come stay here. This may well be the finest hotel experience you ever have.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristi H wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: We loved our stay here. Originally scheduled for 9 nights we ended up leaving after 6 because of a scheduling conflict but the management could not have been nicer and more helpful to us ... securing us an upgraded room at no cost to us of course at the Four Seasons Marrakech for the last 3 nights of our stay. Thank you Samir.    The Palace is a beautiful building with large rooms and exquisite art in every room. The pool was huge and clean and well maintained. The Dior Spa was INCREDIBLE and I can recommend the massages and the facials at least one of which I had every day of our stay.    We were served a decadent and delicious breakfast every morning in our room. The restaurants were all fantastic especially the top floor fancy one. Can't remember its' name right now but the food there was top notch.    The palace is an easy walk to the medina or the square and there are several good restaurants and clubs within walking distance as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights and i wish i had more time.    The staff were really helpful and always willing to do more. The room was clean with everything working properly. The pool was clean too and always enough seats - when the pool staff get to knnow you after 1 or 2 days they tend to reserve your bed for you.    We had half board but only found out that we could eat at the casino on the 3rd night - the food in the casino was to die for! I had to keep asking if they were sure that it was covered because it was that good. We spent 2 and half hours eating and drinking! We ate in the hotel the first two nights and i was really pleased with that also.    We went to a Moroccan themed night that the hotel had planned which consisted of us eating traditional moroccan food with a Moroccan show. This was fantastic! The food was really good and i am Moroccan so i can judge Moroccan food really well the portions were massive too. They had live bands belly dancers and gymnasts etc.    The hotel was about 10 minutes in a cab from old marrakesh and possibly 2-3 minutes from new marrakesh so it was a good balance. The hotel is stuck on to a casino if you go to the back of the hotel. From there you can also access shisha cafes and other bars.    I only managed to wake up for breakfast once ( its a holiday!) but the one day that i did go down i had a good full breakfast. Eating breakfast in the garden is like nothing ive experienced before listening to the birds and the trees it was actually very quiet on my table i think every one was just enjoying the food an the surroundings. I had soup and some croissants with almond something in them - it was really good! The fruit was fresh too.    The main thing i remember about this hotel is about how attentive the staff were. I was feeling very poorly one day and the staff asked if i was alright i told them about how i felt and the next morning i had the receptionist knocking on my door checking to see how i am and if they could go to the pharmacy for me! You cant buy service like that.

There are 3 hotels on this complexwe stayed at the hotelthe service is good and food accecptable the gardens are beautiful peacefull and quietfull of twittering birds.  Very close to the medinabut easey to get around with a callechor small yellow taxior the open top city bus.All prices very reasonable.  We also had dinner at the palace hotelwhich was lovley.  We had 8 days in marakechwhich were enjoyable.as we travelled at end octthe weather was not to hotbut lots of rain also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just spent a lovely weekend staying at the Es Saadi Palace in Marrakech. The location of the hotel is perfect for a weekend spent exploring the city. It is just outside the Medina which balances out the busy souks with having some quiet time to relax.    The service at the hotel was excellent. Samir the concierge couldn't do enough for us and was extremely efficient at sorting out restaurant reservations a guide and other excursions.    The rooms were beautiful and spacious and the bed huge and comfy!    There are a lots of facilities at the Palace including a huge spa and lovely outdoor swimming pools. We picked a quiet weekend to visit the palace so often had them all to ourselves.    I would definitely recommend the hotel to all first time visitors to Marrakech as they will be beautifully looked after and the staff will make sure its a trip to remember.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: andrew l wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: Absolutely stunning hotel in beautiful palatial settings.    The pool is exquisite and the Dior spa and gym are wonderful - mainly empty with water and nuts for energy on hand.    Great location - walking distance to souks main square and local restaurants.    Wonderful mint tea on demand.

Review_Date: Saif A wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at the Es Saadi gardens and resort - palace marrakech for three nights in August 2012. First plse note that there are three properties in the huge gardens: hotel palace and villas. In addition there is a spa and casino    Hotel- some 150 rooms and 15 suites which can be crowded during peak period  Palace - there are all suites from 70 to 250 m2 and also there are 8 small ksars villas built in berber architectural. These Ksars are ideal for families or group of friends. We stayed at the suite in the palace all decorated in typical morroccon deco including terra cotta tiled floors and moroccan rugs which we loved it.  Villas- there are 10 large villas up 200 m2 with own gardens and private swimming pool. Each villa built in unique design and colors. The villas are nested in the colorful garden but they are very expensive    Location of resort  The resort is located in hivernage where most of the top hotels are located and some 15 to 20 min walk to the old medina and jamaa el fna. It is a safe and nice walk including good pavement all the way past the fountains. I recommend staying out of chaos and noises of the old medina and instead in hivernage oasis where there is peace and tranquility    Suite Room in the palace  Our palace suite was HUGE with biggest and comfortable bed we ever have stayed ( i think the bed is 7ft x 6.7ft) . This bed is so confoy and better than all brand hotels.The linen and the amenities were all natural and of highest quality. There is a huge bathroom: separate toilet and biddet huge bathtub for two separate shower even for two to indulge in whatever you can imagine a walk in cupboard and large a safety box. There is a sitting room with large tv dining table mini bar with free soft drinks free coffee expresso and a working desk. At the private terrace there is a good view of the swimming pool and city with a day bed two sunbathing chairs and table. Amazing during the day was too hot but evening was cooler and nice    Service  The staff are the excellent and are very ken and helpful to ensure memorable stay. Once you enter the palace you are greated with morrocon mint tea and morrocon live local solo music. The check in is fast and swift and then you are then given a 10 mini tour of the resort (which you need)    The concierge is one of the best I have seen. He is soft spoken and did arrange for us two tours (day tour for old medina souk and the other one to ourika valley) plus arranged for first class railway ticket to casablanca. Highly recommended to travel by train - it is comfortable and relative cheap. We paid usd $15 one way per person for first class ticket from Marrakech to casa and takes 3 hrs and trains are on time    Breakfast is la carte and you can order whatever you want try the local dishes including moroccan crepes. More choices in the la carte menu could be added.    Restaurants  There are 8 restaurants in the complex but we decided most of the time to eat outside in local restaurants - try chicken lemon    Spa el Saadi palace  Has large indoor heated pool and is really a place for relaxation and serenity and opens 9 to 9  My wife and myself had 80 min the Marrakech Hammam with body scrub with wrap massage and essential oil moisturizing. The ancestral ritual of the morrocon Hammad is a blissful experience where the skin after having been exfoliated with black soap and then covered with ghasssoul earth is cleared of all impurities and leaves smooth and cool skin    My wife endulged herself with rose and Argan facial treatment. Whe you visit Marakesh do put forget to buy Argan natural products which you vpcan either get at the market or at the ourika valley cooperative factory some 45 min drive from Marrakech    Overall the highest standard facilities and the service in this resort is the best i have seen plus great location and good value for money (paid via hotels.com some usd 450 per day for a suite at the palace) . I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely inform my friends and relatives and will come back    I think one reviewers wasn't happy because some staff could not speak proper English - but there are many who speak    Go for it and you won't regret I promise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel was simply wonderful. The rooms were spacious and the hotel grounds were spectacular. A Las Vegas type setting. My room had a balcony that overlooked the pool area and the gardens depending on which way you were looking.    I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler staying in Marrakech MOrocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: D C wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: We had the most wonderful stay at Es Saadi Palace celebrating the wedding anniversarry of dear friends. The location is perfect for good restaurants and night life and an easy ride in to the Medina.  The spa facilities at Es Saadi are magnificent. Excellent quality facilities and very well trained therapists.  We had some wonderful meals in all the restaurants and the Frech chef was espcially strong on pastries. His macaroons were a particular treat and I had the best home made gluten free bread I have ever tasted in a hotel anywhere in the world.  ~What made our trip espcially enjoyable was the personal attention of the staff in particular Laurence Jeanvoine whose attention to detail and friendliness was something you don't find in many large hotels around the world. I would highly reccomend this restort to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Review_Title: Es Saadi Palace my second home Fantastic
Review_Text: You find few hotels that can accomplish the true 5 star experience but Es Saadi Palace exceeds those expectations. It has the charm to dazzle you with decor and true Moroccan ambience the staff are over the top with being helpful and not just friendly but feels like your friends. That is why it feels like you are home amongst your most trusted friends. And of course it has comfort and they make you comfortable. The location was perfect for me near the Medina but in the chic part of town. This is a must stay. The gardens pools and spa are superb so much detail and attention is paid to these places. The night life also tickles many fancies from a night club feel to a lounge setting with wonderful musicians. In every way a must stay.

Review_Title: Exemplary Service and Style at Es Saadi Palace
Review_Text: I‚Äôve just spent a week at the Es Saadi Palace in Marrakech. My experience with Es Saadi however began long before I ever got to Morocco. Never having stayed at the Es Saadi or been to Marrakech before I began planning far in advance. I wished to arrange things as much as possible before I got there to ensure the experience was what I wished it to be. Which it has been. None of this early planning would have been possible without the able help and assurances of the Es Saadi reservation agents especially Lamia Alfa and Nadine Jadari who answered all of my questions and made reservations at several restaurants along with Concierges Mr. Errouk and Samir Alalaoui once I arrived.  My first introduction to Es Saadi Palace was the friendly driver awating my arrival at the Marrakech airport. A friendly face where he is promised to be upon first arriving in a foreign country for the first time is a worthwhile thing. This was my first hint that Es Saadi would deliver on all they promised and more.  Es Saadi is conveniently located just outside the medina. In a way a perfect location. A 10 minute walk will put you in the centre of all the action in Djema El Fna Square and bustling souks in the medina. Right next door is Casino Marrakech. Fine dining is in the hotel or casino and many more options within walking distance or short cab or caleche ride away. But when you want to escape the heat noise action of the exotic city the oasis of Es Saadi is nearby.  With luggage collected I was quickly taken to the Palace and greeted by music friendly door men and reception staff some hot mint tea and sweets. Check in was taken care of while I indulged then after a short tour including the Spa I was taken to my Villa.  This was a gift really. The Villa stay was an upgrade by the hotel. Of course such a thing is not to be an expectation at any hotel but their willingness to do this was itself a precursor of the fine service which would follow for the next week.  I am a bit of an oddity; a single traveler who does not speak much French and no Arabic or Berber. But none of this was an issue at the Palace (although somewhat at the Spa). My villa was the Art Deco. A spectacular place to spend the week. So much so that I changed plans to spend more time in my room! To lounge in my very own L-shaped private pool. Have a wonderful meal and wine on my outdoor patio with the Villa‚Äôs wonderful butler service.  The staff including the excellent butler service at the Villa was always friendly prompt and of high calibre. Whatever you asked for they asked if you wanted more. The door men in their smart white uniforms were also very friendly and willing to help with finding a cab or caleche or do whatever you needed doing. Each night I would return from my adventures in the city or medina to find my room well taken care of lanterns lit at poolside trays of sweets and plenty of water (which you will need in the Moroccan heat). The main Palace pool area is extensive and well taken care of as are the grounds of thriving foliage. On my last night the owner kindly sent over a parting gift of olive oil and marmalade. This was indeed like staying at a Palace. Many thanks to the fine people at Es Saadi for making my stay memorable and special. I highly recommend Es Saadi Palace.
five star hotel convenient to sites in Marrakesh. We liked the Bulgarian violin/piano duo who entertained every night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Only good works for this hotel!the service is very nice and polite clean rooms everytime nice views...its a destiny you dont care to come many timesits my second.perfect!

Review_Title: Most amazing hotel ever! Truely magical!
Review_Text: If u want to experience staying in a palace this is where you want to go. The spa pool and facilities are fantastic a little pricey but definetly worth every penny. The palace can be a little quite but that's what we wanted. It was a real pleasure to be there and the staff were fantastic! Definetly will visit again this year!

Review_Title: Es Saaid Palace... Arabic for "Palace of Inate Sadness"?
Review_Text: I often "switch off" when I see what appears to be a long and bad review and quickly go to the next 5 star review because I only want to read "good". You will note by my other reviews over the years I am not an habitual moaner. If a hotel or restaurant is great it gets said..... conversely if it's bad it also gets said in an effort to advise others to avoid our mistakes. This hotel was one of our pretty rare mistakes. This is the 7th time we have been to Marrakech and seven appears to have been our unlucky number on this trip. We have stayed at La Mamounia Palmeraie Palace and a GREAT Riad Dar Donab all Deluxe properties. Unfortunately they were fully booked for half term and we chose ‚ÄúPalace‚Äù Es Saaid on the strength of TripAdvsor reviews. This time and unusually we were silly enough not to have actually READ the reviews but relied on how many 5 stars reviews we saw. Upon our having ACTUALLY read themafter the event we sincerely are at a complete loss as to quite why this relatively average property (compared to the Deluxe properties we stay at worldwide) has received more than its fair share than it ought of decent reviews. The Palace Es Saadi is a "quiet and relaxing place"....... so long as you keep the double-glazed balcony doors closed so you can't hear the CONSTANT hum of traffic from the nearby main road which you can resoundingly hear by the pool area. This is a family run hotel with NO management structure[ that you would expect from a Deluxe hotel group and we certainly saw no sign of day-today involvement. We felt there to be an innate sadness to this hotel that we have not experienced in a purported Deluxe property before. We found there to be either false or no smiles from staff) and sincerely the worst karma we have experienced. We felt that the staff acted as though they were "scared" of the owner. From the very first 'next morning" we were literally counting the days of our to return to London. The concierge[Unknown] desk we found particularly unhelpful. There is NO structure whatsoever for complaints. (again we are sincerely not a typical complaining couple) other than to the owner directly. We paid full price through Amex Platinum (who subbed it to Classic Collection Holidays) for an Executive suite (a massive 70 sq. metres (750 sq ft) of poorly designed room of which a third of the space was corridor with very poor WIFI facility) We requested a bed (before our trip) for our 5 year old but were told that she had to sleep on the small sofa in the room..... NOT even a proper sofa bed. We told them we wanted a proper single bed as supplied by other hotels of a similar and lesser standard. They eventually did supply a bed but "....only as "a favour just for you" (verbatim). The Front Office Manager and Deputy both tried to get us to "upgrade our room" (already one of the highest category) at a "special price of a further 2000 MD " (UK¬£165 per night) ....we normally charge an extra 5000 per night") so we could gain extra space for our daughter. (We had booked for 8 nights costing circa UK¬£4950 (excluding BMI Club Class) The Front Office Manager "accused" us of having booked through Expedia (it would appear that this is the ultimate sin) and then latter apologising for her mistake. It got to the stage where for the very first time in 30 odd years of being an Amex member we telephoned Amex UK to try to sort out this ridiculous situation. Incidentally the hotel on our arrival had only 36 persons staying there so one might have thought that every effort for a full paying guest might have been "de riguer". The restaurant staff (other than the Signature Restaurant) speak the very poorest of English resulting in a totally frustrating experience full of misunderstanding and wrong orders for the 10% (certainly during our internment) of English speaking clientele. The main dining room/breakfast room a poorly designed depressing and sincerely soulless public "airport lounge". The F&B ‚ÄúManager‚Äù had an unenviable job and had been in his post for nearly six months. He didn‚Äôt sound particularly confident that he was going to be there in another 6 months. The kitchen staff were continually shouting at each other. The service around the pool area was poor. One waiter (literally) delivering food around the pool. One day our lunch was delivered "stone cold" with the waiter blaming the 25 metre walk to where we were sitting! Food OK (ish) The two pools (neither young child or "poor swimmer" friendly (1.4 metres min depth) so if you're short even an adult can't touch the floor and have their head above the water. Holes and cracks ( See image...an accident waiting to happen) around the pool. Incidentally on 3 of our 8 days here the hotel "ran out" of the good quality pool towels by 09:30 only to replace them with cheap and threadbare towels that they use in the "5 Star" (see more below) sister hotel. There's a large taxi rank outside the hotel (about 90 second walk down hotel driveway. When you order a taxi one might reasonably expect there to be a "flashing light" system to alert the "next in line" taxi. Not here! The doorman walks to the taxi rank and "handpicks" (I‚Äôll let the reader guess the euphemism".....) your taxi. We understand that the churn rate (turnaround) of "senior" staff is very high. The "3 star guests" staying next door in the sister hotel (Es Saadi Hote.....advertised as 5 star but sincerely 3.5 star max when we inspected it to see if it were any better than the "Palace") used the pool facilities of the "Palace". (Call us snobs but if Iwe are paying top dollar then I don't expect the pool area to be overrun by the 2/3 star guests next door paying half the price or less). The Casino next door is owned by the same family I understand and we popped in to check it out and in the main there were fruit machines in a thick cigarette smoke environment and yoy come out stinking. The Main Square is a 10/12 minute taxi ride....not a 15 minute walk as suggested in literature. Finally lest I be accused of being totally unfair in my review the owner has a sublime collection of Moroccan 20th Century Art which can be viewed on each floor and at the time of our visit was on exhibition.

The palace is an absolutely beautiful hotel. It is the nicest place I have ever stayed. Putting just another 5 star next to this hotel is not giving it enough credit. They did not cut one corner on this place. I just love it here they have a butler at your call and they make up your room twice a day. I honestly could go on and on. Bottom line everything is incredible. Anyone that could think of one bad thing to say about this place is crazy. It's pricey you get what you pay for.

Review_Title: Three Stars for Three Star Service
Review_Text: Perhaps one of the most depressing and disorganised hotels we have stayed at. The service at best was three-star and at worst two-star. The staff did not speak English of an acceptable standard of even a four-star property making it very difficult to communicate. Often no towels by pool. Food at breakfast was very acceptable but more often than not shambolic and understaffed service. The training at this hotel needs desparate attention. Certainly some of the reviews I have read seem "suspect" and certainly do not reflect my experience. (For the avoidance of doubt we stayed at the Es Saadi Palace and not the Hotel of a similar name next door) Certainlythe few English speaking families we met were unanimous in their agreement that they would not return.

Stayed in Es Saadi Palace corner suite- room beautiful not as large as in photos but really lovely. Staff charming welcoming and helpful. Food good slightly limited menu so better for a short trip. Limited children's menu but staff happily adapted dishes from normal menu. Very good stay. Took meals at original hotel make sure you know which accommodation you are booking. Original hotel oridnary but with a retro charm. Spa treatment wonderful. All in all very good if a bit pricey.

Review_Title: Es Saadi good hotel with some shortfalls
Review_Text: I recently stayed at the Es Saadi as a single traveller on a half board basis and although the hotel was of a good standard there were some disappointing features.. On the plus side the staff were very friendly and the room I occupied was clean and maintained to a good standard. The hotel is set in very attractive gardens with lovely flora and because there are very few cats or dogs in Marrakech there are plenty of birds within the grounds. However on the negative side the food was mediocre. For exampleIi chose the fillet of fish one evening and the bone was blooming massive and when I pointed it out to the senior waiter he simply shrugged his shoulders. There may have been a language issue but a massive bone in a fillet of fish does not take a lot of translation!! There was a choice of restaurantsbut the one night me and two other guests decided to try the alternative to the main restaurant we were the only eaters and were outnumbered by about twenty to one. when we asked why there was so few customers rthe waiter explained that in that part of the hotel guests were so exclusive they preferred to eat in their rooms out of site of the public!! needless to say we did not eat there. I would therefore heavily recommend that should you decide to stay at the Es Saadi then choose the bed and breakfast option. Ther are plenty of excellent eating places within wallking distance or a short taxi drive away.

Review_Date: alenka b wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: From the beginning till the end of our stay in Es Saadi everything was more than Excellent
Review_Text: The most beautiful place in the world witch i have ever been.  Service food accomodation and hospitality are on a highest level.All resort is surrounded by old trees you can feel the nature from every part of the resort.  Safe place with beautifull pool and SPA best personal witch take care of every guest 24 hours.    I really recomend to visit Es Saadi palace and resort.

Review_Title: BE VERY CAREFUL - Make sure which property booked - classless owner
Review_Text: There are two completely different hotels on one property. Also be aware that the normal star rating system in Marrakech is not consistent with the rest of the world. This property looked like it would be a nice place to stay. I stayed in the hotel located at the back of the property. Which was disgusting. Make sure you are staying at the palace. The hotel is completely different. I will review the hotel property on the hotel site on tripadvisor. I have read other reviews whom have made the same mistake. I tried meeting with the owner after conferring with tripadvisor after checking in which stated the owner was easy to meet. I was told the owner was hosting guests the night I checked in. For the next 2 days I tried meeting with her to discuss my displeasure and ask to correct the hotel name problem so other guests are not burdened with booking a 5* hotel and getting a run down 3 star hotel. Which by the way guests of each hotel has access to the grounds of the other - odd mix to see the 5 star guests with the families and shenanigans of the 3 star guests. The owner set up an appointment but when I showed up the manager met with me and tried to put me in a suite in the same hotel a bigger lousy room. I wanted to meet with the owner to show her the shower nozzle that fell off in my hands. Before the meeting the owner did not make I asked housekeeping if I could look in my previous room. Sure enough to prove my point the hotel put the shower lever back on without fixing it. I brought it to the meeting with the Owner which she did not attend and the manager grabbed it out of my hands and hid it behind the desk. BE VERY CAREFUL!!!!! Very deceitful people who refuse to correct the confusion the hotel creates by naming two different quality hotels the same name on one property. Who puts customers from a 5 star hotel with a low quality 3 star anyway?

Review_Title: Felt like the angels, in the best heaven's place.
Review_Text: French poet Baudelaire said "Ici tout n'est qu'ordre luxe calme et volupt√©". This is exactly what were my feelings about this hotel. It worth the money it's gorgeous luxury you'll feel like an angel in paradise. If your budget allows it this is "the place" to be.

I have just organised a medical congress in the Es Saadi Palace and stayed for 10 days. It was totally outstanding. The service is second to none the rooms are huge the food phenomenal the gardens and swimming pools are kept in immaculate condition. The new spa is state of the art.  The location is ideal since the complex is secure and self contained but not far from the medina.  I can think of no bad comments and I have been organising conferences for 32 years in five star hotels arond the world.

The Es Saadi Palace was used as a venue for a conference and whilst my other half worked and enjoyed the conference facilities provided by the hotel I enjoyed total luxury for a week. The hotel provides first class accommodation. The staff is multilingual and provides impeccable friendly service. The executive suite was palacial very beautifully decorated in Morrocan style the bathroom most splendid the walk-in cupboard a dream. The hotel and the room were spotless clean.  The welcome plates of fruits and Morrocan sweets were delicious. The superb flower bouquets were changed so often it felt a waste. Petals of roses are decorating the bathroom freshly every day even inside the toilet! Another nice touch is that the hotel slippers are in the shape of local babouches.    The Saadi do not apply yet the policy that all hotels should apply nowadays: to offer the choice of changing towels or not to protect the environment from the chemical of washing powders. It is not clear why the suite (one very large room but one room) had two enormous televisions and it was not possible to swith them completely off they remained on stand by again not environmental friendly.  I had dinner by the pool the restaurant provides very nice dishes in generous portions a mix of international and morrocan cuisine with impeccable service. The room service was very good and timely having breakfast on the terrasse with the birds and the view on the magnificent garden with the lovely fragrance of the orange flowers was an absolute delight.  The swimming pool is immense and spotless clean it divides in two parts with the bar in the middle you can have a drink sitting whilst in the water. The large one is cool at 16 degrees C and the less large one in an oval shaper is warmer. There a many comfortable loungers in the shade or in the sunshine and towels are provided. It is very relaxing and again the staff is helpful professional friendly and discreet.  It is a short walk to the centre of town and the main Square with all the tourist activities but it is quite a walk if you carry shopping (and in Marrakech you will). So you have to be prepared to haggle with the taxi drivers to get you to and from the hotel. Some drivers will ask the standard price others understandably will try to obtain more from the tourists. The economical situation is difficult for everyone and they have to try to get as much as possible from the tourist. Do not hesitate to ask help from the concierges if you have a haggling disagreement with a taxi driver they are very helpful and will listen to both parties very calmly.  I also lunched at the restaurant by the much smaller pool in the older part the non palace hotel Saadi there the food was good with large portion too but the service was mixed. A lot of staff present but don't seem to know what to do or seem to wait instructions from a moody maitre d' hotel instead of doing what they should do: welcome someone quickly with a smile and a menu for example.  The boutiques are difficult to find sort of hidden in the garden they provide the same as the souks at a higher price and surprisingly they sell local fakes of French haute couture bags!  I liked the fact that each suite had a different beautifully crafted door in antique style with a real key not the horrid credit card type of keys that you see so often these days.  If you stay all the time in the Es Saadi Palace you can relax nicely but you will have seen nothing of the real Morroco but for work or as part of a holiday it is very luxury place to stay in.

From the moment we were greeted at the hotel until the last day when we were provided a room to get dressed in our stay was wonderful....absolutely perfect. Such friendly efficient and welcoming staff -made our stay one of the best we have ever had. The food is amazing delicious and beautifully prepared and served. Our Junior Suite was such a pleasure to return to each day. Dont think I have ever had such a brilliant spa treatment before. Will definately come back - preferably sooner than later!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Saadi Hotel Marrakech is the best of the best/vipnh
Review_Text: I must admit I'd carefully reviewed all the hotels and eventually choose to go for the SAADI HOTEL IN MARRAKECH/MOROCCO.2011  The arrival was a mixed experience with a remakably professional staff greeting me at the entrance.  The room was perfect with all the nice touches one may expect spacious clean and with a view to kill for Bathroom was brilliant and the Fitness center was impeccable and the pool was simply splendid.  There was a very nice and romantic touch experience we hadwe were told the king of Morocco is going to pray in Mosk on friday and that so many people will be there to great himit was amazing how people really loves their king heredifferent than in any other arabic country.Best

Review_Title: Great stay at the Es Saadi Palace
Review_Text: We booked 3 nights in February last August and got 3 nights for the price of 2 which was a good deal. The hotel collected us from the airport and the service throughout was excellent. We were given an upgrade to an executive suite which was fantastic with a large balcony with table chairs and 2 sunbeds. The concierge was very helpful and efficient. The heated pool was lovely and the weather was hot so we sat round the pool part of every day. Enjoyable breakfast we sat ourside in the sun and the choice and quality of the food was very good. The Spa is new and lovely too. I found the bed a bit hard but that is personal choice. We have stayed at the Sofitel in Marrakech but overall the Es Saadi Palace is better. This is a good area to stay in as there are nice restaurants and clubs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very warm welcome. Friendly staff. The Palace and the Hotel are separate buildings in the same grounds. Each has their own pool restaurants and bars. Probably about a 15min walk to the main square and souks in Marrakech. Ate in one of the Palace restaurants the first night and it was very good. There is also a casino and nightclub in the grounds but we didn't hear anything even though our room was very close. Stayed in a junior suite in the Palace and the room was excellent with terrace 4 poster bed and big bathroom. Only complaint is that the aircon didn't work very well. Kept forgetting to tell reception but as it was winter it wasn't really a problem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a family-owned hotel with the family discreetly in residence. There is therefore constant supervision and this is reflected in top quality long stay staff who are both friendly and efficent. The extensive gardens are a delighf and you could spend many wonderful days here without even going into Marrakech. The food is excellent especially breakfast outside in the jardin d'hiver and at the poolside restaurant.. We stayed in the older European-style hotel although there is a stunning newer Moroccan style part next to the Casino and fabulous individual villas with their own pools for honeymooners or those well-heeled ones with a romantic inclination. Definitely a place to go back to and excellent value for moneey.

I stayed with my family at Es Saadi Palace for eleven nights. The Es Saadi Palace is lovely - everything is just right the great location the beautiful garden the relaxing pool area the excellent fresh food in all their Food and Beverage outlets and the perfect service. I believe it's the latter that really sets it apart from other hotels. A special thanks to Mr.Yanis Laboureau Food and Beverage Manager Mrs Fatiha Soulaimi at Reservation and Maria at Housekeeping. The rooms were very large comfortable and spotlessly clean. I did like their unique Moroccan bathroom products. Overall it's a lovely Hotel/Palace and a great place to stay when in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Marie-Laure S wrote a review Aug 2010
Review_Text: Es saadi palace is a great place to stay and rest. Very quiet great service at any time of the day and night. Rooms are very comfy and the bathroom is the prettiest i've ever seen !! also lots of things to do around : walking in the beautiful park gambling at the casino playing tennis resting at the spa... and last but not least that's the best place in Marrakech to eat !!

Review_Title: It was the best hotel during our trip in Morocco, however is was not great value for money !
Review_Text: It was a comfortable stay.The staff was welcoming. The service was good. The room was very comfortable. Found the breakfast good. Overall  while the service and facilities were good the value for money equation was not that good!

At Euro 700+ a night you get b/fast in a seemingly make-shift room with a spread that even a Best Western can better two 200ml bottles of water in the room (anything more U gotta pay) conccierge service that's more reactive than proactive uninspirational decor....one helluva let down.

Review_Title: The scent of orange blossom and feeling of well-being stays with you for a long time after a stay at the Palace
Review_Text: Amazing things about Es Saadi Palace -  Every little need has been considered - beautiful spacious rooms and bathrooms with large fluffy towels and peppered with fresh rose petals  Friendly and willing staff with a culture where they like to please  Really good tasty food prepared daily with lovely fresh ingredients  Massage therapists who will transport you to another world  The best poolside beds to fall asleep in

We spent a week here over the Easter break and I have to say it ticked every box.We were looking for a hotel that we could relax around a beautiful pool and feel pampered in the sunshine but near enough to the Medina for a different experience when we needed it.This hotel definitely provided us with that.The hotel service was impeccable at the restaurantsat receptionat the concierge table and housekeeping was outstanding.  The rooms were extremely comfortable and I really do miss the exceptional bed and pillows.There was a very large bathroom with a massive shower and a massive bath along with some exquisite complimentary toiletries.We never had an issue trying to get a sunbed for 4 of us and they too were very comfortable.The towels were provided and the pool men were willing to jump up and help at any point with moving umbrellas or providing dry towels.We ate mostly at the poolside restaurant where the food quality was excellent and really not overly expensive. You can walk to the Medina in about 10 minutes and it really felt very safe.In fact we never once felt threatened by the local people and they were all extremely friendly and welcoming.  If we visit Marrakech again we certainly wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Es Saadi Palace again.

Very friendly people luxury rooms and a lot of lovely details. Very good restaurants top service quality life music entertainment tranquil gardens and a very impressif and relaxing pool area (2400 m¬≤ surface!). I liked the casino nearby and ‚Äì of course ‚Äì the Theatro a nightclub you would either expect in Los Angeles London or Paris‚Ä¶ very trendy!

I spent 5 nights in Es Saadi Palace in November 2009 and overall - it is a great hotel: good location nice big bedrooms very clean (they clean replace towels etc. several times a day). Also very good breakfast and excellent Moroccan restaurant upstairs. Pool is very clean as well so overall - great experience. However there was still one thing that was very disappointing - the air conditioning. Everything was working fine during the first night. After that the air conditioning in the hotel was switched off centrally and no matter what you did to the switch in the room - didn't help. It even made you wonder why you have it in the room if it's no use. It was quite warm for November - about 28-30 degrees but the hotel wouldn't swich air conditioning on due to "winter time and people being cold". One night I woke up and discovered that the heating was on (with +18..20 degrees outside)! After four conversations with housekeeping they eventually switched the heating off but refused to turn air conditioning on and offerred me a fan (or two!) instead - and this is in a 400+ Euro a night hotel probably one of the most expensive in Marrakech. So I had to sleep with my windows open which added quite a bit of noise. My colleagues who I was travelling with were complaining about the same thing - so can't say it was just me.    Other than this issue everything else was great.

We spent 5 nights at the Es Saadi Palace and were very impressed with the room and the service. The room was spacious and comfortable with a great view from the balcony. The service was great. Our luggage did not arrive with us and when we checked in we told the conceirge. He assured he would take care of it and when we returned from dinner he told us the bags were in our room. The location is a short walk from the madina and the hotel provides a relaxing oasis. We really enjoyed walking around the madina in the morning returning to the hotel and spending time by the pool in the afternoon and then returning to the madina in the evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Es Saadi Palace (next to the Es Saadi Hotel but a lot better so careful when booking) for a long week-end in July with our three children. We selected this hotel as we wanted to have a nice swimming pool to relax in the afternoons (absolutely necessary if you have children as visiting the city in the morning with the heat is enough) close to the Medina. So we did not want to go to any of the hotels in La Palmeraie and waste time in taxis and the only other choice was Les Jardins de La Koutoubia which has a much smaller pool (try this hotel if you are without children otherwise stay away).  The simming pool is HUGE and we were not disappointed by the hotel ammenities. We were updgraded to an executive suite which was very nice (ask for it when you check in as they are not full at all). The staff is very helpull. We had a very nice dinner at the Cour des Lions restaurant. It's worth it.  Also  - if you are planning to visit the souks for the first time having a guide is a must to avoid wasting time and making sure you are not missing anything. we had a great time with the hotel's guide Mohammed  - we were able to add extra beds for our three children (369) in our suite at no cost  - check their website for photos of the hotel and special offers  We had a very relaxing stay and recommend the Palace especially for families

Review_Title: Pure luxury and class in the heart of chaotic, but so romantic Marrakech !
Review_Text: Marrakech is one of my favorit destinations and i have to say it's also thanks to this hotel.  It's an oase of repose in the middle of a lively chaotic city.  Everything but really everything is perfect. Couldn't mention one bad or minor mark.  It's not cheap but you get value for every cent you spend.  This is definitaly the most prestigious hotel of the city. Have stayed at La Mamounia La Sultana (small luxury hotels of the world) but not one can match to the quality style charme and romance of "Es Saadi Palace"  Already dying to go back in june !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stunning in every way luxurious and comfortable.
Review_Text: We stayed 5 nights and loved this hotel. It is ideally placed for visiting everything in Marrakech. Very easy to get into the Medina (a cheap taxi ride) or 10 minutes walk. There are really good restaurants nearby if you do not want to go into the Medina. It is a beautiful hotel with a stunning swimming pool (one part heated for cooler weather). The Junior Suit was extremely comfortable with the largest marble bathroom I have ever seen. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in. Breakfast is good and can be taken in your room. Wonderful views of the Atlas mountains from your bed. Service was impeccable and the staff could not have done more to help us. Do take a city tour with one of the guides they will arrange it for you at short notice if necessary and it is not expensive. We loved The Palace Es Saadi and could not recommend it more hightly. The only problem is that only a few people were staying when we were there and it would have felt more inviting with a greater number of guests. I can reccomend you stay at this hotel and you can find some really good rates on the internet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
